name: Savannah Rose
text: This post office is amazing!! I run a small business and live closer to the slocomb post office than Dothan, even though Dothan is my home post office. I can’t comment as far as mail delivery BUT I drop packages off here sometimes because of convenience and they always get scanned out on time. The employees are kind and seem like they actually care. I haven’t experienced that with other post offices. THANK YOU SLOCOMB POST OFFICE!!

name: G Bullard
text: Kisha and Miranda are very knowledgeable and always helpful.  Thank you ladies.

name: Titus Prevatt
text: I was expecting a letter from overseas.  The letter was sent with the wrong zip code and I was afraid we might never see this letter.  I talked with Keisha, at the Slocomb post office,  about the matter.  She took down the information and stayed on top of this  for me, tracking the letter as it made it's way through the system.    The USPS could use more employees like Keisha and more post offices like the Slocomb Post Office.

name: Elizabeth Peavey
text: Very friendly and ready to help with anything you might need. Keisha is a very kind person. She always has a smile and a helping hand.

name: Cathy Solis
text: The personnel here in Slocomb are kind & helpful. It is always a pleasure to be in their presence.

name: 2 Tall Ted Lynn
text: well i just got off the phone with a lady from here and she was so nice told me everything would need and that if my wife was over my ssi she can do it all for me so i don't  have to get out in this hot air so she on her way i hope that when she gets there that she gets the same lady i talked to and everything works out ok in need of the money big time got put out of my home after i paid the rent and all the bills so plz help us

name: Tommie Hardy
text: I must say the last time I visited this store the woman behind the counter was rude and disrespectful to me and wouldn't let me send an money gram. The customer service skills here is aweful. I will never bring my business to this location or any other EasyMoney store in Birmingham!

name: Gay Allen
text: Very helpful staff.

name: I.O.U
text: Never to busy excellent customer service

name: Rena Cosby
text: Let me tell you about Abbeville,Alabama  mail carriers  Angela Nell is mine and she goes beyond her job title she is a caring considerate person and will help her residents. Also there are a lot more carriers that care such as Kendra Fleming who always has a smile on her face Cody Young is a fine young man so Abbeville is blessed to have these carriers with a kind ❤

name: Melissa Hix
text: Tired of my pickup requests not being honored 😡 in addition to some packages not be delivered to me on time when they arrive in Abbeville with enough time to be delivered that day... But multiple times I've had packages that were time sensitive where i requested a pickup the next day and had my packages out and ready to just be ignored by the carrier. It was the last straw today when the carrier came up to the house to deliver some packages, sat them down NEXT TO the packages I had put out for pickup and then he turned around and left, leaving my packages! 😡 Now my packages are going to be late, and for a small business that I do from my home, that does not look good. Time to get it together Abbeville! When yall start acting like a REAL post office, the review will change..

name: Jeremy Moore
text: The only reason this USPS is getting any stars more than 1 is because the lady who delivers my mail is very kind. The gentleman I spoke to on the phone today I believe he said his name was Brett. I called this morning from Georgia, unaware of the timezone change. I place my phone on speaker while it rang 9 minutes before they opened because I was at work. The phone rang for 51 seconds before someone picked up and hung up. I thought it was an honest mistake. I called back, this is when someone picks up immidiately to quickly respond with a long phrase to which is was unintelligible but the end of the sentence was "we open at 9 okay bye", with no time to even apologize for not realizing the time difference. I call back at 1001 eastern time now being that it is 901 in alabama, same guy answers. I asked him if he was the gentleman I had recently spoken too? He immidiately gets defensive and says we were not open you need to call back at 9 when we open, to which I replied it is 901. He proceeds to attempt to rush me off the phone to get back to loading packages. He is clearly upset with how the 9 minutes prior to this call has gone. I was calling to ask to have my packages held at the location because of how many will be coming in between now and Friday so as to not inconvenience them with a large amount of packages over a few days. Due to him being immediately cynical of how he assumed I was just being annoying with the phone ringing "50 times" in his words,, which when would it ever be justifiable to answer and hang up? I'm just going to call back? Why be so negative? I was trying to do you a favor. My packages left the carrier facility at 647 this morning in abbeville, I live 6 minutes away by car. It is 607 at night. Still hasn't arrived. Thats okay. I really hope you can have a better day tomorrow brett, and not assume everyone is trying to do bad and wrong.

name: Mary Suarez
text: The ladies who work here are always ready to help and sweet as can be

name: Mike Allen
text: This place of "business" is a joke. I spoke with a woman on the phone today and she was possibly one of the rudest people I've ever dealt with. Zero customer service skills. She is a prime example of why the United States Postal Service is a failing business. Use UPS or FedEx.

name: Jon Lynn
text: Have not gotten medication from the VA this month. Said it was delivered when it was tracked.  As for many other medicines that come in bottles.

name: Ambitious 575
text: Horrible customer service as the other reviewers have pointed out. I took a package in with a UPS label because they exchange packages with each other and I was immediately insulted. If I can find company policy on the internet why don't they know it behind the register? It is unfortunate because people in professional positions are so quick to insult people as if they're not representing a brand. The USPS is always in a financial crisis it seems.......maybe if they take a look inside they'll see why people would rather spend their money elsewhere.

name: Shaniqua Davis
text: This post office has the most rudest employees I have ever met in my life. They need to go ahead a retire this staff and start over fresh. I hate this post office with a passion.

Some people left bc it was so slow. I am never going to this post office, next time I'll go to the other one by Wells Fargo and Goodwill. Also, I believe that if this post office is so slow and busy, maybe they should have 2 people working in the front.

text: Needed to overnight an envelope to Albuquerque, NM. The woman was very helpful. Told me which envelope and address label I needed.

Brianna has always made me feel welcome & makes the process so easy. She needs a raise & a promotion, but PLEASE LEAVE HER IN SPRINGVILLE!!

resp.text: Hi Phillip, we apologize about your experience at our Phenix City location. We will be happy to service your WU needs there, and if you run into any issues while attempting to do so in the future, please feel free to contact the District Manager over that area at 205-739-9870 and he will be glad to assist. Hope this helps!

text: just awful staff.. Where did you hire these people?

name: Robbie Bradford
text: To begin , our carrier delivers mail to us that belongs to other people almost weekly. I’ve had to give packages to my neighbors myself because our carrier is so inept.  Secondly , I received a text message saying that They had attempted to deliver my package at 7:12 PM but  my text was received at 5:39 PM making it impossible for them to be telling the truth. In my opinion the carrier was just too lazy to deliver my package and insisted on me having to drive to my local post office and pick up my package. This is absolutely ridiculous.

name: Gary Harper
text: Teller was helpful had to send a money order. Always helpful.

name: Cheryl Gatlin
text: Called to ask if I could pick up my package since I will be at work when it goes out for delivery tomorrow. Simple yes or no question. Chastity/Cassidy? Something like that. Was very very very rude. I work in customer service. There is no reason whatsoever to be so rude and condescending towards someone asking you a simple question. I understand it's the holidays, believe me, I work in a large retail store, but that was just uncalled for. USPS needs to be hiring some more professional employees that know how to speak to their customers.

name: Joe and Angela Eustice
text: I put in a change of address here.They are returning all my mail as decrease unable to forward return to sender . I have been in this post office alot and they are lazy and don't know how to do there job . I'm will be calling the main office and complaining.  Guess what Im not dead 😂 .  This post office needs employee number that know how to follow directions .

text: They are such clowns.  Don't ever let Amazon send you something for Sunday delivery - they don't do their job.  They act like they either attempted it or even mark falsely as delivered.

text: Helpful her they could use some extended hours

name: John Hardin
text: 9am and no one here at the post office so I can pick up package

name: Danielle theHanyo
text: I love this place. The employees are always very helpful and we've never really had any problems with anything at all. We end up coming in fairly regularly too and mailing out a ton of mail all over the world and the closest thing to a problem was a mix up on an address to Austria (the guy thought it was supposed to go to Australia) and it took us a moment to catch it too so like... Not a big deal. We caught it in time and beyond that every time we've gone it's been a good experience. I wouldn't say fun exactly but I don't dread going there and the wait time is never over 10 minutes when they're crowded.

name: Pamela Pugh
text: I had a seller mail a package in a flat rate box and only paid for 1 ounce so additional money was due, the Postmaster Greg hand delivered me this package and did not send it back even though he could have chosen that route. I live 10 miles from post office so this shows the character that our Jasper, Alabama Postmaster has, He cares about people and our mail! Thank you GREG for your generosity and going beyond your job duties!

name: Misti Estes
text: The postal workers are very helpful. Always greet there patrons with How can I help you and Thank you at the end. Very knowledgeable of rules and regulations. Most of the office workers have worked there for several years.

name: Patti Griffith
text:
The employees are always nice and helpful. Service is very fast, usually at least three clerk's are
working at a time. You can get all
your shipping material here, nice greeting cards, gift cards to almost anything you want, and Jasper, Alabama United States
Postal always has a great
variety of postage stamps. 💯

name: A JRuck
text: They are always super friendly and keep things running. For the amount of packages I receive, I never have any problems.

name: Mecachu 64
text: Absolutely AWFUL!!! I've always taken my prepaid packages to Carbon Hill and they were sent out perfectly, Jasper's employees on the other hand came up with every excuse in the book on why they couldn't mail my package (the USPS tape can't be accepted, the box size, the label, literally anything). Today I take the same package to CH and it's mailed off with no problem, also found out the employees at Jasper LIED, there was nothing wrong with the box or the label and the tape is THE ONLY TAPE USPS CAN ACCEPT!!! Getting things mailed off at Jasper would be a lot easier if the employees would want to do their job instead of being lazy. From now on when staying in Jasper I'll just make a longer trip to CH where the employees actually know what they are doing!

name: Kiley Smith
text: Need a proper contact number and not this automated junk..been trying for over 30 minutes just to try an get a person.

name: Sandra Courington
text: Most friendly and helpful post office in our area!!

name: Kelleigh Killingsworth
text: Very helpful and sweet ladies working here. They even helped me wrap the china I was shipping when I said I was in a hurry!

name: Margaret Spears
text: JASPER POST OFFICE-Southern Hospitality At It's Best.

name: Samson Kirby
text: This is the 2nd time that my paycheck has been delivered to someone else's address!! How about hiring people who actually want to do their job!

name: Kristopher McGregor
text: This postal service is full of idiots, i have had 5 total packages lost by them, Tracked them all the way to Jasper and the Jasper Post officer either loses them or misdelivers them. 1 of them was even my Check. I hate living in a town where most elementary school kids could deliver the post more accurately than them.

name: Avis Hudson
text: The employees for the most part are very helpful and knowledgable.

name: Jessica pittman
text: Worst service I have ever received. Their mailman Bryan put down that he delivered two of our packages in a mailbox (which we do not have a mailbox) and then tries to say that he delivered it to someone at our kiosk. I've spoke to every employee and no one has received either package! Our customers are steaming mad Bc their products have not come in so I called the office and spoke to a woman named Cindy I believe which was very rude and said that she talked to a female that said she claimed that she received the part and that she thought she had misplaced it. Funny thing is is I am the only female working here and I received no calls. I asked Cindy who this persons name was and she couldn't remember apparently. She also said that Bryan said he may have dropped it off at the store beside us that he couldn't remember. I've spoke to the owner the manager and the employees and they all said that they never received our package and that none of them have received a phone call from her. I figured it may have been the mall manager so I called her, nope not her either. I asked for some kind of proof that it was delivered and they could not give me any form of proof, I asked why he documented that it was delivered to a mailbox and he was saying he delivered it to us (why is the documentation off u know) and she said oh well they sometimes accidentally push the wrong button and file it wrong. So on top of them losing two of our packages and lying to us and having false documentation they are now saying that they are not gonna reimburse us for any of our packages they have lost. And because we now have to order another product AGAIN FOR THE THIRD TIME we will now be losing money from our business, the customers are steaming mad, and they have made business very difficult and we no longer trust them. Keep in mind my owners do business for 46 franchises and they are still growing! They have agreed that we will never be using USPS again. Their service is awful and I'll be so happy to know that I will never have to deal with them again!

name: Shannon Michelle Clark
text: I had loooong help n she was grrrrrrrreat!!!!!!!

text: Love this post ... Not a long line no waste of time!

name: Art Of Valor
text: From what I've read, the first Piedmont, Alabama post office was resurrected in the mid 1800's. This building is very old but has been remodeled and kept up well over the years. Always enjoyed the atmosphere here.

name: Krystal Moore
text:
Most of the clerk's are just fine.
Shelia ruins it for the whole post, though. She never wears her mask properly. She is ALWAYS rude and short with customers that she doesn't know or who aren't overly friendly with her. We've watched her bully and talk down to many customers over the years...she has no business working with the public.
I'm leaving a review now because things seem to be getting worse. I recently witnessed Shelia checking a customer out, and insinuating to another employee that bad things happen to some people's packages. Obviously the customers in line would assume that she was referring to the package that she was currently processing.
We have never had a problem with our delivery...just our encounters with Shelia. She should not work with the public.

name: Pam Love
text: You pay outrageous prices for 2 day service and it takes 5 days for delivery and even with that they still didnt deliver. I am noy sending anything else USPS. I could walk and deliver it in person faster. Then you go to post office for a refund only to have to stand and wait for 2 hours because the post master has left for lunch at 2p and there are not sure the postmaster is even coming back to finish the day. If you cant overnight or express mail then its quite simply take it down until you can do your jobs. While I was at the,post office several people came in to send mail express. They gladly take your money knowing they cant deliver like they are paid to do. I am very 😡 with the service I received while there the anger and smart comments were uncalled for.

name: indrid cold
text: Shelia is very rude and not cut out to work with the public. Shipping is horrible even before covid. The Post office is a waste of tax payers money imo.

name: Karen Towne
text: The two clerks ( blonde and brunette) were working when I stopped by and they were very nice. They answered my questions and helped me with my packages. Really liked the building also, pretty old but clean. Definitely will go back!

name: Terry Smart
text: There was only one clerk working up front when I went so it’s understaffed. There was a loud older lady eating at a table, while the clerk that helped me was doing everything else. However, the clerk that helped me was very friendly. I asked about the flag and a woman in the back came up and talked to me and my wife. Other than the very loud woman, it was a pleasant experience.

name: Cindy Kohl
text: I usually have good things to say about folks but the new mail carrier on my route is LACKING. My mail is left with my neighbors mail in their boxes at times. Not always, mind you, just sometimes. And Why is it that our carrier will leave 2 out of 3 packages stuffed inside our jumbo box, and take the 3rd back with him causing Amazon to notify me that the carrier COULD NOT MAKE IT TO MY DOOR to leave my package and that I must contact the carrier to track it down?? My front door is about a hundred or so yards from my  mailbox & the carrier has left packages at my front door before numerous times. However,  yesterday he could not. I called the Post Office, spoke with the supervisor on June 11, 2019, tried to find out where my package was like Amazon told me to do, and  after a brief hold was told shortly & quickly the carrier will bring my package out today and the call was disconnected. How rude.  Why was it not left yesterday with the other two packages that WERE delivered?? Were there dragons in my driveway he just could not overcome??  And for over a month now, for some reason when the carrier tries to leave my mail the door on my mailbox decides to attack and tears itself from the box and flings itself into the ditch. My husband has tried to force it to stay by installing new rivets to hold the door on the box on (2) two separate occasions. We have finally stepped up to using bolts to fasten the door to the box. We sincerely hope this will stop our wayward mailbox from acting so rudely to our mail carrier. Hopefully this will help encourage our carrier to know we care about our mail and packages and appreciate him doing the same. He can leave our packages at our door anytime. 😊

name: Donna Hill
text: Every time I have been in this post office or my granddaughter the lady is very rude & ugly. It’s a shame to go in for something & be treated so rude. If you work with the public you should be nicer. I think that old lady needs to retire or get a job that’s nit around the public. We the customers don’t deserve to be treated so ugly.

text: Been coming here for 2 years on and off the open at 10 am and are closed 4 out if 5 times I come  between 1 pm and 3 pm  apparently very understaffed  and today the girl at the counter  when I showed up at 1:30 said she was closed for lunch until 2:15  over the years I've been told they are closed from 230 to 330 to pickup kids from school closed from 1 to 2 for lunch   closed from 2 to 3 to pickup kids from school  seems like when  you open after most people go to work and close before the rest get off of work you'd focus on having enough staff to stay open the full 8 hours of your business day came back by at 2:50  and they are still closed

name: Rica Turner
text: I just went in the post office around 20 minutes ago, and the lady working the front desk was extremely rude. Now I stood in line and watched her give everyone else man that they haven’t received due to it getting sent back, but when it was my turn she was very rude. I told her that my check supposed to been mailed to my address on the 26th so told me no it said they’ll go out on the 26th now remind you it’s customers in the lobby. I asked if she could check she told me no and that they haven’t gotten any checks today and I said well I just wanted to be sure she said like I said it don’t suppose to come to your house on the 26 it get mailed out I told her she wasn’t the IRS she got smart and started something as I walking out but that was very unprofessional.

text: Drove nine miles to get to post office by 1:00. Got to post office at 12:53, (they close at 1:00) and they won’t let me in, because “she’s going to lunch at one”. I agree the person deserves their lunch hour, but closing for lunch is BS in my opinion. Someone other than one person should be able to mail a package, rather than having to come back at their connivence. Change your business hours if your not going to let anyone in, especially if their there before “closing time”.

name: RedHotCole 35
text:
UPDATE: Now they are not even delivering my packages to my door or the mailroom, instead they have given them to an "agent" for final delivery! I did not authorize anyone to receive my package!!!

They refuse to deliver my packages after clubhouse business hours! My apartment door is easily accessible since the hallway is open air if for some reason they they get in the mailbox. Now they are saying I requested my package be held at the post office, when I did not! Lazy lazy lazy. If they have access to the mailboxes, they have access to the package lockers. It's ONLY when my package is delivered in the evening too. Absolutely pathetic. I've lived in multiple different states, counties, and housing options without ever having issue with package delivery. Worst service I've ever had.

name: Kirk Maddox
text:
Don't trust that your packages will be scanned so they can be tracked.

Many times the substitute drivers do not scan the packages I send to my Ebay customers,,, I have complained so many times in person and calls and emails.. I have been informed more than once that drivers would be trained and reprimanded and their actions corrected but that has either not happened or has already been forgotten.
If you have a package whose tracking information must be shared with a customer, be sure to go through the inconvenience of driving the package down to this post office in person so you can get a receipt after the scan it at the desk.  We  have never had an issue with our regular route driver.
Do not trust these critical packages to any sub drivers who are supposed to scan every package the second they pick them up from your mailbox...

name: Randy Lee
text:
I use this post office a couple times a week for business and personal purposes. I wanted to take a moment to just say THANK YOU to all of the postal workers here - especially PEGGY - who is usually manning the front desk when I visit. Peggy is always gracious, helpful and professional. I truly appreciate her taking the time to treat me like a customer. I can tell she enjoys her job and makes the most of her interactions with the public. I know it is easy to forget when people do their job well, because that is what we expect - but I just wanted to pause and say thanks Peggy for caring. I hope God blesses you... and maybe your bosses too. You deserve it.
-Randy Lee
Middle Man Enterprises
Host of the Flipping Genius podcast

name: Bee Bee
text: I was standing in line, behind another family, waiting to be seen because they only allow one person in at a time to be helped. A gentleman came out of the room, and said “we are closing at 11 for lunch, I didn’t realize the time.” No offense, but how is that our problem? They should have helped us since we were waiting in line BEFORE 11, and THEN closed for lunch! Soooo irritating!!! SUCH BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

text: Well, if the worker is unhappy having to scan submitted multiple packages, then why is she working there. Retired already. I never like going to this office but it's the only nearby postal services.

text:
Had one manilla envelope  to mail tax info to my accountant,  been driving to Hughes road  P. O. ,but decided to use this one.
Thought the cluttered isolated space was packed with three of us.
One gentleman  had several small packages  to send, handling each, pricing,payment of each took her forever.
People outside waiting to get in the tiny space, paid my three to four
dollar  fee and left the bldg.  Only thirty  minutes to handle three people
,mistakes not included.
Hughes Rd. P. O. IS not that far away. No wonder  the system is losing money.😣

name: Kathy Strickland
text: I have always loved using this Post Office.  Very friendly.

name: Billy Pettinger
text: This month I have spent close to $3000 at USPS. This is the closest post office to my house, but I would rather drive 20 minutes out of the way so that I don’t have to deal with this lady. Today I only had a couple of things to ship so I thought I would make an exception. Once again, she just flat out refused to ship something stating that she couldn’t get the label on the package. I ship this kind of stuff all the time so when she said are you going to go home and repackage it, I said honestly? I’m just gonna drive down the street where they’re going to put the label here and here. She acted like I was speaking some kind of alien language and as she handed me my change I told her how much I spent at the post office that month and how I drive out of the way because people don’t seem to wanna help me here. She couldn’t have cared any less.

name: Vibes
text: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Tried to ship something off today and the guy would not help me because my stuff wasn't already in a box ready to go and kept taking other customers in front of me when only one person was supposed to be in there at a time. GET IT TOGETHER!

text: I have been coming to this little Post Office for three years now and I love it. One, it opens at 8 AM. Two, typically, I am in and out. Three - I do not understand the comments about rude service for I have had nothing but great service and the  people there are just plain nice. I suspect if someone had to wait, or were running late, or something of that nature, they might check their attitude first.

name: Frank Bell
text: I returned my cell phone for an upgrade via Capshaw's Post Office and it took 1 1/2 weeks for the package to get scanned in at the Birmingham distribution facility. I expected the package to be scanned the next day! I would assume it was possibly  misplaced at the Capshaw post office. Yet, the tracking number would have revealed it as missing and appropriate action to locate the item should have been exercised immediately!

name: Shannon
text: Lady is always rude.  Used a little bit of the tape from the tape gun, on the counter because envelope wasn't sticking properly and she ended up making me send it priority mail due to using a little teeny tiny piece.  Postal offices are Government offices, so why is it they can open and close with their own hours?  Its a Government office and should have the same hours as every other post office.  Open for 6 hours and 45 minutes exactly and the person needs a full hour for lunch.  Most places ppl only get a half hour for every 4 hours that you work and she is definitely is not  school aged.  But okay I guess the lady gets what she wants so she doesn't go postal on them!  But yes she is very rude. Not just to me but also with the ppl I have had in front of me and not just 1 time either, every time I have gone in there (about 5 times).  Not gonna just make it up for no reason!

name: Philip Campbell
text: The woman ( Yes we all know who I am talking about) needs to go to some classes on how to treat people. Dont get a job as a public servant if you dont know how to deal with the public. Very unprofessional and rude, she doesnt deserve her job.

name: Local Customer LC

Today is Thursday so 3 days should be ample time. She told me my ONLY option was overnight for $26. There was no 2 or 3 day option?? $26 to mail a $50 gift card  is crazy... there are other options she just didnt care to tell me.

text:

Late packages are common with them. Even if it says it’s out for delivery, don’t get too excited
Because 9 times out of 10 it will end up right back at the post office inconveniently so you have to go out of your way to pick it up.

Why just because I want to do a payday loan that I have to be pushed off because there are people that has came in the store. Poor excuses for a store.

text: I never get my mail. I even had to get informed delivery because people said they were sending things and I never received it. I Dont even get the items that show on informed delivery now too. It said my stimulus check came and never received it. I don't know where it's disappearing to but I even spoke to the postmaster Jeremy and still not getting what I am supposed too.

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text: Awesome most of the time, Christmas is crazy. And so is April 15th. Building is classic with a grand entrance and plenty of stairs so it can take an effort to get into.

text: Jackie was very kind, knowledgeable, and helpful. She helped me with all my needs, and more. Thank you Jackie!

name: Richard Sporn
text: Only shoals area post Ill goto anymore. Always helpful, fast and friendly!

name: Kelly Brown
text: They don’t know how to answer the phones at this post office.  We could all be productive if we didn’t answer the phone to take care of customer needs!  Teach them some phone etiquette and manners please!

name: sherrie gordon
text:
Yesterday I had a package they did not deliver to me. There are lockers at my apartment complex for big packages and the mailman was too sorry to put it in there. Instead he said customer refused and returned it to the post office.
Another time the mailman was so incompetent that he delivered my package to ninth floor, I live on the fifth floor. Thank goodness the person was honest and gave me my package. The address was plain to see. So it was the carriers fault.

name: Law Offices
text: Where do I start with our carrier, Andy Bauscher?!! He's seriously the greatest person I have ever met. He does his job so well. He's a hard worker and cares about the people on his route! Always comes in with a smile, jokes and charm. Andy always makes sure we are taken care of, along with our neighbors! He's very genuine and you can tell he takes pride in his work. So refreshing to see a good work ethic. He's our go to mailman! Thanks for all that you do Andy! I hope we are just as much of a delight as you are to us!

name: Travis
text: Worst service I have ever had. Not only is the main office a joke, its almost impossible to get a hold of them. Our driver (Even after being reported multiple times) Continues to lie about being able to deliver packages. Today, she dropped off one of my 2 packages, and because she forgot the second on her truck, she marked it as "Animal Interference" , instead of just coming back to deliver it. I watched her walk back to her truck and I came out the door as she was pulling out of the drive... No animals anywhere! The one package she did deliver she left at the side of the house on top of our trash!! yet marked delivery as "at front door / under porch".. This has been happening for years... Pathetic excuse of a USPS.

name: BETH COTTLES
text:
The guys at the post office are always friendly and helpful when I stop by to Mail my Ebay packages.
Andy Bausher delivers Mail to the office I work in and he is a pleasure to do business with!
He always has a smile on his face and he makes sure our packages are handled with care.
It's refreshing to see someone take such pride in their job and enjoy what they do. We need more Andys in this world.

name: Beverly Armstead Sparks
text: I actually love my local usps.  They are fast and super friendly.  I actually find it a joy to go there.  Parking is usually decent.  They are very helpful if you have a question and need information about anything.

name: Brad Nichols
text: When you must go inside the main post office for counter service, If at all possible avoid having Mr Woods wait on you. This is the rudest person I have ever experienced there. He needs some major customer service lessons especially working with the public the way he does. I hate giving a 1 star because of the one person because everyone else is nice and pleasant to work with.

name: Jamie Roberson
text: We have a business that needs our mail delivered on a regular basis. Our normal mail carrier, Andy Bauscher, is excellent at providing that service not only in a timely manner but always with an upbeat attitude and charming personality. He will go above and beyond to make sure that our office is provided outstanding services and we truly appreciate him! With that being said I am writing this review because when Andy is not delivering our mail nothing is done right! We haven't received mail since last Wednesday because our office was closed for the 4th of July holiday and over the weekend. So yesterday, Monday we should've had tons of mail, most of which is time-sensitive. But Andy was off work yesterday and whoever his stand-in that covers his route didn't even bother to come by our office at all! This is a common occurrence. So if the Post Master is going to have someone cover Andy's routes the least they could do is make sure that his stand-in is half as good as Andy! We need our mail!!!

name: Ima Acehole
text: Mr. Woods clearly discriminates against female customers. While I had to wait for him to finish his long conversations with two male customers ahead of me whom he greeted with "Hey buddy!", when I got to his window, there was no greeting and he said my package had to be "wrapped" because it had one small mark on the lower corner from it's original shipment. I asked if I could just mark through it and he said "Nope! Wrap it! Next!". He SHOVED my package out to me followed with "Hey, man, how are you?" to the next MALE customer. This man had a flat -flat rate mailing envelope stuffed full of clothing to the point it would not close. This was not a padded envelope - this was one of the flat cardboard ones which is supposed to hold FLAT paper mail ONLY. But instead of rejecting his, he said "Here, buddy, let me tape this up for you."  Ridiculous. And I have seen him treat other women the same way. This is the 6th package he has not accepted from me. I have taken all 6 to the other post office in North Florence or brought them back the next day and got a different window clerk and had NO problem mailing them whatsoever - and I had not made one single change to the package!!! It is very clear that he makes up his own rules and has issues with women. Especially white women. I plan on filing a formal complaint and urge other women to do the same if you have been treated with discrimination in his line.

name: G A
text: Wish I could give ZERO stars. One guy at desk is great. Other guy is always rude. I had an issue and even showed them the postal regulations. The post master on site said "I don't care what they say, this is MY post office and I will run it how I want!" Today I tried to send a letter back via reply mail in the envelope that was provided which had a tracking label. I was told it was illegal and it would not be tracked. Each time I tried to explain it was the envelope provided to me, it got worse. To the point the guy was yelling and told me to get out and never come back.

name: Laura Hill
text: Moved from Florence and left a forwarding address, a package ended up getting returned to sender and then shipped back to Florence. I called and the gentleman I spoke with was incredibly friendly and helpful and even overnighted my package to me! Great experience, and never had any issues in the 5 years I lived there.

name: Dawn Buttrum
text: For a week now mailman has gone passed my house!!

name: Richard Blue
text: How does one rate the phone experience minus 100?  I am positive that by not being able to speak with a human it will create hours of extra work for the post office and frustration on my part.  What are they afraid of by not having a local phone number.

name: Janice Coil
text: Disappointed with the mail service.  I didn't get 2 out of 3 of my sons Christmas cards from Michigan.  They had gift cards in them and had sent them 2 weeks ago.  It's in the New Year already.  They are not happy about me not getting their gifts.  I had problems last year which was my first year here in Florence, Alabama.  It also took 3 weeks for 2 of my sons to get their packages and I sent them before Thanksgiving.  Something is fishy.  Where are my son's mailed cards?  I told them not to send anything by mail like a gift card any more to Florence, Alabama

name: Matt Daemond
text: Terrible service. Use UPS or something else. They have misplaced my packages 3 out of 4 times and blamed me for it. They refuse to improve or do anything to help. Honestly if not affiliated with the government they would have died out long ago. I would rather drive across the country pick up anything I ordered online and drive back home. It would take less time and be much less of a hassle.

name: Kyla C.
text:
If you have any complaints for the staff, especially if you’re over the phone, save them. You’ll be the problem be the end of the conversation. Our carrier wasnt delivering packages to our door in our complex for about two or so weeks, and when we complained about never receiving the package we were told that our mailbox wasn’t labeled clearly enough and that he thought our building was abandoned bc of mail being piled up in ONE. Our boxes are labeled by a big bronze number to match our doors.. so they are labeled, but we agreed to pull a little weight despite this clearly not being our fault and the staff being a little rude. There’s four mail slots and only one full from vacancy.. which isn’t our mailbox and it wasnt a month ago when that same mail box was full and ours was being checked regularly. The other two people in our cluster were receiving mail fine and this didn’t become a problem for us until about two weeks ago. We have been here for MONTHS. It’s super easy to get our utility bill, but when it comes to our other mail suddenly our apartment was “abandoned”. There is no place for packages so they would have to walk up the stairs to deliver it anyways like they had done before, and as UPS and FEDex does. Come home today to a package shoved in the mail box. Anytime there’s a flimsy package it gets delivered to me because they’re easier to fold and shove into the mail slot, but if it’s a box heaven forbid. The idea of the carrier being lazy or confused wasn’t even entertained.

This review was posted in the past but I figured I’d give it a little update since some time has passed. Was 3 stars and I think 1 is sufficient. After the situation above, we had a new mail carrier assigned to us after a month or so. New mail carrier refused to deliver any mail to my part of the complex. I would literally watch her deliver to other buildings. The only thing that set our apart was that there were extra stairs from the parking lot to climb before you got to our boxes. Other buildings got their mail but ours never got delivered. We fought with our landlords and the post office over who’s responsibility it was to fix the mailbox situation. No matter how many times I tried there was not getting in contact with the post master. My landlords went as far as replacing the mail box itself because the first excuse was that the mail boxes weren’t secure.  I started to think that maybe the post master didn’t even exist as it was impossible to get them on the phone or even in front of me when I was at the counter. Again, no one wanted to entertain the idea of the mail carrier not wanting to do their job was even an option. To give you a time frame we started having issues in Aug of 2019. We didn’t get a single piece of mail until January 2020 when we MOVED because we couldn’t get any mail and it was clear no one with the power to fix things was going to do it. and guess who I’ve recently seen in pictures disrupting a public event on the property? The good ole post master. Good to know that people gathering on public property gets you out of your chair but someone calling to ask you about your own post office operations you’re not where to be found.

name: Michael Smith
text: Everyone has always been friendly and professional,  I am 100 % satisfied with the staff and the services provided by this post office.

name: Optimus Prime
text: Not sure what's going on with this Post Office but don't EVER expect them to answer the phone if you need to call. They absolutely will NOT answer no matter how many time you call.

name: Karen Thorne
text: First package did not have my apt number on it, shipper error. Call post office and give apt number. Package was still returned instead of redelivered. Second package, sent back also, and it had my apt number on it. Thank you post office for delaying the mail. A federal offence.

name: Andrew Bernard
text: My letter carrier is awesome....staff treated me kind...it's nice that places like this still exist...

name: Bobby Moore
text: Worst experience I had a package held for me because it was sent to the wrong address and they sent it back . Abosolute trash
