text: Terrible, had a express mail 2 day package that was several days late, checked on the usps site and it said out for delivery. We had a small snow so no delivery so i called and some extremely rude guy answered, i asked if i could pick my package up he said no their all scattered out on the floor right now it would be impossible to find. Is that not your job?????? Unbelievable!!!!

name: Kiikz
text: The driver didn’t even attempt to deliver my package then proceeded to scan it at delivery attempted and took it back to post office “at customer request”. Plain lazy worker that now cost me time to go get a package I paid to be delivered.

name: Joel Blackstock (LICSW MSW PIP)
text: Believe it or not the post office used to be a tourist atraction in Florence. When it was originally built the US government switched up the plans for the SC and AL Florence's post offices. This resulted in an enormous post office for the size of the city. Strangely the area that customers can use in this Post office is the smallest of any post office I have ever been in. Service is slow and it is always tight and cramped.

name: Carleton Goodloe
text: The guy who works there is very rude

name: hungry
text: Dang i read one review about them "NEVER PICKING UP THEIR PHONES".....that person was as right as my prom dress being delivered to my racist neighbors by accident and now they refuse to give it back... I NEED HELP

name: Theresia Harris
text: I love our Post office!

name: Tim Adams
text:
Terrible. I called 7 times to the post of on Tuesday 30 Sept and got no answer  Google  site said it was closed  .trying to track package .

no success at this post ofc.

name: Robin Featherston
text: What a majestic building!

name: Kevin
text: Always slow service

name: ryan mediano
text: Worst post office and very unprofessional

name: Kimberly Phillips
text: The lady was considerate and professional. I love her customer service and how she was friendly and not stuck up.

name: Abduallah S.
text: Nice facilities

name: Michele Marsh
text: I love this place the people who work there are so nice. Great customer service!!!!

name: Caitlin Foote
text:
I have attempted to call this post office many, many times whenever I've had issues with packages being misdelivered or not receiving package where the tracking info from USPS says they are delivered, and I have never once had a person pick up the phone at this location. I've called at different times of the day, and I've called multiple times in a row, no one picks up. I had to go by in person just to talk to someone. The first time, I was able to get my package there, but recently I've had 2 separate packages mysteriously not in my mailbox that say they are delivered by USPS to my mailbox, and I have not been able to get anyone to get back to me about this issue.

I contacted USPS Customer Service, who contacted the post office for me and said they would call me. The post office called, asked if I got my package and I said no, so they said they'll call me right back after speaking with the carrier. They did not call back, that was a week ago. I called many times to get back in touch, but like I said - no one picks up. I received an email from USPS customer service saying my issue is resolved, saying my package was in a parcel locker and to check my mailbox for the key. The parcel lockers were empty and there was no key in my mailbox. I tried to call the post office, no answer. After a few days, I went by in person. The clerk took my info and assured me that the carrier will contact me. They did not. I still do not have my packages.

I have reported one of the packages missing to the business I purchased it from because it has been two weeks since it was "delivered" and all they could do is start an investigation with USPS. The other, I will wait a few days and if it's not here I will report it missing as well. Currently I'm out about $100 or so with none of the items I purchased, and I can't get any info on what has happened to the packages. I'm beyond frustrated with this situation, and I'm not sure I will ever get these packages at this point.

Something needs to change at this location.

name: Menta Na
text:
Amazon sent me on a wild goose chase claiming that a package was supposed to be picked up at another post office, and they sent me here. The clerk wasn't able to fix my problem, and the package wasn't here, but she did take the time to explain what had likely happened, which I appreciated. + the mailman brought my package anyway, even if it was a day late.

also the lobby is big, and it wasn't busy while I was there, so it seemed pretty easy to social distance compared to some places.

name: X Huang
text: Bunch of liars. Package tracking says attempted delivery in the afternoon, and security camera footage showed no one even showed up at the door

name: Renee Apollo
text: I went by September 14th to pick up a package that was brought here because I put the wrong address in. The two women working were so helpful. My package was already Sent out to be returned to sender right before I got there but they spent time calling the carrier to get the address changed for me so it was delivered the next day instead of having me wait until it got returned to the sender.

name: Tommie Hardy
text: I must say I do not like the customer service here. I wish the postal manger would better train thier people. I asked for ten American Flag stamps and she counts out ten books of stamps and knew I was asking for ten stamps only. This woman got attitude about breaking up stamps. If this is way the employees at this branch act I wont be spending my hard earned money here anymore!

name: Joshua Moody
text: It’s a well known issue that this post office delivers packages to the wrong addresses. When you try to call no one answers the phone. Thankfully we have great neighbors that typically drop the package off at the right address but usually a day or two after it’s been marked delivered.

name: Luke Thomas
text: I had a lovely experience with a young lady working here. She was very helpful, fast, and even suggested I use Media Mail for a cheaper rate for the book I was shipping. It was refreshing to get such service, as I didn't go in with high expectations. Very pleased with my visit here!

name: Licia Blessed
text: Call no answer. Go pick up my mail keep saying I don’t have any wen I’m getting emails showing my mail.

name: Tim Fisher
text:
I hate to trash the whole agency, but the purpose of the post office is to facilitate mail delivery, and the carrier who services my neighborhood is a lazy sack of [advertiser friendly content] who can make up whatever story they want about why they couldn't do their job and the office will back them up. I've had nothing but bad experiences with any parcel bigger than a standard envelope, and everyone I've talked to in my neighborhood tells the same story.

Don't give these people your business. Use UPS or someone similar. You may pay a bit more, but at least you'll get what you pay for.

name: marcus moten
text: Mail man never showed up

name: Rikesha Foster
text: Never enough workers here to handle the customers. The wait time is always too long. You would think that there would be more than worker during the holiday season. There isn't. Save your time and energy and go somewhere else for your postage needs.

name: Aaron Hutchens
text: I've always had a good experience at this post office. I'm not sure what other reviewers are expecting. They're not going to six flags. It's usually pretty fast in and out when i go, and the employees are very curtious. I'm sure some have had bad experiences, as they have "we are not responsible for items stolen out of your car" signs outside, but I have never had a bad experience there.

name: nicole vincent
text:
I would give zero stars if possible. It's sad that  even if you put mail on hold, and follow their rules, they can never find it. Going to the Irondale post office instead. I'd rather pay extra for a PO box than deal with this post office and trusting them with my mail.

Their attitudes are awful.

name: Chas Keithan
text: I hate living in this office's coverage. I request anything but USPS whenever I order something online and they have a comment box available. Roughly 60% of my packages don't get delivered and are returned to sender if I don't catch it via tracking. I've had packages overnighted from overseas to Birmingham only to sit at this office "lost" for 4 days. The packages I do get, I have to go to the office a number of times before I'm able to actually receive it. If it comes through here, you can expect a week added to your shipping time.

name: WackyleeBing
text: Scary..worries me always. I Lost letters, parcels.  website has options to redeliver but never redeliver on the date of redelivery. You  would not know who to ask, no contact number at all. You cannot tell the seller online not to use USPS. When shopping online I will  just it will not be unlucky purchase again.

name: Clinton Babers II
text: Trash..........  Absolute abysmal post office. This had been my post office since I bought my home here and every year there is a MAJOR mishap with the carrier assigned or the branch. Not throwing shade, I have video evidence. Generally im easy going and passive..... Today was was breaking point. Terrible!!

name: R E
text: I ordered a package using expedited shipping to receive it on Thursday. An attempt was made to delivery it on Thursday and a notice was left telling me I could pick it up on Friday. I went to pick it up Friday and the package was not there. I went back on Saturday and the package was still not there. Of course they are closed on Sunday. Apparently, the carrier decided to ride around with my package for a few days instead of leaving at the office like the notice he left said. There has also been no additional attempts to delivery the package. I ORDERED USING EXPEDITED SHIPPING FOR A REASON!

name: RobertMStahl
text: A second day air letter took almost four days, but it was shipped out of this post office on time.  Apparently, it did not make it out of the distribution center, but that is not an excuse.  Ten times the cost and a stamp might have worked better.  Other problems associated with receiving mail from this location, my zip code, but the real issue is the way the Federal Government is trying to bring em down financially, isn't it?

name: Cee Jay
text: ordered a very expensive package and included in my notes do not leave on ground.  Hell, If you deliver in the neighborhood you should no not to leave packages exposed anywhere outside. Called to complain to 1800 number and to dispute the charge with credit card company. I am not paying for something I never received.  It says that they delivered the item to an individual but how is that so when I am the only one who lives here. People if you have to deal with this post office get a PO BOX never trust the actual mail carriers who open your mail, loose your mail or take your mail or in my case dont deliver the mail or the packages.at all. WOODLAWN BRANCH IS HORRIBLE. This is why everything has moved from this area.

name: Marcia Wharton
text: Very uneven delivery. Sometimes they tell you you had no mail when it is not true and sometimes when you do get the mail, it is obvious that they decided not to deliver it for a day. Trying to contact them if you have a problem or question is nearly impossible. I have also had a few problems with packages being delivered to a different address. Postal workers are polite, but they do skip our house sometimes or deliver to the wrong address.

name: Shantay Fowler
text: Had a delivery but I was not there and instead of leaving it at the door like normal they took it back for me to come and pick it up. I had to send someone since it closes before I get off work. They gave him someone else's package. The same last name but obviously the wrong address and first name.  Needless to say I have to go pick up my package today between the 2 hours that they are opened on Saturday. I had my friend take the other package to the person it was meant to be delivered too since she ordered it in February with 2-day delivery, it is now May!!!

name: carnisha jackson
text: They're always losing my packages. I'm not sure if they're stealing them or what but the company should get new employees because the current ones are completely unreliable and quite unprofessional.

name: Jennifer Garrett
text: WORST EXPERIENCE! I shipped 2 boxes out of this location for Christmas. 1 box made it however was empty of all content and the 2nd box never made it! So my family in FL didn't get any presents from us.  I will never again use the U.S. Postal Service to ship boxes. I will gladly spend a few extra dollars and use UPS or Fedex.

name: Payton Sittason
text: customer service? Can't get anyone to answer the phone. impossible to get in touch with

name: Latirra Payne
text: The worse post office in Birmingham, clueless as to what their jobs consist of and very poor management.

name: Javier Perez
text: I had a packaged that was late and of course they didn't do to well to recover it. Remember, it's just another USPS among other bad USPS offices.

name: John Higginbotham
text: Will not answer the phone to save their lives. USPS worst customer service and shipping company in United States.

name: Gary Argo
text: I have been trying  for a week to get the staff to put the name of the sender on my certified slip. They refuse to do so. I try calling to find this out but no one  answers the phone.

name: Neal Dameron
text: As bad as the DMV.  Typical gov agency.

name: The Awakening Enthusiast
text: By far one of the best kept up and clean Wal-Mart's in or around the Huntsville area. They are always very well stocked and have very friendly staff. I have went to this store at least once a day for over a year and a half now and I have never had a negative experience. Which say's a lot because I can't say that about any other Wal-Mart I've ever been to. Management is doing a great job! Keep up the great work guys!

name: Umar Bello
text: The staff were very courteous and supportive.They took their time to explain processes that were not clear.Their conduct to duty was commendable.

name: TrinaMerrell
text: I am absolutely upset with this post office. I’ve had two different issues with package deliveries. The first one, I will say that the post master tried to make it right but my package was never found. And now, they “couldn’t deliver it to my door because they couldn’t gain access to it”. I live in an apartment complex and my unit is across from our mailboxes...We also have postal boxes that they could’ve left the package in...I didn’t get the delivery notification about it until after post hours so now I’m not even able to contact anyone about this issue. I am so frustrated that they can’t even get a simple delivery correct. I wish when I ordered things online, I could choose the carrier because I KNOW that FedEx/UPS would get it right and be available almost 24/7 if they did something wrong.

name: Mandy Beeson
text: I stopped receiving mail for a couple of weeks. I had a couple of people call me to tell me they received my mail back saying the mail was undeliverable. I called the post office to ask about it, and apparently my mail carrier said "someone told me the house was vacant". I don't know who because certainly nobody spoke to me or anyone else in the house. I'm at work during mail delivery times. There is no repercussion for these kinds of things either. I now have to call to have all of my tax forms, etc resent because of the carelessness of this post office and its carriers.

name: randy fallon
text: For a YEAR straight I’ve had to go pick up my packages from there every time. UPS always delivers my package promptly or even few days late but always manages. Then their rude and slow when you go inside. I shouldn’t pay for delivery and then have to get it myself I could just go to the store.

name: W Barringer
text: First off I hope everyone in the USPS community will see this... So about 2 weeks ago my wife ordered some very expensive items that were set to be shipped through USPS... Most might assume shipping was the issue, NOT this time... The reason for a 1 star review was all about the DELIVERY... So normally anytime a package is delivered to our home (no matter who the courier is) its placed either at the gate of our courtyard or right at the front door (12 feet from the gate)... NOT this time... Instead who ever management has decided to run our route decided to place the large package on top off not only our mailbox but also on top of our neighbors mailbox (2 mail boxes 2 post). WTH!!! Our mailbox is 2 acres away from the house and by the way even though its personal business im a disabled Veteran, (cant just walk to the mailbox so dont try a think im just lazy) so i had to watch and make sure no one stole this large package until my wife or neighbor came home and checked the mail after work... I know this has to be a new deiver because our old USPS driver would have never done something so ignorant and lazy... Please fix this for everyone else in the future and make sure delivery drivers have a little common sense and maybe a little bit of respect for other people and there mail (envelope or box).. oh and by the way for anyone thinking about (it was just a mistake) NOT this time... Apparently since the driver changed they have been putting eveyones boxes just on top of the mailboxes.. info provided by neighborhood..

name: Michael Conner
text: HOW is one package delievered when another isnt. I realize I like in a rural area, but USP and Fedex have no issues. Get it together USPS this has been going on for years.

name: James Roper
text: Poor service went several weeks not receiving mail never know if they will pick up what you are sending out or not had one carrier come up to my house a few years back and tell me I must check my mail more often with a nasty attitude they continue to put other people's mail in my box that for some reason has my address after I went and told them I'm the only one receiving mail here

name: Tori W
text: Nice post office. We just went in for some postal priority supplies, so I can't speak to the customer service, but easy parking.

name: Adam Zwickl
text: Every package I order from this location is delayed by 2 to 3 days I pay extra shipping to the to the post office and they still take 4 days to give me something that had guaranteed 2-day shipping if they didn't have a monopoly on all of our shipping coming to my house I would use someone else.

name: j N
text: I don't often write reviews and try to give people the benefit of the doubt but this is getting ridiculous. They have several times recently received my packages and mail and said "delivery attempt: unable to deliver your package" before even coming to my residence. If you aren't actually going to deliver people's mail then just shut down and let us or FedEx handle Prattville. When they do actually come here, they usually leave multiple people's boxes open afterward. Worst mail carrier branch I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with.

name: Cory Woods
text: Terrible customer service. Took my prepaid package that was sent back to me by USPS and told to add more postage because label was insufficient postage only for the workers to tell me that I could not add postage to the label and that I was going to have to redo the entire thing over again. Ended up having to order priority which was no big deal except now they never scanned as delivered making me think my package was delayed or lost. Thankfully company has indicated that they have received it but this is unacceptable from the USPS because this was a high dollar item being shipped off. If I could leave less than half a star I would.

name: Patrick Carter
text: Horrible! Been waiting on a package for 3 days now. My mail usually runs around 4:30 pm but for some reason they supposedly came by at 10:45 am and left a "sorry we missed you" note that I didn't get until 4:30 when the mail actually ran. Tell me how that is?! Did the redeliver BS on the website for the next day. Guess what??....Nothing! Called and talked to whoever at this place and she said it would be delivered today. Guess what??...Nothing!

name: rw7425
text:
Wish I could give the Prattville USPS zero stars. This is hands down the worst USPS delivery ever. There is no rhyme or reason to their delivery schedule. One day the mail comes at 9:30 am, the next day it comes at 9:30 pm. Packages are marked as delivered when they were not delivered. I had to call the office three or four times to find out where a package was. The supervisor at the post office is totally useless, never knows what is going on.
UPDATE: I now realize the mail wasn't being delivered at all hours of the day. Instead, several of my neighbors were placing mail that was mis-delivered to them in my mailbox early in the mornings, on their way to work or very late in afternoon after they got home from work. Still the worst postal delivery ever!

name: Tanya Brumett
text: Speedy and efficient for your postal needs. They even sell money orders.

name: J N
text: Worst post office ever. Never actually delivers my packages. Makes me go into the office after reporting it delivered or lying by saying an attempt was made before the mail even comes

name: Gary Latimer
text: Unbelievably random delivery times. Some days my mail will show up at at 11 am other days not until 7 or 8. Certified mail requiring signatures arriving when I'm not home without any attempt to deliver again.  Packages never arriving on time unless it's a Sunday drop off I will say that carrier is awesome the Monday thru Friday carriers just show up when they feel like it.

name: Brenna Walker
text: I don’t know if it’s everyone she carries for or just us but she’s always rude, throws packages that say fragile, she skips our house randomly, and I ship so many items I have to schedule pickup and she has skipped my scheduled pickups.

name: Chelsea Cherry
text: Prattville post office is very rude and are no help. I have a problem with some of my mail being delivered; where my mail carrier lies about packages being delivered and it will never be delivered. I go up to the post office and tell them my dilemma and they are rude as hell and no help, pretty much tell me that there’s nothing they can do because it was “delivered” when it wasn’t.

name: Happily Retired
text: This place is without a doubt the most disorganized, incompetent post office I have ever encountered. One day, my mail is delivered at 10:00 am. The next day, my mail is delivered at 8:30 pm. It's crazy! They lost my tracked package (marked as delivered, but wasn't), then lied about it. When I called to see about filing a complaint, I was told that there was "nobody" higher up than the person I was speaking to on the phone. Really? I made the mistake of giving them my name and address. After that, I didn't receive ANY mail for the next week to ten days. No kidding!

name: Melvin Welsh
text: Great team here. Friendly and helpful. True professionals.

name: Destiny Barberree
text: Somehow my mail and packages end up at the wrong house.  This has not just happened one or two times.  I get checks from my escrow,  sometimes even bills, and it makes me wonder how much of my money I've failed to receive because of the carriers failure to perform their job effectively.  I'm still on hold at the moment trying to figure out who's house the dropped my bathing suit off too.  Hopefully they are as honest as the people who returned my THREE HUNDRED DOLLAR cameo silhouette. This is absolutely ridiculous!

name: Chad Underwood
text: The staff at the prattville post office is awesome!! Always very helpful and super friendly.

name: Crystal Needles (Crystal_Needles)
text: I get a message from usps saying my package is out for delivery at 8am on February 8th my husband waited at home until 8:45pm for the package. It never showed then at 9pm I get another message saying my package was available for pickup at the prattville Alabama 36067 location but I couldn’t get it because they were closed by time I received the message. I was irritated but I thought at least I can get it when they open the next morning. So today February 9th at 8am I received yet another message from usps stating that my package had been sent back to the sender. So when was I supposed to be able to pick it up if you were closed when I was informed that it wasn’t delivered to my house like it was supposed to be like the tracking stated “out for delivery”(to a place where I receive at least 9 packages a week) and then you notify me by yet another message that it had been sent back before you even open not giving me a chance to pick it up??????  What is that about. Is this some sort of scam??? Did I get robbed??? That package is filled with the jewelry for me and my bridesmaids for my Wedding. Or is this just the carrier/driver just being lazy and not wanting to make all his/her stops???? Because like I said my fiancé was here all day and i know my address isn’t false because I legitimately receive at least 9 packages a week for work and for my wedding. So please explain to me why this happened?????

name: Leighetta Hilton
text: This is the worst post office ever .....the staff up front are awesome but the mail carrier's are the worst I have to come up here all the time about my mail not being delivered its getting ridiculous like can you not read

name: Vicki Weber
text: Great service and always helpful.  I truly enjoy going to this office because of the staff.

name: Sherri Herring
text: My mail carrier is great, but the staff at post office is rude.  I tried to pick up a package that was addressed to me with my home address.  They refused to allow me to pick it up.  It had to be delivered to my home.  It did not matter that I had my licenses to prove my name and address.

name: Paul Hernandez
text: I've been pleased with the service I receive in mailing packages, buying stamps, etc.

name: Scott Crouch
text: Nice post office,  staff is friendly and very helpful

name: Frank Talley
text: Staff is always friendly, courteous and professional.

name: Keith Wheeler
text: Always have friendly and helpful service

name: Derek -
text: good post office.

name: Ronny Gweilo
text: Helpful staff, always friendly

name: Jeannie Baker
text: The website to change your address does not work well.

name: Milky H
text: Good service!!

name: We The People
text: If you guys can't make the scheduled time, DO NOT set the status to PICK UP! I wasted A LOT of my valuable time due to your NEGLIGENCE! please be a decent human being and have respect for other's time. If you're short-staffed, that is a corporate issue and it needs to be addressed at the top. Thanks in advance.

name: Aaron Burton
text: If you fail to deliver my package on the day it’s scheduled, DO NOT set it’s status for pick up! I wasted A LOT of my valuable time that should of been better allocated due to your negligence! It’s so simple to set the status to running late. If you’re short on manpower then that’s a corporate issue and it needs to be addressed at the top.Please respect my time!! Thank you in advance.

name: Jaí Frenshá
text: The big black man has a AWFUL attitude! I’ve left plenty of reviews not wanting people fired but he needs to be gone or at least not worked in the front! So sad how his own co workers seems afraid of him

name: Mrs. Lenora
text: The customer service is horrible! Sue at the front counter was very rude and her manager was standing there listening to the entire conversation, but did not acknowledge the wrongdoing of his employee. Only certain customers were greeted and acknowledged upon arrival. This is not the first horrible encounter that I had at this post office. It doesn’t cost a thing to be nice and considerate of others.

name: DAVID NAYLOR
text: As a small business owner I am dependent on the USPS for timely deliveries. Unfortunately, this particular location is the absolute worst at every step in the delivery process. I have had packages not scanned and checked in, packages lost, rude customer service, and missing mail requests go unsearched. Do not drop off your packages in the overnight bin either. They will get ignored and not scanned in.....Was recently advised that I could check in my own packages using the kiosk outside. Unfortunately, not all types of shipping can be checked in. So I go inside to report the problem. The only feedback after telling them the issue was to leave the lobby because I didn't have mask.....Helena Post Office is wonderful! Alabaster office is nice too! This was the last straw. No more Pelham USPS.

name: Ashley Campbell
text:
Don’t waste your time. People working there are disrespectful, lazy and rude! Do not go there for a passport application/services because you will get nowhere. As I was walking into the post office two of the employee male and female we’re talking rudely about a customer who just walked out in front of other people.
Just save yourself some time and go to a different location because this is the absolute worst post office ever and I don’t know how they still have a job. I have never seen anybody so rude and disrespectful while sitting on their behind and judging people in front of others

name: Jack Mc
text: The worst. Read other reviews and your going to get a good idea about what to expect from this PO. Packages marked as delivered, but not. Mail delivered to neighbors. Packages stuffed/crammed tightly into the mailbox. Or simply left on the ground by the mailbox instead of being placed in a more secure area (front door, side door, by the garage, etc.). And forget calling them... the phone will ring and ring for about 3 minutes before disconnecting. Do yourself a favor and use another service or PO if at all possible.

name: Ashley
text: How is there never anybody available to answer the phone? Ridiculous and after all the complaints against Sue how is she still there. This location has to be the absolute worst.

name: Cheryl Burnette
text: Absolutely horrible customer service. I called and needed to ask two questions. The woman (not lady) who answered was impatient and short with me from the very beginning. She would not tell me the cost of premium forwarding. Said I had to come in. She eventually hung the phone up in my face! When I tried to call back to speak to the supervisor, she would not answer the phone. Such inept people should not be working in customer service. This is a very black eye for the USPS. Would not use that post office if it were the last one on earth. (I never got the chance to ask my second questions.)

name: Jessica Norris
text: Whatever you do, don't use this post office!!! I'm sure they will never read their reviews just like they don't answer their local phone line either, but today I had the absolute worst service ever. The man working the front desk told me to go grab a mask in order to be in the lobby, which I complied with. Then he proceeded to enforce his political views on me in public in front of the entire lobby. Completely inappropriate and unprofessional, especially since I was the CUSTOMER and he was the EMPLOYEE. I usually avoid USPS but in this scenario I needed to send something to another PO Box and HAD to use them. Never will go back for the rest of my life. No wonder the post office wanted "mail-in" votes to count when this employee publicly tried to push his agenda.

name: Asherr Cole
text: Priority Mail packages will more than likely not be sent on time,  as a business owner I don't recommend this location as a drop off if you are looking for reliable and consistent service.  😔

name: Dennis Dee
text:
They don’t had the sleeve to put the customs declaration in.
Told me I have to go to a different USPS location!
Very poor for a post office!!!!!
USPS is just a nightmare

name: Arena Hill
text: the workers here are just garbage and totally lazy, will not deliver mail. and they are very disrespectful.

name: melissa aplin
text: Worst post office ive ever come across. They dont answer the phone nor deliver your mail on a consistent basis. Also i dropped 3 packages off on Friday and 2 have started tracking but 1 is somehow already lost and not been scanned and sent out anywhere. They are the WORST!!!

name: Heather Cee
text: I just got off a call with Ron and he was very kind and couldn't have been any more helpful. I very much appreciate him and my regular mail carrier, Tony. They do a great job, as I would guess all folks there do. I'm so grateful for our Postal Service.

name: Marcie Prescott
text: No one ever answers the phones.  I'm trying to find out why my package is being held there and not delivered.  So frustrating.

name: Nicole Evans
text: Customer service was absolutely the worst thing I have EVER seen.

name: Alicia Yoerg
text: I went to the Pelham Post Office today 12/8/2020 about 12:00.  While I waited in line, one of the female workers(unsure of her name) was extremely rude to 2 different male customers.  It was super confrontational and uncomfortable to be there.  I had seen this worker be rude before but this time, I will not go back to this post office.  I highly recommend them handle this hostile female worker.  The other two workers on each side of her were apologizing to customers as they came up.

name: Ashley Cox
text: Susan or Sue (not sure what her actual name is) was EXTREMELY rude. Won’t be going back to this location because of my horrible experience with her.

name: Bob from Eufaula
text: (July 1, 9AM) So my wife just lugs two 25 pound boxes into the Pelham Parkway PO. The overly rude and disrespectful government employee at the counter tells her that she can't mail those boxes because they don't have "Flat Rate" printed on the labels. He never looks up and won't listen and does not even try to read the label. Maybe he does not know how to read?She leaves in disgust and begs me to switch to FedEx because at least their people know how to treat customers. please view attached picture and see how long it takes to find the words "Flat Rate" on the label

name: Lara Penney
text: Avoid if at all possible.

name: Marissa Kendrick
text: Talked down on whenever I’ve been there. Multiple packages have been marked as delivered while I was outside waiting on them- and nothing. They just never arrived. When I tried talking to the staff twice they have dismissed me and acted as if I wasn’t worth their time. I’m not one to write reviews but this has really been a issue that should be addressed. I ordered two packages on Black Friday that we’re supposed to be Christmas gifts for my mother, that I never received. I was told “maybe they were stolen” when I watched the delivery truck drive past me while receiving my  “delivered” text message. I was told the post master would be in contact with me twice, nothing. It has been over four weeks at this point. I really hate to be one to complain, I always try my best to be positive but this post office has proven more than once that they do not care about their packages or their customers. I really hate that I’m out $100. Guess I’ll just start using UPS and FedEx.

name: James Walker (Miles)
text: Dropped off a package in overnight box to be sent off with Priority 2Day Shipping. That was the 23rd, today is Dec. 1 and it says it hasn't even been scanned in yet. No one answers the phone or can tell me my package even exists. Of all the places in the government that I wish gets shutdown. Let it be you first, honestly you all don't care enough to be considered a service.

name: Siimply_ Dounuts
text: passaport service is terrible

name: Stephen Byzek
text: I have had four packages in as many weeks fail to get delivered on time for various reasons. "No Secure location" "Customer Requested redelivery" and then just... nothing. Packages will sit as "out for delivery" for three to four days with no updates on the tracking information. Worst post office ever.

name: Brittnay Martínez
text: A lady named Susan is extremely rud and disrespectful she told my mom that the package had not arrived even though the paper to go pick it up and an hour later I went with the same paper and a first she was like “a9 ok she already ask she just came and it’s not there” and I went and asked and the box was there and the box looked like it was opened 😡😡😡

name: Amanda Cortez
text:
I'm updating my review. Original below. I don't know what happened in a year but I was treated like absolute GARBAGE today, not by Debbie but by her dark-haired female coworker. I am removing my 5 start review and I wish I could give zero stars. NO ONE should be treated with the disrespect I encountered today.

Debbie was kind and knowledgeable! I got my packages sent off with ease (and the best deal). She also helped me compete my passport paperwork and send it off! She truly made my morning!

name: alix bada
text: I called to check on my mail it took me one hour and a half to fill them to answer me and then the end didn't give me no help at all they are bad service and bad delivery I barely can see the delivery driver come to our plaza here in the business is terrible

name: gary burton
text: If I could leave no stars I would , this is by far the worst post office in Alabama. The workers are complete garbage. The Mishandling of packages is beyond mind blowing. Literally everyone that works there is a waste of life In general. Not to mention it looks abandoned on the outside. Zero pride . Pathetic

name: Arial Johnson
text: If you live in Pelham and have to use this post office, get stuff sent to a friend not in Pelham if you're able. The mail carriers are incompetent. They mark packages as "Delivered" then deliver them 3-4 days later. They mark as not having access to a delivery point when they are too lazy to deliver and they also do not even bother to check if someone is available to accept a package if a signature is required, but rather mark it as "No One Available for Delivery," forcing you to pick it up at the post office. Not to mention the numerous packages that will get lost or delivered to wrong addresses. It's so bad that I have had to request sellers to NOT ship anything to me USPS and just pay extra for FedEx or UPS.

name: Jessica Sims
text: I watched the employees treat two customers ahead of me horribly and then it was my turn. I was lied to and cursed at. This is not the first time. These people are a disgrace!

name: Janeysi Perez
text:
Very rude. Asked a question and he answered quickly without searching for the package on his computer.
Mailman NEVER rings doorbell to actually deliver packages. Only wants to stay in truck.

name: laith huneidi
text: I had the most horrible service. I dealt with a lady named Sue. She was rude in the past and she was rude to me once again. But this time it was to another extreme.  I have done nothing to this lady. After a mistake on her end that she tried to blame her mistake on me in a room full of customers. I had enough and asked for her managers name and number. Sue did not want to provide me that information at first. Then she proceeded to tell me that her manager is not in. I proceeded to ask for a phone number and was given the wrong phone number! How is this lady even allowed to work there?  We do not appreciate this type of service when doing business here. If i dont see an effort from this Post Office location trying to resolve this issue I will take the matter to someone who can. No person should be spoken to in that manner regardless of race, age religion, or color.  I will not let his one go. Terrible service Sue.

name: James Holeman
text: Dark haired lady at the front is extremely rude!!

name: Paula Harvel
text: Love these workers of this post office. They are always so helpful!

name: Freddie Percy
text: Very rude dark haired lady at the front desk

name: Oui Lee
text: One of the ladies at the register was very rude. I printed out a label for one order, but forgot to print a second for another package. Instead of saying they don’t print labels, she first looked at me shaking her head in a rude manner and said “I don’t know what you want me to do”. So I calmly asked if they printed labels and she finally said no. As I was reaching for my card to pay for tape, I caught her looking at others behind me throwing her hands up and shaking her head again. The overall experience was very unprofessional.

name: Kyle Turner
text: Constantly having issues with my mail carrier. I call and can never get anyone (real person) on the phone. My mail sometimes shows up, sometimes goes to my neighbor, sometimes just sits in the back of the actual stock room until I go up there and ask for it.

name: jeremy lane
text: Lady named Sue needs to get fired. Extremely rude!!

name: Ali Joon
text: If you drop a package in the box after hours it will sit there forever before they touch it. Add at lease one week to the delivery time. There is a reason for all of these one star reviews. You will save yourself lots of frustration by driving to another USPS store or using another carrier altogether.

name: Brittney H (Brittney Hunt)
text: Nice and friendly staff, usually when I go in there’s not too long of a wait.

name: David Lamar
text: ZERO stars would be more accurate.  We have had so much trouble with this post office.  Our mail gets delivered to the neighbors and we get mail for other people that don't even live in our subdivision.  They CRAM packages that don't fit in the mailbox, they mark that there is no one here when we are just because they don't want to get out of the truck and when we try and hold our mail they either DON'T  hold it or they don't deliver it when the hold is over as we requested.  They are totally incompetent.

name: Greg Edgeworth
text: I live in Grey Oaks in Pelham.  I get mail every day.  But most is not mine. Neighbors swap mail most every day.  All streets and mailboxes are labeled.  I don't know if they can't do the job or just don't care. I will go up the ladder if needed.

name: Vernon Pruitt
text: Can't reach anyone by phone. Trying to call and check claim for missing package. Automated phone service says claim is resolved but no one has called or emailed and the package is still missing.

name: Rinku Patel
text: Never again.. i personally drove 20 mins to drop off my package to this location. I verified it was media mail and paid postage for it. 10 days later the package gets dropped to my door step saying I need to pay $32 more to send it out. I drove back there and had to speak to the postmaster. She is rude and very unprofessional.  Has an attitude, and does not deserve to be in her position of serving customers. I never know how these people qualify for these jobs... postmaster didn't know what qualified as media mail... the staff is just as clueless. I think my issue was resolved after 3x of me driving down there. Who knows, they may drop off my package at my door step again, claiming it's not media mail when it is..incompetent idiots....

name: Mike Brooks
text: PostLady Miss Debra and Postman Jesse have been great for almost 14 years experience.

name: Jen Guadalupe
text: The lady I spoke with not only yelled at me to speak up, she had a bad attitude too. I only asked that a package be held at the office so I could pick it up since it had to be signed for. She was rude but said it would be held there. I sent my husband to get it since I was stuck at work. The lady yelled and cursed at my husband that she didn't know what he was talking about and that there was no package there. She even told him to get out! That he was wasting her time! I called Helena office and find out that the lady had it held there! Seriously?? This is how the Fed Gov allows the postal service to be run? I will be avoiding Pelham office at all costs now. Truly offended.

name: Megan Everett
text: If I could give Pelham post office negative stars I would. This place might as well be shut down!!!!!!! In the past two weeks I’ve had two packages delivered to the wrong address. I never get my own mail but At least twice a week I get 2-3 different neighbors mail. Seems like y’all need to fire your mail delivery people.....

name: yusuf alhajj
text: Misplaced a package that needed a signature. Took 45 minutes to finally locate which I should consider myself lucky looking at the other reviews. The carrier refuses to come to my door to let me sign and instead leaves a slip in the mailbox indicating no one was available. Unacceptable!

name: Maria Martinez
text: very bad service with Susan is always bad 😤😤😤

name: B R
text: An employee named Ron was claiming my daughter couldn’t get a passport without me there even though she was of age to do so and had all of the correct paper work according to the federal passport website. He wouldn’t let me explain to him what was going on and when I tried he kept interrupting me and yelling “a parent must be here” in front of everyone in the post office. I was never able to explain anything or show him the website where it states that she can get one with out me there bc he kept interrupting and yelling at me that “A parent MUST be here”! He told me I’d have to cancel my appointment which I was not going to do bc she needed to apply for the passport today. I finally left my daughter there and tried to run and get my other daughter from school hoping I could make it back in ten minutes for the appointment. My daughter calls me a little while later and told me she was able to get the passport and that the nice passport lady told her “Ron” had never done passports before and didn’t know what he was talking about. Needless to say I’m glad Ron didn’t convince me to cancel and I’m glad one person there actually knows what they are doing! I plan on avoiding this post office from now on and driving a bit farther next time we need a passport.

name: B.B.
text: Need a mask required sign not recommended instead of kicking people out

name: Brian Evans
text: They have letters. Sometimes the letters tell us what to do.  Sometimes we tell letters where to go.  File, sort, stuff and stamp.  The post office has it all.  Totally recommend for your next vacation.

name: Full OfFamily
text: Terrible lady who works there over charging people on pre paid shipping.  Terrible Terrible and then you can’t speak to the manager.  Went to other post offices who don’t do this and the person was very rude and treated a 40 year old like a child.

name: Andrew Eberhardt
text: Won't answer the phone. Can't give me info on my package. Told me it's my fault it came to the wrong post office. Done with USPS. Paid money to have it shipped quickly and still have no idea where my order is. Horrible.

name: Eboni Berry
text: If I pay for overnight or 2 day shipping, that’s what I expect. This mail carrier has updated the tracking several times to say that they couldn’t access my mailbox, HOWEVER. I make sure to park in my yard and the mailbox is on the street. I run a business and I need my packages! I expect to receive them according to the shipping I’ve paid! Please stop lien on the tracking and stop being lazy! Do your job!!

name: Brian McDaniel
text: Had several items shipped to my location. 3 items delivered the 4th item is now marked "attempted delivery, could not access location".

name: Chris Edwards
text: Employees suck, lack of knowledge and helpfulness

name: Linda Lemoine
text:
I usually use UPS but for some reason I decided to drive further and use the USPS. I was treated in such a rude manner by "Ron" . Never having experience with packaging he not only would not give me a little help when I asked for it, he told me "customers are supposed to do their own packing". He handed me a heavy tool that dispenses tape and pointed to the area where labels,etc. are. I was the only customer in the store mind you, until another lady came in who offered me help and then I was able to finish my process.
I have never been in a situation where someone refused to help me.
No wonder this office has such a poor rating.
I hope he gets untreatable diarrhea .

name: Trac Vo
text: Never pick up their phone.

name: Katie Vann
text: Everyone was so helpful! Danny thank you for your time and help! Best experience in a post office ever!

name: J Enis
text: Horrible! The mail delivery person left a letter in my mailbox stating they had missed me and that my certified package would be delivered back to the post office. The delivery person did not attempt to knock on my door, ring my doorbell or even blow the horn to alert me they were outside. I tried to call the post office once I received the notification to which I received a message that the hold time would be greater than one hour. Today I went to pick up my package at the post office. I was the first person there out of six people ( I was the last of the six people to leave. Four of the six people had complaints. )The guy took my notification and returned 20 minutes later to tell me there was not a package for me there. Obviously there is a package because I am holding the notification in my hand that was left in my mailbox Saturday. He alerted the Post Master and after 45 minutes of waiting for my package I finally had it in hand. Unorganized...not to mention all the many times the mail delivery person leaves a neighbors mail in my box or vice versa. We are always having to deliver each others mail to one another in my neighborhood.

name: Chris Wilson
text: Usually a long wait, then get treated rudely by postal worker. Hate going there.

name: Megan Templeton
text: Staff always looks depressed and are rude . The packages are thrown around. Observed the staff mocking two customers today. Save yourself the trouble and go to the Helena or Hoover post office - worth the drive.

name: Barbara Williams
text: Misdelivered or missing mail at least once a week. Call the post office & get hung up on.

name: K Smith
text: They frequently misdeliver my mail to other addresses or fail to deliver it at all. The most recent nonsense is failure to deliver a package with the tracking code "No access." Really? A standard residential street address with no access just one day out of the year? Absurd. Some research indicates that's the code used for "it was raining" (it was) or "I didn't want to get out of the truck" or any other reason they have for skipping a delivery, or perhaps later realizing they forgot something. At least this time there was a code. Normally there's no explanation at all. I've lived in many places, and this post office is the worst I've ever experienced.

name: Joey Smith
text: Too bad we can't give negative stars. The "lady" who helped me was the poster child for snarky attitude. Now they have lost another package that has been showing "out for delivery" for 7 days. I didn't realize we still had postal riders on horseback, hell you could walk to our house and back to the post office in less than 1/2 a day. Pathetic, no wonder they are losing money.

name: taylor evans
text: Nice place! I love it good service

name: Brittany C.
text: Easily the worst post office I have ever had dealings with. Packages aren't delivered, they are delivered to the wrong address, etc.

name: Stephanie Young
text: This is the most rude and unprofessional so called post office! You have a problem about receiving your mail or other issues,  and they do not care about resolving anything! They will hang up on you rather than to deal with you. They can't get anything right. I believe some of them can't even read or write! Pathetic

name: smile dog ace dog
text: Only delivered box 2out of 2 and lost box 1 out of 2 . Mail person said they would return the next day with it and didn’t show up.

name: Joshua Jones
text: Danny was awesome, great experience!

name: Gerald Seaborn
text: Instead of walking my package to the front door of my home which is covered, they would rather leave it on the top step which is only a few steps from my door. The package got rained on and was open. This not the first time either. Their mail carriers suck!

name: Bill Hart
text: It's the government at its BEST!

name: Dawn Marie
text:
Worst post office I've ever been to.  POOR customer service.  Nobody EVER answers the phone.
Carrier service is rediculous!

name: Joshua Williams
text: LOCAL PO I USE....STAFF IS KIND....STAYS BUSY

name: Alcides Palacios
text: Good service

name: Darren Morten
text: These people are rude! Beware if you have to go here. Customer service is a foreign concept to these people.

name: Barbie
text: This is the most worse and unprofessional post office

name: janitorial-engineer
text: They act as if it's a free service.

name: Robert Evans
text: You can tell these are government run

name: Richard Walton
text: awful

name: Jose Bracamontes
text: Terrible

name: Christy Sullivan
text: I highly recommend this location.  The ladies at this store do an awesome job of making each and every customer feel comfortable and welcomed.  Best customer service on PLANET EARTH!  Thank you both so much for caring about your customers!

name: Alcides Palacios
text: AlwaysMoney, in times of trouble there is waiting for you ... !!!!

name: Phillip Brewer
text: The reviews this place gets are pretty bad, but all of my experiences have been positive. The ladies that helped were good natured and friendly. In my experience if you treat people with kindness and respect you'll be more likely to get it in return. The people who work here are no different.

name: Terrell Washam
text: THEY WERE SO RUDE AND THE BLACK LADY UP THERE HAS VERY LOW DOWN WITH VERY POOR COUSTOMER EXPIRENCE IF U GONNA WORK IN THE PUBLIC THEM I FEEL AS IF U NEED NOT TO BE SO RUDE JUST SAD

name: S B
text: Worst post office in Mobile. Filled out a change of address form. Says it was being rerouted to new address but still was delivered at old one. The lady at the counter is rude af. I wouldn't advise a dog to do service with this place.

name: Trellanee Rose
text: The people how work inside the office have the absolute nastiest attitudes. They are of no help and extremely unprofessional. I spoke with a woman how said she was the supervisor about some missing packages of which there are a lot. She basically told me f u In so many words and that I should have told the companies my new address so it’s my fault. Then I asked if I could speak with someone else. She asked me way I need to talk to someone else because they would just tell me the same thing she did. I told her because I was becoming frustrated with her. I asked if there was a A corporate number or a higher office of some kind she told me no. I later came home and found the number with a google search. This post office is full of bs. I absolutely hate that I moved this area code .

name: Brian Gavan
text: DO NOT TRUST THIS POST OFFICE! WEDDING RING “MISSING” OR LIKELY STOLEN BY EMPLOYEE! 907 Spring Hill Ave, Mobile, AL 36604.  You hate to think the worst, and you would hope to god you could trust the US Postal Service, but this situation screams of scandal.  A few weeks ago On June 26th 2020 we were sending my fiancés wedding ring back to Arizona to be fixed.  It was a family heirloom given to me by my now deceased grandmother to give to my wife. Of course this is the type of item which cannot be replaced by “insurance” money.  The clerk knew the value, as when I asked that the package be sent by certified mail she said she had no forms and no supervisor. It has now been 3 weeks and the ring has not made it to its final destination. When using the tracking number supplied, it appears that the package never left Mobile. I have since gone to 2 other postal locations in an attempt to get assistance with tracking the package. Coincidence is hard to believe at this point.  Customer service will now not return my phone calls, the case made online is being ignored.  When going down to the post office in person I am met with hostility and aggression, not only at this location but at 250 St Joseph St, Mobile, AL 36601 as well. This is awful, we are torn apart by this and the post office has done nothing.

name: Dree Drum
text:
Leinkauf area Delivery Drivers Not Doing there Job
Here is Day 3 and My Package has yet another delivery Exception for the 3rd day now, everytime i go into office front desk tells me its on  the truck for redelivery ive always gotten my mail delivered around 3-4 pm deliver time has more than doubled lately see drivers sitting and chilling on there cellphones quite a few times....Peoples Packages are of importance

name: NiShawndra Henderson
text: I would appreciate mail carriers being more cautious AND abiding by traffic laws. Everyday, mail carriers in small vehicles and vans run stop signs and speed down Old Shell Rd. from the Springhill Ave location

name: Winston franks
text: On Tuesday June 2nd we were supposed to get a package but we did not get it the mail person claims that we got the package but we didn't we have informed delivery so we get notice of when we have mail coming and also packages so I made a complaint then I got an email so when saying that we got the package and it someone stole it and no one stole it from from the porch it should have been in the mailbox and the mailbox has a lock on now that means that they put it in someone else's mailbox then on Monday June 15th my mother was supposed to get Aiden letter from her church and it did not come I don't know what they're doing at their mailbox and how they keep misplacing mail or losing it I would rate them a zero if I could they are one of the worst post office about 2 months ago I had an issue with the mail lady she had a nasty attitude there's nothing had been done to her about it and apparently I cannot go to the mailbox because she claims she will not come if I go to the mailbox

name: Ann Vanderhart
text: I have lived in 4 States and the service and mail delivery from this Post Office  has been the absolute worst. Some days no delivery at all.  One Postal Person said our route did not have a dedicated carrier, so others had to pick up the slack.  And at times there was no one.

name: Bo Tucker
text: The line is usually pretty small, but there is typically only one person behind the counter. Dropping off prepaid packages is easy and quick because of close parking.

name: Tasha
text: Rude rude rude. Also, I went up there at 5:30 the other morning and the doors were locked.

name: D Nicole Lambert
text:
I believe the postal service has found a new way to get over on the consumers. If your postal inspector general says that your mail is not considered "mail" until it has been scanned into the office, but your postal clerks REFUSE to give consumers proof that they submitted a package, it means that the postal service does not have to pay claims to people when they lose their packages, because there is no way to prove that the package was even received by the post office. I think this is a way for the post office to get away with theft and neglect. This is the second time that I have taken my package into a post office and was told that I could not have a receipt. I have not received confirmation that my package was scanned. My last package was stolen and I was informed that I couldn't submit a claim because they never scanned my package in. So even though the clerk told me to leave it there, it ended up being my fault for leaving it, and the post office would not pull the film unless it was a threat. So I lost my money and items, and received a big fat F you from the post office. I know I walked into that office with three packages, and left with none. And my package was never found. The post office is wrong for this and this is exactly why you are loosing money.

Update...they did it again! I ordered boxes from the post office...online because you can get them FREE!!! Why did I go into the post office and the lady at the front desk attempted to CHARGE me for the box?!!!! Then said that she wasn’t going to ship my package unless I paid. I said lady you can’t charge me for a box I brought in myself!!!

name: Reese Barron
text: This post office is HORRIBLE!!!!!I went in to pick up a package and the lady I was talking to was acting all nonchalant and eating the whole time she was talking to me. And acted like she didn't want to go look for package. But thank goodness there was another worker there who overheard the conversation and went to go look for it.

name: Ray Spratlin
text:
Always have the worst experience at this location. I order online a lot and some packages eventually have to go through USPS. The delivery driver for my area is lazy, and will not get out of the truck to deliver packages. Sometimes they won't even put a notice in my mailbox that the package is being held at a nerby center, which is always this one sadly. They constantly lose mail and packages, and flat out refuse to help when looking for items when I go in. The worst incident happened between 3-12-19 and 3-14-19. Had a phone case from ottorbox sent through  FedEx, and they handed it off to USPS for residential delivery. My tracking # through FedEx said package was undelivered due to incorrect address. Blatant lie from USPS. When to this USPS center to try and retrieve my package. They woman at the customer service desk argued with me I had no package there. When asked to confirm my tracking number, they told me they were "unauthorized to release the package" even though I had several forms of prof it was mine. Funny how it was magically there now. I contacted Otterbox about the incident trying to find away to get my package, and even they where confused as to what was going on. They sent me copies of what I needed to have my package released to me from the USPS center, and now its magically not there again. Imagine that... Luckily Otterbox is replacing the case and paid for new shipping so it won't go through USPS this time.

Last time I checked, theft of mail is a federal crime in the U.S. I really don't understand how these employees still have a job, let alone not having charges brought against them.

AVOID THIS CENTER AT ALL COST!!!

name: fridaythe13thpartx
text:
Called regarding a package of registered mail....left me on hold for over an hour...nobody ever came back on the line to give a status update.
I actually drove down to the post office(still on hold mind you)spoke to someone in person then the manager who at least took down my contact info.
Still no word on where my registered package is or any update on its status for redelivery.Seems to be missing somehow.
I left the post office no more informed than when I arrived.
Was still on hold by the way.
If you have a choice don’t opt for USPS registered mail service for any delivery.

name: Angela Quarles
text: Expected an Amazon delivery at my business, which said it would be delivered by 8PM yesterday. No delivery, no mail. Clicked on track packages and it said business was closed, which means they didn't even try on a Saturday because my business was open from 9 AM to 9 PM

name: aaliyah kyles
text: It’s a shame but always in a our black community where he have so much disgusting staff. Really need to find new employees ASAP

name: SANDRA PRESCOTT
text: My postal carrier from this postal office does not pay attention to names and address on my mail. I receive mail that was supposed to be for my neighbors or business down the street. So, makes you wonder if I am receiving all of MY mail. She needs to take off her earphones and pay attention. If things don't get better I will file a formal complaint.

name: Brian Dunbar
text: The staff isn't very friendly, but it's a Post Office. They mail things. Haven't failed me yet. At the end of the day, they're there to drop your envelope in a bucket, not give you a high five and tell you your hair looks nice. And who knows? Maybe you needed to be knocked down a peg or two today and they did you a favor.

name: 56TheAnimal
text: So unhelpful everytime my mail woman Kennitha comes by she’s screaming and cursing at the top of her lungs into her phone headset and is impossible to reach for help.  Personal calls on the job are bad enough, but the constant cursing and yelling makes dealing with her impossible.

name: Tiffany Mack
text: This is the worst post office ever!!!!! They are so rude!!!! They ALWAYS loose ur packages & when you call to speak to a supervisor, they defend their carrier without getting your version of the facts. Everyone at this location should be fired. And hire ppl who actually do their jobs!!!!

name: Warren Stone
text: Nothing!!!! The mail carriers are slow as hell, in my area. The houses are about 5ft apart and you have to drive to every house. Some are wasting gas and damn lazy. They need to have a physical fitness exam for that job. Our money we'll spent. Hell no!!!

name: Ben Masab
text: Trashy and ghetto. No respect for theirselves or the community. Unproffesional

name: Jaheim Bell
text: Delivered 2/3 of my packages and all we’re supposed to come on the same day and lied and said it was delivered

name: Liz
text: Why does the website say they open at 8:00, but Im here at 8:25 and the doors are locked.. service is okay... sometimes..

name: Rameh Khazen
text: This post office is terrible. Highly likely you will be shot going to it, so don't go at night. Two people have been murdered in the parking lot in the last few years. Also, the postal workers don't care if the mail gets delivered or if you get any help at all. I've had multiple issues with them. I use to ONLY use USPS and now I only use it when I have too. Such a shame when people have no pride in their work.

name: Steven Evans
text: Worst customer service ever. Packages never come on time.

name: Jeremy Kervin
text: No one's in a hurry

name: Joann White
text: Very nice. Staff was kind and helpful. They also had many options of snacks and drinks many other gas stations do not provide.

name: Kristy Weaver
text: I cannot say enough nice things about this Raceway! The new store manager that took over last has really turned the store around.  They opened up a kitchen and the food is amazing! text: I was in search of a payday loan and came across Advance America on yesterday. I walked in and was warmly welcomed by Kanisha. name: Bizizbiz Bam
text: For the first time in 30 years my package has vanished.... did someone retire or what????

name: Christine Ginty
text: I never had an issue until today. The mail carrier is usually very nice. But today, I guess they were too tired to knock on the door to deliver my parcel from England that I've been waiting for all day. There were two adults and a teenager at home yet somehow none of us heard the mail carrier knock on the door? Very unlikely. Now my options are to take off work to go pick it up or arrange to have it re-delivered so that they can be too lazy to actually deliver it again. Awesome. Thanks a lot.

name: James Peterson
text: I use to receive my packages on time. I have been ordering online a bit more since covid, but when I receive the tracking info, it never comes when tracking says. Use to it would be before the tracking schedule. I guess they’ve just gotten lazy. I’m not sure but when I pay for something, I don’t appreciate a business not being professional with it. Especially with how much those mail carriers make. My recent package was delivered on October 6th to the New Market USPS and was suppose to be delivered the 8th. Today is the 14th and I have yet to receive this package. My last package they held for 2 weeks because I have dogs (THAT WERE INSIDE) without sending a notice or anything. Ya I’m a little angry about it.. I’ve actually had my carrier tell me they’re all upset because Amazon is shipping packages through them instead of fedex.. still they get paid to do it and I paid for my product that hasn’t been received because of USPS not because of the company ordered through.. I just wish they’d do their job!

name: Sherrie Merriman
text: Do not know why so many bad reviews! We have extremely good interactions with staff and mail carrier. We travel a lot and they are always kind about holding mail while we are gone. Vickie our mail carrier is awesome. And the lady and gentleman at post office have been very helpful! We are moving out of state and will miss their personal touch!

name: Mitch Schors
text: I have always been very satisfied with New Market Post Office and the delivery staff working out of there. I have packages and my mail delivered on time, the same time roughly, every day. My mailman is even courteous enough to apply postage stamps to my outbound mail if I leave him change in the mailbox. Now that is going over and above the call of duty for your customers and I am very thankful.

name: Jennifer Hatfield
text: Couldn't ask for better people they all are wonderful and my mail carrier is the best

name: Ray Griffin
text: The USPS has a simple job to COMPLETE the task concerning my mailbox.Deliver the mail and PICK UP the mail. I'm assuming delivery is a given because I guess I typically receive mail but it is beyond me why I can't get my outgoing mail picked up !!  FLAG FLAG FLAG FLAG it just doesn't get any easier than that!! It's random but enough to be a nuisance. When I place a piece of mail in the box and RAISE THE FLAG the least I expect is the mail is picked up.I REALIZE that socially the world and mail itself is leaning toward electronical avenues but "snail mail" keeps people employed and mouths fed so you would think rural route workers could simply do the easy task at hand and be grateful for having a job.Anyway a note to my mail carrier: IF MY FLAG IS UP PLEASE PICK UP MY MAIL !! Please note I gave a 1 star because 0 stars wasn't available.

name: Mike Tucker
text: Ordered package from Amazon.  Post office made no attempt to deliver,  instead left note in mailbox item was too large for delivery and would have to be picked up at New Market post office.   REALLY???  Perhaps Amazon should use UPS or FedEx who have delivery drivers who actually deliver packages.

name: Charlie Smitherman
text: This doesn't reflect on the post office it self, rather their delivery staff.  I'm not sure if this person has some sort of vendetta against me personally or not. However, they are always leaving notes in our mailboxes indicating service will be stopped if numbers aren't posted on mailbox when they are already clearly posted on each house. Recently they refused delivery because a car was parked three feet from the box ( I measured it) I know they refused because it was indicated that the reciptical was BLOCKED yet the next day they delivered the package to the front door. Aren't theses people supposed to be public servants. Our's sure isn't. We sure do miss the person that serviced us before and desperately wish they would come back. Just thought you would like to know.......

name: Crystal Preston
text: We were attending my son's football game when a package was attempted to be delivered. Originally it was coming via UPS but instead they dropped it at the post office. I called that Saturday concerned because it contained parts to repair my husband's truck and they were closed. We needed these parts so he could go to work on Monday and the lady brought them back out to us!

name: Jeremy R
text:
Packages "Out for Delivery" don't get delivered on time.

Mailbox will be empty for 2-3 days straight then will be overstuffed with mail.

Package pickup request, may or may not be picked up.

Parcels are often left on steps so they can get rained on, instead of walking another three feet to put them on the porch.

text: RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL my girlfriend had a several packaged delivered to our address before and no problem but now this carrier claims that we provided the wrong address so our item was sent back . When she asked why did our other packaged make it but this one since they were on the same order but in different boxes the employee was rude and careless she got our info and nothing had been resolved since . We order things and expect them to be on time for a number of treasons and for this to happen with no explanation just shows they do this often .

name: Sonya Humphrey
text: Extremely rude employee and supervisor at 1:45 today.... terrible attitude and couldn’t answer questions.... extremely unhelpful, I’ll continue to go here since it’s close to my house, but the female supervisor and the particular lady today I will remember. I mean she was a perfect example of ignorance, I had to explain what a witness signature was.... I can’t believe there are federal employees this stupid and rude...

name: Joan Williams
text: This is the best one around here.

name: T Spencer
text: USPS as a whole is garbage but this location takes the cake. They are dishonest and willing to lie to upsell products and services. I went there on 12/22 to mail my earnest money for a house I was buying. I specifically asked the cashier if it could be guaranteed to be delivered by 12/25. Instead of her informing me that it could not and just advising me to get the regular mail delivery (as all packages would be delivered at the same time) she instead sold me expensive express 1 day delivery for 12/24 that was not guaranteed and even attempted to get me to pay an additional $10-$12 for guaranteed delivery on 12/23 while KNOWING THE ENTIRE TIME THAT IT WAS NOT POSSIBLE. After my earnest money did not arrive, I attempted to get a refund of the full price or at least the price difference in the two services and was told they would not give me anything for my troubles even though it was all caused by their dishonest employee. I hope that USPS as a whole gets shut down because its truly trash. A bunch of over paid people being lazy, dishonest and unwilling to truly help anyone outside of themselves. I suggest always using Fedex instead because its not worth the trouble you are sure to encounter dealing with USPS.

text: Packages constantly stolen by bham driver. But i got him this time. 2 packages were sent  to 2 different towns . In bham they got scanned and weight is showing the same. However , they both arrived empty. Its over 10.000 worth of brand clothing... the only place both packages crossed the path was on the truck from bham to hsv

name: Deb in Alabama
text:
CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EXCELLENT HERE!  This place is small with only 2 people working.  However, they are EXTREMELY helpful, friendly & don't make you feel "rushed".  I had a variety of things to send, both locally, in the US & internationally (Germany).

In particular, Ms. Laurie was very-very helpful & patient with me, which I can't express enough how grateful I am.  I also wanted some cute stamps & she showed me SEVERAL before I finally settled on the Scooby Doo ones (FUN)!

Long story short ...I like this location  because it's convenient.  I walked in expecting a long line, due to Christmas & was surprised that I was the only customer there (not for long though)!

Also, Ms. Sherrie was very helpful & answered a few questions I had about the shipping boxes.

SO BIG-BIG KUDOS TO MS. LAURIE & MS. SHERRIE ...they both greatly deserve it!

Have a blessed New Year!
