text: I know it was almost 430 and I was cutting it super close but they were locked up at 428. I really needed my sons medicine and they obviously were ready to go. I'm trying to pick this up because it was supposedly attempted to be delivered several times but no one ever came to my door.

name: Dorrell Perry
text: I understand the number goes not to office. But hours are posted.. service here is friendly, helpful. Never been long lines....so I am satisfied

name: Ryan Stonecipher
text: Delivery is terrible. The people show total disregard for the stuff they’re delivering. They should probably consider firing everyone and starting over.

name: Amy Murray
text:
I hate that I am required to even leave one star, because this location deserves no star. I cringe every time I receive a notification showing that a package is being delivered by USPS, because I know there will be an issue.
More often than not, I will receive a notification saying that a package has been delivered and left in the mailbox. Normally it is a box that would not have fit in the mailbox anyway. We always file a tracking complaint and will receive an email from this post office (George Todd Dr) saying that they will look into it and never hear another word. The package almost always mysteriously shows up the next day. We have stopped ordering supplements or vitamins through the mail, because every single order is marked delivered and then arrives a day or two later in an open box.
This is very concerning. Nothing is ever done. I have even complained to Amazon about this. Other carriers do not seem to have the same issue, UPS and FEDex deliver on time and in the rare case that there is an issue, they are honest and report a delay. This particular post office just lies.

name: Roderick Hall
text: Every experience I've had at this post office has been horrible. I honestly cringe every time I order a package and it says it'll be delivered by USPS,  because it's likely that I won't receive my package. The customer service is awful, the employees are very rude and don't care about giving customers the right amount of care that should be afforded to them. I understand things may be more stressful because of the pandemic but the service here is absolutely not acceptable. There needs to be a significant change to management.

name: Twyla Knight
text: Every time I go to this post office there is a long line and one worker. They need some additional workers given that they are located in a business area and covers a very broad area. Whoever is running this facility is not doing a very good job. Not everyone is management material.

name: Aggie Mae
text: Had a package marked as delivered on tracking (was late) but it was never received. This was the first incident I've ever had with USPS but with the COVID situation, things are getting messed up, and if they lose your package or deliver it to another address (who knows what happened), they will not rectify the problem but will only say they are sorry. Disappointed that I didn't get my package and they will only process claims if a package meets certain criteria. If not as in my case, you are so out of luck when they are the ones that dropped the ball.

name: Sonia R
text: Have not received 2 packages both of which had my medication in. I’ve opened cases but nobody there cares and they never answer the phone... ever. I’ve called hundreds of times. So I guess I’m just out of my money and my much needed prescriptions. Pretty typical of everything in Montgomery

name: Bethany Howard
text: The customer service rather it is face to face or over the phone is horrible. My packages are never delivered on time, ever and the post office will not leave a not whatsoever, and always hold my packages! The phone wait times are 45 to 60 minutes just to speak to a representative. Who ever is the manger of this postal office is doing a horrible job, just being completely honest here.

name: Grace Lim
text: THE WORST post office. Incompetent and unorganized. They're in a SEVERE need of a management change as soon as possible.

name: Morgan Taylor
text: I’ve ordered multiple items on amazon prime the last few weeks, and every single time they have been delivered by USPS, they have never arrived on time. They even mark my packages as having been delivered, and even SPECIFICALLY left in my mailbox. But no package will be in it. I ordered some items that I needed for my week long vacation, and I used amazon prime (with two day shipping), and I ordered my items a full week before my vacation. Not only did they not arrive on time, they were marked as “delivered” and left in my mailbox, but nothing was in there. I tried calling the number from the website the next day, and the number isn’t even in service. So I drove to the post office and they couldn’t find my package. So they lost it, but according to my amazon app, the mail carrier left it in my mailbox. I have NEVER had so many issues with any other service. I cringe when I see that my packages are going to be delivered by USPS because I know if they aren’t lost, they’ll be delivered late.

name: Josue Sanchez
text: They are making apartments residents pick up all packages at the post office.

name: Alma Bowen
text: Mail is not received daily as shown in the USPS.com.  Often, mail shown is NOT received nor sent back to the sender!  Where did it go?  Must be delivered in a hole or thrown in the garbage!!  Also, mail is not delivered in a timely manner.  I am currently writing a letter to the Post Master!  Hope it helps because verbal communication doesn't seem to work!

name: LM
text: Why aren't you working? Why is it not working properly?? Work correctly and be kind to your customers. Don't show laziness at work!

name: Mary L
text: If I could give them a negative star I would. At this post office they always put attempted deliver when they didn’t actually attempt anything and I’ve been dealing with a lost package issue since April of 2020 and still haven’t received a resolution. Every time I go there they say that they’ll call me and I never receive anything. I’ve opened a case to have my funds refunded and still nothing. The worst post office ever!!!

name: Mary Plemons
text: Postman is not able to get his key to fit or open our mailboxes at our apartment complex, so we havent gotten mail for several days! I am expecting my new checkbooks, bills to pay and important mail! Guess I will have to drive to the facility and see if I can pick it up?! Why does it take so long for him to get a new key? Someone said he had to write up a "report"!!??

name: Daniel Drew
text: A garbage location! Workers there act low class and rude, highly recommend doing business with FedEx and UPS instead of this place, and if you absolutely have to Go to another location!

name: Priya Dionne
text: If i could give this establishment negative stars I would. I had a package that was suppose to be delivered on May 9th. On May 13th I went to see about my package. The lady that was at the counter decided not to look for my package because there was "too much to look through." I heard plenty of people in the back that could have looked through the pile of packages. But she instead didn't want to do any work. I was told to leave my name and number to be notified of when they found my package. The next day my package was sent and returned because she didn't notify the next person coming in of the situation about my package. I wasn't told anything about it. I found out when I returned on the 19th I was given the entire run around and still haven't received my package. I am totally disappointed in the services that I received by this post office.

name: Garrett Weathers
text: I'd give zero stars because this place has lost my packages like 5 times. It has now been 2 weeks with nothing but a single update that they are investigating it no updates no anything. It is literally the worst post office I have ever used.. ever. Is it possible to get a different post office to deliver my mail? They won't even answer the phone.

name: Jon Seal
text:
I am attempted to receive a package.  This is generally something I expect to be able to do from the post office.
I found a reDelivery slip in my mailbox for a package requiring a signature that has a date & time stamp indicating that no one was available for signature, at a time when I was home, in my living room, 12 feet from the front door and working door bell.  I am confident that no actual attempt was made.
The hours on their reDelivery slip are incorrect and obviously have been for some time, as the correct hours are painted on their door.  I found that out when I attempted to pick it up myself.  Sure, I could have double checked online.  But, why would I question a document from the Post Office.  I guess my expectations were too high.
Two days into this process and the tracking number and QR code have still not been loaded into the USPS system so that I can even attempt to schedule a redelivery or pickup.
I don't need smiling customer service or nice ambiance.  I do need the post office to be able to deliver a package or let me go get it from them without this kind of ridiculousness.

name: Kimyarda Jones
text: I constantly receive re delivery slips when I work from home and am always available.   Multiple times I have watched the postal driver drive past after a re delivery confirmation was given with a request to beep the horn with my front door open and I was still not notified of my delivery ever.  This post office is a disappointment on many levels.

name: Carol Roberts
text: This is the Post Office for our neighborhood and we are blessed to have two wonderful mail carriers. They always make sure I get my packages and go above and beyond to help. The Post Office itself has a Saturday morning pick up for missed packages that I appreciate. The people there have always been helpful for me.

name: James Mcbride
text:
On 8/29/20
I received a package from the usps but wasn't home so i knew it was on the way so i sent my neighbor to check my box because they left one on top of my box before but heading down the road and this is how she found my package with people taking people items

name: Lori Weist (Lori D)
text: There needs to be a zero star option. Never a good experience. Negative attitudes. Today their system is down so I have to go to another post office. Also lines are always long. My least favorite place on the planet.

name: Megan Taylor
text: Lost a package for 3 weeks. I kept getting notifications that it was ready for pickup but everytime (3 in total) I went to the location to pick it up they said they couldn't find it and their system showed "in transit" but they couldn't tell me to where. Then randomly I get a delivery slip telling me I OWE $10 in postage.

name: Lakisha Harris
text: Mail is delivered to late

name: LeCretia Snow Middleton
text: The phone is always off of the hook. I placed a case and no one will do anything about a package that I still have no details about the location. I made a special trip to the location, left a message for the person in charge and still have not gotten a return message. This is absolutely ridiculous. I am so disgusted with the entire process.

name: Latrice Bradley
text: I was told on Friday that a package would be re-delivered when I called and gave them the missing suite number for my shipping address.  I called again today since I still had not received it and was told that it had been returned to sender the day before.  Both ladies I spoke to were nice and courteous.  But it would have been really great to get my package delivered as I was told I would.

name: Brandon Davis
text: Unhelpful and lost my package which is putting me out $700!

name: Katphishe #9749
text:
Expected Delivery Date: Nov. 14
Arrived at Post Office on Nov. 14 at 7:11 AM

Now, not only is it 12 hours later, but my package still reads a Nov. 14 expected delivery date.

This problem seems to stretch pretty much all across USPS. AAtleast shipping was free, albeit thanks to the website I ordered from, not USPS.

EDIT: Went from two to one stars as my package now has no expected delivery date, in contrast to yesterday. I plan to pick up the package from the post office myself.

name: Karen Taylor
text: Completely rude customer service. Cut me off and acted like i was a bother

name: Ryan Mac55
text: Never deliver before 5. Then have an attitude. Have had to stay at work until 8 more times than I can count to make sure I got a customers part. Can’t keep up with how much outgoing mail has been lost too. Look at the reviews it will tell you all you need to know.

name: Tara Rose
text: Horrible service. Not open for package pick up like they say on the back of the slip. Not even sure this is a real federal post office. Can’t believe they are allowed to operate this poorly!

name: EJ Marie
text: I'd I could rate it lower than a 1, I would. First of all, the mail is always delivered late!!! Who wants to wait until 6pm to mail? Furthermore, why don't they deliver packages correctly? It's always something or it's always late. I'm pretty sure people can track their packages & see that's it's been delivered to their post office! Just throw the whole post office & staff away!

name: Marla Johnson
text: I went there to sign up for a new mailbox at my new place. The staff was not friendly at all. Very rude! They had bad attitudes.I do not recommend anybody going there. Avoid this place if you can. When you ask a question, you have to repeat yourself as if they don't understand or you're not supposed to ask. They respond with an attitude. Very nonchalant!

name: Nadja Rhodes
text: I was supposed to have a package delivered before Father’s Day and it even said out for delivery. So when the mail came, i noticed that my package was not delivered. I went back to check online, and it said “held at post office at customer’s request.” I did not request for my package to be held. That wouldn’t make since if the package was already out for delivery.

name: Jessica B
text: Okay service, but the mail carrier at our apartment frequently puts mail in the wrong mailbox at our apartment complex. Residents and office staff have complained, but it doesn't do any good. They also seem to have a high turnover for mail carriers. The few times I have had to deal with the office staff, they have been pleasant. My most recent experiences have been better than the initial interactions.

name: Sharinell Lauderdale
text: Mail is not delivered in the Woodmere area some days.  Postman is not delivering mail on Saturday!

name: David Huneycutt
text: Holy s**t! If USPS was a private business, they would have been out of business a long time ago. Take the one star I give and subtract 6, that gives them a negative 5 stars, the most god awful service on the planet.

name: L Taylor
text: Second time a package has been marked as undelivered due to business closed. Time stamped when my business is open and people are here.  Says it will be delivered next business day and is never delivered.  I have to call the post office.  Then again complaining will do no good.  The people who do not do their job are not in any way disciplined.  In the real world doing business like this would mean me being out of business.

name: Kasey Dixon
text: Worst post office I’ve had to deal with in the entire United States. Constantly deliver to incorrect addresses, sometimes don’t even attempt to deliver at all because they are lazy. Terrible customer service. Should be disbanded.

name: Alexis Hughey
text: I was supposed to have my package on Friday. I watched the mail lady at the mail box, but she never stopped by to bring my package. I waited at home all day for my package and then I look online at my  delivery process and it said I was not home for the delivery or the business was closed. I was so pissed. So I called the post office and she goes "it says it was for pick up" then places me on hold then comes back and says " oh we sent it out for delivery". They left no slip or nothing. I think they just didn't want to go door to door because it was a Friday.

name: S Rogers
text: Reading is fundamental!  This post office is pitiful!  The mail often get delayed and the carriers from this location that deliver to my neighborhood, are ALWAYS putting mail in the wrong boxes!!! The addresses are clearly marked on the packages, however somehow they still put it in the WRONG BOX and it ends up being sent back which delays it even longer!!! Is it really that hard!!!! If you don't want to work, quit so someone that can read can do the job!

name: Natquellia Dailey
text: This is the worst!! Post office I've ever been too! I went in to get a mail box key made. The lady put my name in the book and said come back Friday. I went back that following Monday, there was no key made and no request in the book.  The same day I ask can you please put my address in the book? they weren't  taking any key request bc they have no lock.! The lady suggested that I call everyday to see if they have any locks. Each time I call I'm on hold for An hour! I hate that my apartment company deals with this post office !

name: Walter Gibson
text: I had a certified letter sent from Montgomery Alabama (next day), mail to Copperas Cove Texas, and it still hasn't arrived as of May 6th. Once I called I was told the package is in transit, after 10 days you have got to be kidding me !!! The worst experience I have ever had from (ANY) post office. Come on Alabama, we here in Texas are not impressed!!!

name: Vann Montgomery
text: If only there were an option for less stars like perhaps 0!!!

name: Megan Liu
text: Terrible! You may or may not get your packages! They always say they leave a notice but never do and then your packages fall somewhere unknown to any of the employees. Good luck trying to get the manager to help find your missing items, everything is always misplaced. I actually called ahead, they said my package was there and when I showed up no one could seem to find it so I had to wait yet again. I've been waiting over a month for a signature required letter from the state and still have not heard anything from them since I requested redelivery a month ago. Absolutely the worst post office ever!! If they could have negative stars I'm sure they would!

name: Larry Summons
text: Package was supposed to be delivered Monday May 14th, package was delayed. Called the office numerous times with no call back or additional information. Went in person on May 16th and received no information just that they are out to "find" the package. This is gross negligence and extremely unprofessional, how does the sole responsibility of the post office turn into the thing they can not accomplish? How does a 12lb package disappear? The driver or car 73 at this location apparently lost 3 packages... how do you lose three packages when it is your profession to deliver said packages? It defies logic.

name: Tameria Mosley
text: The supervisor there has a nasty attitude. I don't know if your having a bad day but one little question shouldn't have ticked you off that bad. I asked if she could do one simple thing and she acted like she was going out of her way and like I had insulted her by asking for a supervisor not know that it was her. She wasn't helpful or understanding and I'll be speaking to her service manager about her terrible customer service.

name: Neal Smith
text: After I waited in line and got to the next teller the lady spent a half hour trying to find my package. She asked me 3 times for my address of where the attempted delivery was made. After 30 minutes she told me that today's carrier took it out for delivery. That is not what the certified mail pink ticket said that was on my door. It clearly said that it would be at that post office.

name: Amanda Gray
text: Email said they attempted to deliver my package twice (someone was home both times) no package, no slip at the door and called to speak with someone. Told me I would receive my package the next day(didn't happen) and no slip again. Mail carrier will not deliver to the door at my apartment complex.

name: Jeffery’sGirl Friday
text: Absolutely the rudest employee  I’ve ever dealt with. The male employee working inside has a rotten attitude and never has anything nice to say unless you are same race as him. It doesn’t matter how nice you are to him either! Avoid this place if at all possible.

name: Greg Black
text: They don't answer the phone... how do you expect to stay in business when you will not answer the phone.

name: Jon Marshall
text: I went in without my pick up slip, just the tracking #.  They located the package within about 30 seconds and gave it to me with a smile.  Other customers in line seemed to be very happy with the service as well.

name: Asiah Stanton
text: Called them 17 times and someone kept picking up and hanging up in my face. waiting for mail from the being of November to be delivered it’s the 14

name: Nolan Odom
text: The most unreliable Post Office I have ever done business with. I have had multiple packages come through this office and each time, they're either delivered to the wrong address, sent back to the sender, or I was left a notice on my door about needing to go to the post office to pick it up, only to get there and be told that they don't have it or they can't find it. If it all possible, DO NOT go through this post office for the delivery of packages any larger than an envelope.

name: KaDi
text: I wish I could give this post office 0 stars! Service here is HORRIBLE!

name: Elijah Lofgren
text: No problems picking up package/letter.

name: Charles Mann
text: Lagoon park branch has a rude female working there. Fire her !!!

name: Jasmine Austin
text: The drivers are VERY lazy. They pick and choose where they’re gonna deliver at.

name: Charles Heringer
text: Probably the worst PO in the United States. Never answers the phone and the customer service is horrible.

name: Tina Crowell
text: Been waiting 3 days for my apt key and paying $25 for it. 3 days later... still no key even though it was promised the next day. The staff is horribly rude  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

name: Trissue Hall
text: They never answer the phone when I call it's been a week since I been calling I decided to drop everything I was doing today just to see if I get a answer it's 3:51and still no anewer what's the use of this location it need to be only for picking up package.

name: Emily McGowan
text: This post office is stupid and don't do their job. They can not delivery my packages right. If they don't feel like doing their job they say they can't find your address. You are the POST OFFICE YOU DO MAIL so why can they not find my address for my packages?

name: D H A ReelProdiiG
text: Been Trying To Get My Apartment Mailbox Key For Months & They Keep Saying Come Back Another Time . I've Had It With Them

name: Tawanna Harris
text: I hate this post office the carrier for my area is very rude and they stay misplacing packages or mail. Carrier even gave my package to a neighbor without my permission smdh

name: Kirsten Barnes
text: I like this post office.

name: Anthony Waters
text: My phone said a notice was left for my package... no notice, I was home. And now the lady can’t find my package... I think she stole it !

name: Keisha Briggins
text: I went to this Post office two days in a row only to read a sign that said,”No money orders as of right now!” I asked the clerk if they were still out of money orders today and the reply was,”Yes ma’am, we’ll be out until next week!” Unbelievable

name: Chris Lynch
text: Routinely the worst customer service in town, and they almost always find a way to screw up delivery of special packages inbound from international locations.

name: Josh Cordova
text: Very poor service and the delivery takes forever...

name: Chad Simmons
text: Would not accept my mail without a return address. Return addresses are not a requirement of the USPS.

name: Paula Harris
text: Mail

name: Will B
text: I wish I had another post office...

name: miguel montse
text:
Horrible service .
I called on 09/13/2016 at 4:02 pm to make a complaint that I was not receiving all my mails and that the mail man threw my mail box ,the person that answer the phone made me wait for 15 mins and then hung up ,I could heard saying and complaining about her job that she was not supposed to be there ,if you're not happy with your job you should quit ,you don't bring your problems to your work place.

name: J Park
text: Horrible service

name: Debby Dahl
text: I receive other people's packages and mail and my mail and packages aren't being delivered to me. I have filed 2 complaints on USPS website.  An employee left a message for me at work but I have yet to get anything but a busy signal.   This is my second experience trying to have the USPS do their job.

name: Janice Howard
text: The manager was very professional yet friendly and explained everything completely.

resp.text: - Thank you for your feedback regarding our loan and money services.   Our Gadsden location appreciates your business!

name: Jc Pace
text: Customer service is outstanding. Friendly staff.

resp.text: Jc  - Thank you for your feedback regarding our loan and money services.   Our Gadsden location appreciates your business!

name: Rhiana Higginbotham
text: Terrible customer service EVERY. TIME.I. GO. Used my entire 1hour lunch plus 15mins more just to process my very simple payday loan when I was the first & nearly only customer in there...& STILL couldn't finish process. Did not count my money back out to me. Just jammed it in the register. Employee's walk around barefoot. Will not re loan here.

resp.text: Rhiana  - Thank you for your feedback regarding our loan and money services.   Our Gadsden location appreciates your business!

name: Deborah Loyd
text: Love this place!!!     The girls are super nice always going above & beyond to take care of you!!    I would recommend them highly if you need quick cash

name: susie jackson
text: Marka and the ladies there are spectacular! Nice people and super friendly service. If you ever need some help this is your place.

name: Lucas Renfrow
text: Great customer service!

resp.text: Lucas  - Your business is important to us, thank you for your review of our Gadsden location!

name: Meagan Rice
text: Lovely people and always smiling! Love all these ladies!!

resp.text: Your business is important to us, thank you for your response!

name: Anthony Morgan
text: These ladies are great & always helpful.

name: Alabama's Finest
text: FAST and FRIENDLY service. What more can you ask for?! Didn’t have to wait in line long and staff was magnificent! Will continue to use this location AND it’s clean!!!

name: Sherry B
text: Fast, efficient, and friendly service!! I was in and out within a couple of minutes. Can't go wrong with fast service. No one likes to stand in line for a long time. Will definitely continue to use this Post office.

name: M Jefferson
text: Stopped here to get some shipping supplies and info for EDDM. Spoke with the Postmaster and she was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable. Not to mention, the office is very clean and quiet.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
YEAH IT'S GOING TO BE A LONG REVIEW SORRY.
I never thought I'd review a PO, but after today's experience I have to leave this review. Normally I have received AWESOME service at the Brookwood location from the nicest people you can imagine. However, today, Tuesday August 4th 2020, we (husband and I) went to the PO around 9 a.m. to send off a package and the young lady that we dealt with was SO EXTREMELY RUDE...for no reason whatsoever. Just last week my husband had to send off something else and the lady that helped him was SO nice; she helped him seal it correctly and as is normal with NICE and FRIENDLY people/employees, she informed him of when the package should arrive, other details, etc. Today was the complete opposite. I don't know if she was having a bad day or what but she was so rude to us. We realized that the package needed some tape on it (we just come home from the hospital from surgery in the package was in the car and we realized that we should stop by the post office but we saw that it needed to be taped up more...which is usually no big deal) and she literally asked us to pay for the tape....I believe she said "if it's not Priority Mail then you will have to pay for the tape." Which yes of course it was Priority Mail, but she hadn't even bothered to ask at this point. However no worries to you Miss Rude Employee... IF IT HAD NOT BEEN PRIORITY MAIL I/WE WOULD HAVE BEEN WILLING TO PAY THE $0.25 or $5 WORTH OF A FEW PIECES OF TAPE.

Anyway, Little Miss Friendly taped it up herself in a messy way of course because it must have really been putting her out from sitting at her seat drinking her drink that she had to put down to "help" us (if that's what you want to call being helped). However with that attitude there was no way we'd dare say anything to her. She flung the receipt and said "here ya go." No, "have a good day," or "thank you," ...nothing.

Folks we're in a different time right now with Covid-19 and there are a lot of people who would like to have a job and having one with the USPS is a very good one so if you don't want to do a job that deals with the public because you're rude and you have an attitude- DON'T DO IT! NO ONE MADE YOU COME TO WORK. ALSO remember that you never know what someone may have been through right before they came in the door. You get more flies with honey than you do with vinegar.

name: J. Jackson
text: Fast and friendly staff. It's also very clean!

name: Melissa Martin
text: Beware of no knowledge of postal activity/rates at this office .   Was told a package destination Mexico would be $96 for the least expensive option.  Went to Peterson with the same package and charged $27.  Crooks???  Or just no knowledge???  Not sure???

name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: Who leaves a review on a post office? I usually never would but these are the nicest people you could meet! Very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. Always get in and out, never pressure you to buy anything you don't need or to ship things more expensive than you have to. Thank you for this wonderful Post Office that is convenient, friendly and the best! Also, I know as for my carrier, I never have packages stolen or missing, she remembers the people on her route! Edit in June 2020, what has happened to this post office?! And I'm not referring to the Covid19 times! I understand that and by no means am referring to this time but it started before that. It seems there is new staff 🤦🏻‍♀️

name: Jamie Dawson
text: Small town, Nice People

name: Vic Scott
text: The whole Tuscaloosa post office is fraudulent. They are stealing packages. They are opening them up and putting in the mailbox. I have been experiencing this since December. I have lost so much money because Amazon refuses to use another Carrier! There is no real person to talk to, There is nothing being done about this issue. They need to screen these employees better than this. This would never happen in Washington DC. I just chalk it to people who never had anything life so they talk from others! The while post office needs to be under investigation in Tuscaloosa

name: Tera B
text: Would never go here again if I had the choice. As the others have said, be prepared to wait in line 45 minutes minimum. They regularly have 15+ people in line and only one person at the counter. I have to wait to pick up mail too big for a company P.O. Box, on company time. It’s beyond frustrating.

name: Janet Morgan
text: I have tried calling the post office about my missing package. They do not answer the phone. According to them, my package was delivered to my door on March 10, 2021. I checked my camera and no package.

name: Christi Jones
text: Not receiving all of my mail recently even though it has my correct address on it.  But they can certainly drop off mail for past residents. Tried to get help at the P.O. but the lady was not helpful (polite though).

name: kathryn wilkerson
text: There is a minimum wait of 45 minutes every time I come here. One person working, and I feel so sorry for her. Skyland branch.

name: Charles Krueger
text: Worst post office ever. I thought Tuscaloosa was a major city but every time I'm here there is one, sometimes two people working. It's the weekend and only one person working.  Also last two days (that I'm aware of) the internet is down, so no credit transactions and no tracking info available..

name: Dubbbz Master
text: They cannot deliver a package to my apartment to save their lives. They never bother bringing it inside to the office so I can get it later, but instead leave me re-delivery slips and every time I fill one out by hand or online, it never gets re-delivered. If I could give them less than 1, I would.

name: Jacob (Jake) Reed
text: Be prepared to wait at least a week for mail to arrive at your location, if it ever does. It took 2 weeks for mail to be delivered to me from a town about an hour away. Please avoid this post office at all costs!

name: Crystal B
text: The worst won’t even answer the phone. I hate they try to make u put a star when one is not even deserved..

name: Rosey Red
text: My rating is a negative star! I’ve had several packages missing. They messed up my PO Box payment and locked my box and it had been paid up to six months! I had to go in and show my payment receipt and find my mail!!!! Now they have miss placed several of my packages and they show they have been delivered to my box. I have several months left on my PO office box and I’m afraid to receive mail because they’re taking the packages!!!!

name: Nina Ashborro
text: My package has been sitting in this post office for the last ten days. I got confirmation by ups that it had been transferred to the post office (usps) for delivery, and have attempted to get in touch with to office to no avail. The woman I spoke to at UPS literally told me "good luck", getting my package. My latest expected delivery date was December 2nd, and the ordering company can't get in touch with them either. No idea what to do, as I'm missing several packages that I ordered for the holidays for my family. Now I need to sort through all tracking numbers and see how many others they potentially lost or dropped the ball on. Also has anyone found a way to actually contact them, without getting put on hold, then hung up on. I would rate 0 stars if I could; messenger pigeons might be a more efficient use of government funding and resources.

name: Rowboat (Rowboat)
text: This is the armpit of post offices. If you don't have a minimum of 45 minutes to wait in line then go to a different post office.

name: John O'Mahoney
text: Our mail lady is from this location. She just waved at us as she put our post into the mailbox. Checked the mail, it was a “sorry we missed you card.” The laziness is unreal.

name: Elaine Singletary
text: Don’t know if it’s this post office or USPS in General but I had a package leave North Carolina on Dec 4th and arrive in Atlanta on the 5th. It  arrived in Birmingham on the 6th and according to the tracking information, left that day in route to the final destination (Tuscaloosa). It’s now the 14th and I still don’t have it.  They need to make the USPS part of the military and assign soldiers to perform its duties. I’ll bet we get things straightened out then.

name: brendan roach
text: If you can avoid this waste of space United States postal service do it at all costs I have now had three different packages with my address and unit number on them sent back because the person they have delivering the packages cannot read the unit number after the address. a fourth package I actually managed to get to the post office before they returned it where I pointed out that in the address it had the unit number on it after the manager got smart with me saying it wasn't on there. ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE

name: Sydnee
text: My package has been sitting there over a week and nobody answers the phone at this location. Just terrible

name: Charles Nevels
text: I have had a post office box with the U.S. post Office since 1982 and have maintained the same box number since then.  Originally it was at Alberta station and then combined moved to  the Skyland branch in the last year to 2 years the service has steadily declined.  This is a business box and I have had over 20 checks not get delivered from various sources.  I have also had registered mail that I had never received a notice on or that I came to pick up and could not be found.  The most recent 1 was from the Department of Justice involving investigation at a nursing facility I work with.  I have also received packages that were 3 to 4-month-old apparently had been sitting at the post office all that time. by my box is full  my mail is placed in a male tub for me to pick up but recently when I have gone and ask for the male I have been told that no one was available in the back to give it to me and they would not go from the front desk to get it for me though I may awaited in line for 25 minutes to get to the desk.  Another point they told me to Bang on the door out by the boxes and I did but no one ever came to help me.  On 1 occasion someone came to the door but said they were allowed to do that or give me my mail.  I have tried calling both the branch supervisor and the postmaster with no response.  I have also asked to speak to the branch manager while in the post office and they called him any never came out to talk to me.

name: Cody Clements
text: Watched the driver drive up to my mail box look and drive away, later usps said my package wasn't delivered due to my mailbox being inaccessible. Again watch her look and drive off. Plus I have to video on my security camera. Will be sending to corporate. Had to delay a project due to her. Cost me 1000s from one part.

name: Jennie
text: Claimed to have delivered a package to my son; within 4 hours, same package was ready for "pick-up" at the Skyland P.O. Never has a package that has truly been delivered been ready for pick-up in that time frame (same day) at a post office. Four days later (after Labor Day holiday), this same post office claims the package is not there (and that it must be at the 35401 facility) even though tracking says it is and that it is available for pick-up at the 35405 P.O. Never seen such incompetency!

name: Mike Meadows
text:
No mail again today !
This is ridiculous.
I have had to redistribute mail to other houses
In my neighborhood for several weeks.
Could you please hire individuals that can
read !

name: M
text:
Past three deliveries I was supposed to get from this post office were either lost or stolen from this post office.
Order 1: A shipment from Amazon from a third party seller, claimed as lost by the USPS and received a refund from Amazon. Never delivered.
Order 2: An order from a third party Ebay seller that was only misaddressed by a letter (my address has an East at the end of it and the person who was sending it accidently forgot to put it there.) Instead of leaving the box for me to pickup, the item was returned to send by USPS.
Order 3: An order from Amazon again, a small package. Had a roommate go over to figure out hat happened to order 2, and they saw order 3 IN THE CLERK'S HANDS but because it was addressed to me. The next day I showed up before closing time to pick it up and the person in charge was extremely reluctant to help (closing time, I get it) and while I was polite and calm about it asking what was happening to my package, the clerk was unhelpful and only after asking to please help did they do it. Order 3 was labeled as 'with USPS carrier' meaning that the package was en route to delivery. Later that night, the package was deemed lost.

Point being: this post office is incompetent and has continued to lose packages over the past month. Tread carefully.

name: Meme Credit
text: Literally the WORST. I tried getting in touch with someone at this post office because my package was accidentally sent to the wrong  address. I am unfortunately living in Kansas and needing help since I no longer live in Tuscaloosa. I called the number provided and it rang for a good 2 mins. When I called again it was like someone answered and took the phone off of the line so it’s just beeping now. So frustrating when someone could answer to help with a small question that I have

name: Cameron Oswalt
text: The people working at the counter are just bitter. That's the only way I can explain it.  Avoid this place no matter what

name: Bill Pate
text:
I just went to this PO to buy stamps. Ten persons were in line ahead of me and when no one was attending I asked where were the desk workers. I was told they left at 3:00 to have lunch and said they would be back at 4:00. After a few more minutes of waiting I left with most of the other customers.
Terrible supervision! Fire this Postmaster!!!

name: Ashlee René Thompson
text: I wished that I could rate this post office with no stars. It is horrible. Lazy drivers, never answer the phone, and don't care about anyone's packages. Worst experience moving here was the post office!

name: Shadowstalker09
text: Delivery drivers cannot read or they refuse to read delivery instructions.  Refused to try and bring the package back to the house. They also refuse to answer the phone when you call the office and will let it ring for around 10 minutes untill the system hangs up the phone

name: Ethan Leonard
text: I needed to drop a package off. I already had postage and a label on it. I literally just needed to sit it on their counter because they won't let you stick it in the box in the lobby if it's over 13 ounces. I came in right at closing which was the quickest I could get there. A lady that looked like the manager barely looked at me and said "closed" Then shut and locked the door in my face. Other people were in line being helped so I loudly explained through the door I just needed to sit it on the counter. I figured she would let me do that since I didn't need to pay for anything or talk to someone behind the counter. Instead of replying, she turned her back to me! I understand that it was right at closing but she could have been way nicer about the situation.

name: Primetimesha
text: Only one person working up front an it's very slow!

name: Henry Wright
text: Older lady with long hair and glasses was very unprofessional and made me feel very targeted.

name: Patrick Hall
text: Worst customer service, worst ran business, rude incompetent employees. This why we should never rely on the government, absolutely horrendous. It should be closed down or at least every person that is employed there terminated and replaced with new and start over.

name: Cynthia McAdams
text: The mail use to arrive at 11am., then 12 pm, now 5pm. Do not get all your mail or you get someone else.  I had register letter,  they did not come to the door or blow the horn. Just left a notice. So I fill it out , they left the notice still in the box.  The skyland has fallen down on their job or just do not care.

name: Little Sandy Glass
text: No one answers the phone there. So after calling many times and eventually my call just gets dropped, I went in to ask which side of the street they want my new mailbox on. Miss Candace said she would have to check with the carrier and get back to me. When asked she said that would be later that day. She never called me back. And they won't answer the phone. I guess I will have to go stand in line for another 30 minutes and try again to get an answer.

name: Lindsey Bowden
text: The worst place ever!!!! They are currently marking packages as delivered that have not been delivered, which is completely against protocols. They frequently deliver packages to the WRONG address. They NEVER answer the phone, I called 30 times with no answer! Packages are constantly “lost” or “unable to locate at this time” I can’t wait to move and no longer have this facility as my mail carrier. Completely incompetent!!!!

name: V Robinson
text: This post office is by far the worst and the drivers are sorry and lazy....

name: Dequita Manuel
text: I went to this office to pick up my mail that was on hold for my new address,I’ve been going for the past week and they keep telling me that i don’t have any mail,the supervisor called the delivery driver and told him to pull my mail and bring it back to be placed on hold, i went back the next day to check for mail and the mail clerk told me there’s no mail, but i know that I’ve had mail for the past week or so,I’m expecting important mail and they continue to be rude after standing in line for almost an hour!! They’re rude and have poor Customer service!!

name: Kid Weezy
text: Operator tells me to stay on the line but the car disconnect before anybody can answer

name: Felicia Green
text: Mail clerks r very rude towards customers that need help with packaging especially the white lady with gray brownish hair .

name: Nick Chichester
text:
Two service reps behind the counter on arrival.
Line to the door. One goes to lunch.
Counter productive to customer service.

name: Melinda Pigott
text: I came home to find four packages shoved into my mailbox - absolutely smashed into my mailbox - wrinkling and bending all of my letter mail.  This is absolutely unacceptable!  While these items may hold little to no value to the postal carrier - they do hold value to my family.

name: Kristen
text: You have to scour the internet in order to get the actual phone number for this location, otherwise you'll call the national customer service number, sit on hold for an hour, and they'll do nothing for you. Took calling 6 times before someone answered. They don't deliver your mail properly, don't leave a notice when they attempt to deliver a package, and then have no idea where it went after that.  Now I'm out $50. Thanks

name: JoZay Long
text:
This is the worst post office I have ever been in! They have been giving me the run around about my mailbox key for 2.5 months!!!! Now, my mail is not being held anymore and my packages have been sent back!.

Update 3.5 months still no key!

name: Levetta Bias
text: No help at all. I moved recently and I had just renewed my license. The license place said they hadnt received it, so I called to see if they still had it. The lady didn't even try to look. She just said it MAY be on its way back. Thanks for nothing.

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Phone number is not to local post office and does not give you what you need nor let you speak to a real person. Waist of time to call

name: Janecia Bennett
text: Supervisor Candice nonchalant. After waiting 20 minutes for package to be located, driver continued to walk past me with item in hand as if it was still being searched for. Great customer service starts at the top, so poor service from this location is to be expected.

name: Abby Lindsey
text: This is the worst post office in the United States. The mail carrier has lost my package FOUR TIMES and did not work to help find the package. The line is always long inside of the building and the workers are extremely rude.

name: Angie Nicolletta
text: 8 people in line and only one attendant. It's not an in and out stop. Make sure you give yourself 20 mins.

name: Colby Henry
text:
Summary: Ordered ~$900 ring only to have it "lost" when it was out for delivery. Do NOT send valuables through this service. Request UPS or FedEx instead.

I have the unfortunate luck to have this office service our location. My roommates and I have had issues with packages not being delivered before, and the only way of resolving this issue is to go to the office (they will NOT answer the phone). After waiting in line, you will be told something along the lines that you weren't home, or that no one answered the door. This is completely false, as we will usually be waiting for the knock.

I ordered a university class ring from Balfour. They shipped it via USPS. I should mention that they do not have an automated system to email package tracking numbers (really guys?). More than enough time had passed to make and send the ring, so I called to check on its status. They claimed that it had been sent 3 weeks before my call. I was dumbfounded, but asked for them to send me the tracking number so that I could follow up on it. Checked the status of the package: Out for Delivery. They could have "lost" the package, but I find that highly improbable if it made it all the way here with no issues.

Attempted calling, to no avail. I then visited their office, only to be told that they couldn't find it. I was also asked repeatedly why I had waited so long to notify them (it had been an hour since I found out). I had to repeatedly explain the situation to each person and it seemed as though they just couldn't grasp it. I finally gave up after some weak promises of finding it. I called Balfour and notified them of the situation so that they could start working on things from their end.

I then called the USPS service number. I was on hold for 55 minutes before speaking to a representative. He was very helpful with setting up a case with the missing package and assigning the task to one of the location supervisors. I requested that they contact me through email so that I would have documentation of our conversations. Long story short, they couldn't find it.

name: ALexus Horn
text: They Lost my package! Had to go up there several times and call for them to tell me they couldn’t find the package. I’ve never had mail become misplaced or lost. Went to file a claim online and it told me that my package wasn’t eligible for one because I didn’t purchase insurance.Very disappointed and will try to avoid my mail coming through them ever.

name: Brittany Ray
text: I always have a pleasant experience here, and I ship out packages very often. The staff has always been really sweet and even helps me figure out how to cut costs if I need a cheaper way to ship.

name: Des Owino
text: I've call the post office about my package but nobody answers the phone. I've called 3 times in one day and nobody picks up the phone. Very unprofessional and employee work ethic is pathetic. I'll suggest for new customers to visit another post office and avoid this one.

name: Benita Gibbs
text: Call and call and call and no one ever answer the phone.

name: Brooke Mitchell
text: This place sucks

name: Rose A
text: Mail carrier comes to my neighborhood when its convenient  for her. No mail carrier should be still be delivering mail at 5:00 p.m.

name: Nia M
text: This is a terrible post office. I sent off my text books to be returned to get my money back. The company said they never received it so I was overcharged a fee. I called and asked to speak to Sharon the manager but she couldn’t come to a resolution. This is a terrible post office everyone is rude and incompetent of doing their job. They honestly need to clean out the whole post office and replace everyone single body in management/ supervisory position. Oh let’s not forget James Campbell will lie through giant dirty teeth, so don’t even ever talk to him. Last but not least Jaslyn the Guinne pig is so clueless idk how she even got management position she can’t even spell manage. Don’t born come here worst post office ever.

name: Brett Billings
text: Item shows delivered although it was not. Called them and they basically accused my wife of lying, theft, fraud, etc. Completely rude and unnecessary. I absolutely would never employ anybody who acted in that manner regardless of the circumstances. We receive at least 2-3 packages per week from USPS, UPS, or FedEx and this is the first time an item has been lost. You would think from talking to the lady at USPS that we were trying to defraud the government of millions. It was a $10 item. I can get over losing a $10 package. I'm more concerned that we employ a person that is not qualified and would probably have trouble finding fast food work should she lose her job at USPS.

name: MARTA COLEMAN SKELTON
text: This post office is very efficient. Its employees are highly knowledgeable and very helpful.

name: David Rucker
text: I live 100 yards from them and they can't seem to deliver my packages. They mark that I requested a hold but they didn't even speak to me. Just too lazy to get out of the truck.

name: Renee Chambers
text: Can’t believe these ppls lost my package. Worse of worse

name: Jamie lou Purser
text: The regular lady's are good but the manager lady is rude and thinks she is above you she refused to give me my package said it was on its way still nothing a second time the manager lady simply was rude I hate this post office then the mail guy John in my area of bear Creek road read my mail and asked me personal stuff had him reported he still leaves my mail and packages in the rain won't notify me

name: Millian Giang Pham
text: Don’t even try calling. You’ll be put on perpetual hold. Useless to request any services from here.

name: KJ Rahiid
text: I been waiting on a package and a card from CO since Dec 19 th got the card today but still no package mad about it hopefully I will get it tomorrow it just a small Manila bubble pack that fits in a mailbox!!! 😡

name: robert harrison
text: USPS SUUUUUUCKS

name: Mike Van
text: Cant seam to deliver mail or packages even though my address is clearly displayed. They put all my mail in a neighbors box.

name: Lauren Gibbs
text: Always packed with one or two employees avalaible to assist.

name: Huey Harris
text: never answer

name: Tracy Clark
text: Biggest waste of a phone call.... tried to get help for a procedure and they just shut me down!

name: Shalonzia Tubbs
text: **Always losing packages.

name: L Gulley
text: It was clean and quiet

name: DIY JAZZ
text: I’m too frustrated to even vent right now...I’ll edit later

name: Paul Johnson
text: If my normal carrier, Daniel, is off. the "fill-in" carrier will NOT deliver the package

name: Marphus Prewitt
text: They STEAL PACKAGES!!!

name: The Glam Gatzby
text: My mail is hardly ever delivered to my home, it's always at the house down the street from mine.

name: Justin watkins
text: Set up an appointment a week ahead of time for 9AM Monday morning and in the scheduling system it said please show up early as it takes us time to prepare. So I show up at 8:40 and as soon as I identify the purpose of my visit she very rudely said If you have an appointment for 9 I’ll be with you AT 9. I of course responded with your scheduling system says be sure to arrive early and she interrupted me to say well I’m still sorting mail so I’ll see you after 9. You guys need to calm the hell down and change your system if it is going to instruct your patrons to do things outside of what you want.

name: Pitty Pat
text: Always come here instead of PO right down street from my house. Friendlier, more helpful clerks here. Only prob is they often only have 1 window clerk and when you have the misfortune to get behind a customer doing passport business you might as well leave and come back later. Also they close for lunch (prob due to personnel shortages,  which of course is not the fault of this branch.) Overall, I consider this my "local" PO even though it is not, because my local PO is TERRIBLE.

name: John Samuel Gurtler
text: You can spend the same amount of time driving to the Cottondale location and receiving prompt service as you would standing in line at the Tuscaloosa and Northport offices. It's just quicker than the city locales.

name: Lasandra Tucker
text: This is the best post office in the Tuscaloosa area. Always great customer service and the wait is never long. I’ve shipped multiple packages and I have a po box here. My friend and I had so much fun getting our passports here. I travel out of my way to  go here! I can’t say enough good things about theEmployees at this location!

name: Pamela Nicole
text: Great customer service..always smiling faces and respectful.

name: Austin Huddleston
text: Why is there not a direct call number for this location?  I went through a 10 minute automated service just to be on hold for an hour to ask one simple question.

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Phone number is not to local post office and does not give you what you need nor let you speak to a real person. Waist of time to call

name: Krislynn Woolwine
text: Can someone please tell me how I can speak to an actual individual about when mail will be delivered to my area ? Very important question that I have waited on hold for 45 mins with.

name: Christi Burge
text: So fast and super friendly. The blonde haired woman with glasses makes you feel right at home!!

name: Amanda Morgan
text: My favorite post office. I even drive out of my way to go there.  The ladies are always so nice and helpful.

name: April in Alabama
text: Best Postal Workers in Tuscaloosa! So friendly, patient and helpful!

name: Jeff Jones
text: Very helpful staff at this post office

name: Thelma Vick
text: Good good

name: Clayton Curry
text: Friendly service

name: Amanda Vaughn
text:
They don’t even attempt to deliver packages that won’t fit in the mailbox. Then they note the delivery was not made “at the customer’s request” which has never been true. When asked, the rude lady at the desk says the carrier has health issues and cannot handle “heavy” packages. While I sympathize, delivering packages is a part of the job, and shouldn’t be consistently skipped. I always have to pick them up. They don’t even try to deliver packages. If not for Amazon’s notifications, I would wait days past expected delivery for the post office to tell me they have the package there. So much for getting Prime delivery!
USPS Somerville...terrible service all around.

name: Michael Hamilton
text: Its small but they have a lot of services to help people out, it's centrally located on hwy 67 in Somerville. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

name: Mary jane Miller
text: If you are mailing a bill that is due within 2 weeks, you had better mail it a month early because twice now my water bill was mailed in a timely manner but not delivered to the office resulting in my paying a telephone convenience fee to avoid water shutoff,,,,my tax dollars at work, huh!!

name: Michelle Flood
text: To whom ever delivers mail to E Upper River Rd, your in big trouble. Did you know it's a felony to open someone else's mail? On top of that you left an empty Amazon envelope in my mail box. My Husband and I will get down to the bottom of this and you will be fired, and arrested cause we are going to press charges depending on whether or not you return the item you stole.

name: Ashlyn Barnard
text:
Called about a package that wasn’t delivered, said it could be picked up at this location or scheduled for a redelivery. I thought maybe they just couldn’t get up the driveway since we had a bad storm a couple of days ago and a very big tree had fallen on one half of the driveway. Our house sits on a hill so if you don’t continue down the road a little you don’t see that the driveway continues all the way up the hill to the other side. I made sure to make a note letting them know that we have another driveway just a little further down the rod. I scheduled for a redelivery for the next day, and received a confirmation email. Next day comes and no package, and no updates other than my confirmation email. I called the local office it was being held at and the lady on the phone was extremely rude. She would cut me off mid sentence, and would ask me condescendingly if I had checked all around the house for it. She wouldn’t let me get a word in edgewise. Right as I’m about to give her the tracking number she cuts me off again to say she had people in the lobby and immediately puts me on hold for at least 10 minutes. When I finally get to giving her the tracking number I come to find out that the reason it wasn’t delivered was because it was TOO LARGE FOR THE VEHICLE. You couldn’t have told me that, instead of leading me around in circles thinking my package was on its way? It’s all of 20lbs and too large??
I wouldn’t be so stirred up about this if the desk lady wasn’t so condescending and rude.

name: Kristin Sells
text: I love this post office. The staff is always friendly and the lines are very short.

name: Justin Z
text: I really like this small town post office. They have some shorter & odd hours but are still manageable to work with. The staff is really friendly & helpful (sometimes have to wait a minute or two to get someone at the desk). This is also one of the cleanest post offices I have ever been in.

name: Lynn Morgan
text: This Post office has the worst customer service I have ever had to deal with. The woman behind the counter should be replaced ASAP.  If you live in the area like I do, good luck getting your mail. They have the tendency to lose it or put it in someone's mailbox.

name: Alaina Thomas
text: This post office has an EXTREMELY rude woman that works behind the desk. This is the first time I have ever written a review on anything. I felt that my experience with this lady was so beyond terrible and unpleasant that I just could not go without giving HER a review. Needless to say, she had the ugliest attitude  I have ever encountered anywhere!

name: Christina Mathews
text: The lady was extremely rude and no help.

name: Erich Tackett
text: Unfriendly staff

name: John Hopkins
text: Always something with them, not delivering packages and saying they tried when the didnt.

name: Tiffiney Busby
text:
I have kept my mouth shut for a while trying to be the better person. But I'm beyond livid. I'm beyond sick and tired of my boxes being locked I have been a customer for 3years I have had package come up lost or missing and no one can find them when it says it's been delivered. My account is on auto draft I have signed up for it but some how you never take it out and just lock me out of my boxs then want to charge a 20 fee per each one to reopen it back up on top of the 6 months fee. The one person I love working with who goes over and beyond here is Tyler that boy deserves a raise and a 5 star. I feel like he's the only one that cares. Last time I paid $120 for 6month with my reopening fee. I will not pay that again I want my stuff. I'm tired of the run around and being locked out my boxes every other week or having my stuff sent back. Tyler had to put a stop to that by putting a note on my boxes.

Signed one angry customer

name: George Walthall
text:
They answered the phone and. JJ was very nice.

Will report RESULTS

name: DeAnn Telarico
text: I moved to Orange Beach at the end of February 2019. I have had two lost packages and a misplaced certified letter in 4 months. The clerks may be polite but there is an issue with mail delivery.

name: Ellen Greer
text: We have trouble getting our mail delivered in condo building where we live.  Days go by with no mail, then a stack. Stops and starts don't work well. Mail is put in wrong boxes. Clerks in office very pleasant.

name: Amber Sievers
text: I needed to ship several awkward items and Ty and Marion went above and beyond to help me get them packed and shipped at an affordable price. Excellent service, very clean. Very pleased with my experience!

name: Valerie Clingen
text: Great service. There was only one attendant up front, but helped everyone through with ease.

name: Jack Minehart
text: Generally speaking, I'm not a big fan of the USPS but the folks at this location are great.

name: Mary Howard
text: Not from here. Found this P.O. Very clean!  The two postal workers were efficient and polite.

name: Haley Moulton
text: I have never had an issue with the people here, no matter what time of day I have been in. They are always helpful, friendly and professional.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! Your shared comments are appreciated. If there is anything else we can do to make your experience better, please let us know. Thanks again for choosing EasyMoney!

name: James “Jay” Casey
text: Could use some personality upgrades! But it is what it is.

name: WHAT THE MUSIC?! - W/ Neil C.
text: The evening shift is very pushy when it comes to a problem they can’t handle. It’s okay if you can’t handle it personally. I’m not expecting you to if you aren’t a manager. But don’t get an attitude before the issue is resolved or give snappy responses bc it’s an issue you can’t handle. If you can’t handle it jut say that and we can come up with a solution. It’s simple. Bc a customer is only going to feed off that energy.

resp.text:
We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. It is our goal to always provide an excellent
experience. We have forwarded your concerns to management for further review. For immediate
assistance, please call our Customer Service Department at 1-855-920-9800.

name: Sir Charles
text: I am a law enforcement officer when i went inside to get a money order for my rent the young lady was servicing a customer I was the first person in line and plus I was on my way to work. Another gentleman came in the door while I was still at front of line and she told him to get in front of me that was very disrespectful and unprofessional I will not be back here and i will spread the word to my friends and family not to go here.

name: Tambatha Sias
text: Love the workers there. Always get in and out

name: Steve Besch
text: The location is open 24 hours for my convenience.  It was colorful, clean and inviting and I was out in less than 15 minutes with the cash I needed!

name: J Yvonne Stanton

text: I ship/receive many packages and have never had an issue with this post office ever.  They always leave packages safely at my door on the porch to keep them out of the rain.  Everyone at the post office is very friendly and patient with customers.  I strongly prefer mailing & receiving packages with USPS over FEDEX or UPS.

name: XOXOBRA GRIT
text: Terrible organization, i havent been able to leave my house for three days now under the guise that the perishable package was supposed to be delivered “by 8 PM” every day this week. I was here yesterday and waiting next to the door reading when they came to deliver it yesterday but they didn’t knock or anything I just got a text saying I they didn’t know my address for sure.

name: Marcus Garner
text: The post office will hire anyone.

name: Nekenya taylor
text: Come to late and 5 is not a good time to come when things are closed

name: Andrès Morales
text: This is easily the most dysfunctional post office in all of America. If it was possible I would strip them of the one star I'm forced to gift them. The people that deliver the mail are firstly, rude. Secondly, slow. Thirdly, (and most importantly) INCOMPETENT. This place has no concern for any of its customers and mail recipients. They will NOT deliver your mail if they don't FEEL like it. As a business manager I would recommend getting delivery drivers that can actually physically get out of their car to put mail where it's supposed to go. It's like they're afraid of the sun! Don't bother paying for 2 day delivery because it will easily take about a week for you to receive your packages. It is remarkable how much they don't care about the mail they deliver. It is apparent every time I visit this office that they lack any understanding of how basic customer service works. They have literally no idea how to run a business. It's dumbfounding how a package that was supposed to be delivered on a certain day cannot be picked up on the same day considering it's in the SAME CITY. All you have to do is look at the hours these people work. 4:30 is your cutoff ladies and gentlemen. If you work a 9 to 5 like everyone else well too bad! You'll have to inconvenience yourself to get the packages YOU paid for. And even if you go they still might not have your mail at the office! This place is a disaster and a disgrace to ALL post offices across the nation. If the Post Office Museum in Washington DC had an exhibit on this location it would be titled "HOW NOT TO RUN A POST OFFICE EVER". This office does more of a disservice for anyone in this area than serve the consumers they are paid to work for. These people just wake up to a check and never consider how their work may affect others. If I was in charge of this post office I would fire myself as owner, lay off every single employee, burn the place to the ground and start ALL over. This business is in SHAMBLES.

name: Brittany Eldridge
text: I paid for two day shipping. My package was sent out Tuesday and arrived in mobile last night. My delivery driver decided that since my apartment office was closed, he just wasn't going to deliver my package. I now have to wait until Tuesday, one week after it shipped, to receive it. Because they won't even deliver my package to my door, like they're supposed to.

name: J'Branie White
text: Horrible horrible horrible!!!

name: Brian Orr
text: Super nice staff and I'm not joking. The somewhat heavy set African-American man was *the* nicest Post Office employee I have ever met. Helped me ship international boxes and fill out the paperwork ^^ Thanks!

name: Kaylan Greene
text: Sorry employees!!!! I had a package delivered, didn’t know it was coming from USPS this person never did come to my door!! They left a paper telling me to go to the post office only for them to tell me to come back another day!!

name: Laura Hartley
text: We have had several packages left at different houses in our neighborhood for two years. If the package will not fit in the mailbox I get a slip to go pick it up. I know they are not required to leave it at the door, but the courtesy of customer service would be appreciated. There is a reason I am ordering something and having it delivered. Now, I was waiting on a package to be delivered and after I got home yesterday we had no mail and no package.  I checked the status and it is mark "undeliverable as addressed." I have been trying to call all day and no one has answered the phone. The customer service is terrible even for a government run agency. My expectations are not high but this is ridiculous.

name: Jackie Salac
text: This is THE worst office in ALL of Mobile, possibly the entire state.  They are rude and unprofessional. Their employee, Stephanie Beasley answers the phone immediately being rude. Complaints to her supervisor, Leander Harris were met with an equal amount of hostility. They BOTH need to be fired. VERY unprofessional!  I have filed a formal complaint against them. If anyone else needs the site it is:  Office of public affairs and government relations (PRC.gov) PLEASE, if you have this happen too, COMPLAIN. These people need to be GONE and replaced with people who know how to conduct themselves in a manner more fitting with a job at a US post office!

name: Cassy D
text: If I had the option to give this 0 stars, I would because this place deserves it. My boyfriend had a package stolen because the carrier from this office left it of the front door step of our apartment even though they ARE NOT allowed to do so. After my boyfriend called and went to the branch several times, the manager claimed the office gave the carrier permission to leave it at the doorstep and refused to give him a refund so he lost like 60 dollars worth of items. This place is terrible, just ship through FedEx - it's worth it not to deal with these idiots.

name: Cori Sylvester
text: Horrible service! My mom is handicapped, has no transportation and has been receiving her medical supplies through the mail for years because of that and now all of a sudden the mail carrier is too lazy to bring it to the door. There was a slip in her mail box saying sorry we missed you but no one ever came to the door.  My mom put on the slip that she wanted it re-delivered to the door but it never came because the mail carrier never took the slip out of the mailbox. I made a point of putting the slip into a drop box and the mail carrier brought the slip right back to my moms mailbox. My mom called the post office and they said they couldn't find the package, called back again and they said it would be delivered again. That was 3 days ago and it still hasn't been delivered and they have had it since Nov. 29th (16 days). The mail lady can stand at the mailboxes and flirt and do everything else but she can't take 2 seconds to bring a box to the door.  She doesn't even put the mail in the right mailboxes. If I could put zero stars I would! This is ridiculous!!!

name: Stephenie Vannoy
text: The worst postal services I have ever recieved. My business goes days without mail due to the constant change in carriers and them not getting routes sorted out properly...which causes customers payments to be late. No services on Saturdays because they somehow changed it in the system that business is closed that day. Multiple trips to this office to have the issues sorted out. Still hasn't been fixed. A few of the carriers are great! One lady actually threw the mail on the floor and said she didn't have time and left. Wish we coukd change post offices.

Thankfully, a customer in line let me use hers...she also seemed perplexed at the employees rudeness. Seems like a bad environment compared to other post offices, like the one on Wesley Ave where the building is nicer, and the employees are helpful, and friendly.

hey mail goes in and then mail comes out you can’t really ask for much more than that.

text: My mail lady sucks.! She doesn't deliver my mail half the time and the other half she doesn't pick up the mail in the mailbox. I'm not the only one in my neighborhood who has problems with her. I I give the post office one star and that is one too many stars!

name: Joseph Bayer
text: Package was not received, but said it was delivered. I called and opened a case to find out where it was. The branch was supposed to look and call me back. It's been over a week and I have still heard nothing. This is the second piece of mail I have had lost.

name: John Bobbitt
text:
marked my sons home as  "vacant" during its renovation. With tools/materials out front and 3 cars in the driveway always. Returned our christmas presents, his bills, and mental health medication. We called companies looking for the bills, but they didnt know anything and moat hung up, next day...Water/gas/electric cut off, and then had to pay fees to hook them back up. The medication was for my sons antidepressants. hes suicidal and nearly did it but not for someone walking it at the last second.. and so you can imagine what happened without his meds.

All the while, postman driving by and waving like he didnt have anything, while hes the one had it marked as vacant, and returned the mail every day. Three months later he decided the mailbox wasnt suitable and had the address cut off AGAIN. Aparently the VIRGINIA Tech logo on the side of the box wasnt approved (BY nick saban, i guess), so....same issue all over again. Sons BIRTHDAY Presents this time. And waved to him every day.

When asked why nobody was informed that mail was being interrupted, and just left to think we didnt  have any mail, we were told "We aint gotta tell ya". So basically, they can take a suicidally depressed 20 year old, and take his medication....steal his christmas presents AND birthday presents (the only reminders he gets of home)....have his lights, gas, and water cut off... cost us nearly $1,000 in cut on fees.....AND DO IT TWICE!   ..but they dont have any responsibility....  and this is the office we had to go through.

Theres a national joke about Alabama being home of really moronic people, and when my son confirmed it and told me stories about his daily adventures, i still thought them exagerated. But no... this is REALLY the highest concentration on ignorant, lazy, worthless, and stupid people on earth. Mobile, Al

name: nydra hill
text: The post manger was rude to me and she snatched the paper in needed her to look t out of my hand. I will not be using this post office ever again and I will definitely be calling to complain about her.

Package says available for pickup at this facility. Went to this place, the employee goes "it ain't here". I ask if she could check but she goes "don't need to, it's at yo place". Me: "Look the tracking says it's here, can you at least check? I know your a government employee and you have a reputation to uphold, but check please.". She replies "oh lawd oh lawd hell naw i don't need dis sheet you white cracka coming up in hur cluck cluck cluck cluck".

Bonus round: privately owned mail centers have told me they complain at least twice a month about this facility. The post master has had to talk to them multiple times. If you decide to go there, go to the white woman there, not the black ones (if your white).

text:
THE WORST POSTAL DELIVERY SERVICE EVER! My package was scanned Notice Left - NoAuthRcpct 06/25/2016 1:12pm MOBILE AL 36693

Management solved things out like a breeze.

text: They never answer the phone, and I have had many packages delivered to the wrong address. For two years now.

text: Horrible customer service. Rude employees. Called asking about a package that another branch suggested we call them. Lady that answered the phone was ugly. In a loud voice said I had to call Theodore Branch, when I ask if I could have her name she hung up on me.

Packages left at my doorstep to be stolen and when I had left specific instructions to leave items with my apartment office and they won't do it instead I am forced to drive across town weekly to get my mail. The employees are idiots and function at a three year old mental capacity. So done with this place!

resp.text: Hello, we take customer feedback very seriously and believe this to be a false review submitted by a former employee. Therefore, we are requesting this review be removed. If you have any questions or concerns, please call our customer service team at 1-855-920-9800.comments, concerns, or suggestions you wish to share.

name: Ashley Barron
text: I’ve been here more than once.  The ladies here are always very helpful and friendly. I’m always out the door in less than 10 minutes. Alaina (probably spelled that wrong) did a great job with helping me out today. Highly recommend!

text: Today we went here and they weren’t open on time. They usually open around 9 and we got there around 9:15 and they weren’t open and the crazy part is the lights were on, the open sign was lit up, and there was employee cars outside but there business door was locked!!!! We called several times and we got no answer!!

resp.text: We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. It is our goal to always provide an excellent experience. We have forwarded your concerns to management for further review.

name: Shena Henley
text: No problems. Nice ladies and easy process. Open a little late too which is helpful for after work needs.

name: John Bobbitt
text: ive learned alot abojt reverse racism during my year in alabama. but the women behind the counter here? i havent had ANYONE be so openly scornfully and rude to me in all that time. from the second i approached the counter and she broke policy to demand extra ID. to when i left and requested 20s and she intentionally ignored me, tossed a 100 bill at me and walked away. I dunno how they treat others, but if youre white, dont go here. ...unless you know a way to yoke someone out through 2 inches of acrylic.

text: Seriously!? $70.80 to cash a check ? That's robbery!! I won't use the words I really want to. 😡😠🤬😠😡🤬
