This place is a rip off!! Wrote a check from the wrong account took them the MONEY ...and they have ran that check 3 more times and will not answer my calls
I need a manager to call me asap

text: Today I stopped by this pawn shop with the intention of just getting a smartwatch. I walked out of there with not only a smart watch but an electric guitar and a clarinet. The person that helped me she was very polite kind and was very apologizing on everything taking so long. I understand all too well myself on everything that was happening. I will absolutely stop by there again to give them my business because they took care of me when I was patient and waiting with them. They have my business always. I cannot highly recommend them enough. 10 out of 10 experience.

name: Big Dawg
text: They are terrible!! They don't answer the phone for anything!! I have been trying to call them to pay over the phone no one is even trying to answer. It's sad the phone just rings.i don't have transportation and tried to pay my bill for 4 days now.

text: I love the staff, how genuinely friendly and kind they are, I love the variety of things to choose from and I definitely love the reasonable prices.

text: This is the best pawn shop in Montgomery. Very friendly staff and will do the best they can for you. I have been there many times and several others. They are the only pawn shop I have been able to buy from in this area. Great people and if you go in there enough they make you feel like part of their Quick Pawn family.  The other Quick Pawns in the area are not as generous. Thanks

name: Carol Roberts
text: This is a perfectly nice pawn shop. I'm a buyer, not a seller, so I can't speak to the prices they pay for items, but they have always been nice when I've been in there. They have a very nice assortment of jewelry, although usually it's on the lower price end. Once in a while you can find a nice high end piece.

name: Brittany Best
text: I have gotten several things from this place. One was a really really nice brand new flat screen tv that was still in the box and my family put it on hold or lay away for me and gradually paid on it and recently got my small little one a PS3 with an afterglow controller that was in great condition and was at a great price.  They have many things to choose from here and friendly staff.

name: brandon leflore
text: Great Customer service, Will treat you like the next presidential candidate upon entering.If Your Thinking About Pawning This is The Place To Go, Very respectable. Thanks Quik Pawn Burbank!!!!

resp.text: Hey Brandon! Glad you enjoyed your experience. Thanks for stopping by!

text: The lady said we dont take laptops but funny how all of the other locations do

resp.text:
Hi Byrdie - Why we attempt to pawn or purchase a variety of items including resalable laptops, not all merchandise meets the underwriting requirements.

If you would like to speak directly to the District Manager over our Burbank location, you may email your contact information to customerservice@quikpawnshop.com and he would be happy to give you a call and assist with any questions you may have about our process.

Best regards

name: Sylvia Ross
text: My mail carrier recently informed me I'd have to replace my mailbox because the post is rotten, making the mailbox lean. I'm 61 with a bad back & no one to help me, so I told the mail carrier it would be several days until I could put a new mailbox up. I don't get out much, so I ordered a post & FedEx delivered it in 2 days. The mail carrier has been very sympathetic, & even climbed up my rickety steps & put a package in front of my door while I was at the vet yesterday with my sick dog. I know a lot of people have legitimate gripes about their mail carriers, but I want to praise mine. Don't know his name, but I want to give a BIG shoutout to the guy one who delivers mail on Sitton Road.

name: Tim Parker
text: If you're expecting a package, you'll have to go and get it because this PO refuses to deliver packages. It's a 30 mile round trip for me to go get my packages. And with this round of new carriers, it's after 5 before we get our mail

name: Mindy Moore
text:
I am expecting a package.   I have had a change of address in place. The package was sent to the old address and rerouted. That's fine.
What I don't get is that some of our mail is still being delivered to the old address and the package that should have been rerouted INSIDE my state went to a different state and then was sent to new address.
THE THING IS...YESTERDAY I CHECKED THE TRACKING AND IT SAID DELIVERY ATTEMPT HAD BEEN MADE. I WAS HOME ALL DAY.  NOBODY EVEN DROVE UP MY DRIVEWAY.

GET IT TOGETHER USPS

name: Danielle Sundstrom
text: Carrier didn’t even attempt to ring the door bell or anything the day of delivery. Instead they leave a blank re-delivery slip in our mailbox. We were home all day. I completed the back of the slip for redelivery checking the box to indicate to leave at front door. They dismissed my request and left the slip in my mailbox so I went online to request re-delivery. Four days later, they repeated the same process not delivering my package (while home) just placing another missed delivery slip in my mailbox. Then I received yet a third slip stating final notice, articles will be returned to sender! The post office (Leanne) called me and left a message stating I need to pick up my packages because it is “extremely heavy.” The package weighs 40 lbs. and even though I’m pregnant, I can muster the strength to lift it myself. The point is I ordered online not only for convenience but so I wouldn’t have to take off a day of work to pick up my packages.

name: cyndi maymi
text: Went out to mail box while raining and my son's package was sitting on top of the mail box. The mail carrier Did not bring it up my driveway to my door. Package was received very wet.

name: Rebecca Richardson
text: This small United States postal service office in Hayden provides the community with great service and professionalism. The postal worker allowed me to select the style of stamps I wanted. For the reasonable price of sending letters or packages you can't beat the USPS. The letter carriers also do a great job.

name: Kathleen Dutton
text: We have an excellent carrier who is on time. If the packages don't fit in the box he leaves them in a secure,  covered plac .  He goes the extra mile,  is courteous and helpful.

name: Katy Knaebel
text: I'm only leaving one star because it's impossible to leave zero stars. Let me set the scene: as I walk in with my package I was returning, one of the clerks greets me with a warm "you're at the wrong place." There was no way she could have known this right away, so I was taken aback. I quickly showed her my return information on my phone (which was to be shipped back via USPS), and she then proceeded to VERY poorly tape up my return envelope and hand me my receipt. I will be very surprised if my package ever makes it to its destination.  Definitely will make sure to hold onto my receipt on this one!

name: John Lankow
text: Very rude to begin with then instead of holding a packages that was delivered a day before but no one was home so it didn’t get left but any mother we are constantly walking packages to the right houses because the people they have working for them don’t give a dam about us or our belongings now we have to pay to get the dress reshipped and pray to go god the person that it was purchased from is honest enough to let us know when it’s sent back ........... lesson learned lesson learned!!!!!!! Will be using fed ex or Amazon for now on !!!!!!

name: Kayla Knight
text: Worst service in the United States. My package has been lost for FOUR weeks now and they have been ZERO HELP. The mail carrier claims to have placed my package inside of my mailbox, however I live in an apartment complex. The mailbox is the size of a cheese grater. Considering the package consisted of 7 shirts, 5 pairs of pants, and an plethora of jewelry I highly doubt it would have fit inside of the mailbox. I called every day asking for an update and the guy in charge of packages gives me the same story: “I will call you tomorrow and let you know what we find”. Of course he never called. The last time I called him he had me on hold for 26 minutes and then hung up. I haven’t heard back since. As previously stated, it’s been FOUR WEEKS since my package had gone missing. I contacted the company who originally shipped my package and thankfully they resent my items for free via FEDEX, even though it was clearly negligence on the behalf of USPS.

name: Drew Madere
text: The most unreliable and inconsistent service to the likes I have never seen with the USPS.

name: Sonya Wentland
text: Extremely helpful and nice employees. Crystal, Eva, and David went out of their way to help me find my package because I was leaving town early!   Thank you again

name: Robert Denton
text: Terrible service. The drop boxes for our apartments have been out of service for years. The manager here refused to get them repaired.  This causes long delays to pick up packages. I even have to take off work because their hours are so short.  This is just ridiculous.

name: Darlene W
text: I am not able to wear a mask, for medical issues and yet the clerk refused me service.

name: Annette Robertson
text: October 22, 2020   5:45pm on Cottage Hill Rd near, USPS truck #7202543 driving recklessly in heavy traffic. Nearly took off my front bumper changing lanes. There was also an accident ahead and she just about causes another.

name: Lori Jester
text: I have been waiting for a Certified letter for 7 days. I have been home 24 / 7. I get a notice online when I tracked my package that they tried to deliver and there was no response. No one knocked on my door. This is so frustrating.

name: ToyotaJ
text: This location is not nearly large enough to handle the influx of people that have moved to this area.   Very small and totally understaffed.  This is a prime example of what happens when you let the government run a service.  Very little accountability or consequence because it’s doesn’t matter if they make money or not.   If this were a free enterprise service it would be bankrupt in less than 5 years.

name: Elberik
text:
The building is very small & there's always a mob right inside the door.  The staff don't bother even trying to create some sort of orderly line.  Plus the two women who are almost always at the counter are incredibly slow.
If you see them chatting with a customer, prepare to wait a long time.

name: William Clark
text: The most horrible mail service in the country.  I guess the mail is electronically sorted and then the couriers simply shove all mail into the boxes, whether it's the correct box or not.  I'm having to rent a PO box at a different location due to incompetence and lost paychecks... and of course they don't even offer PO Box rental at this location.

name: Ken Sils
text: Folks, whoever designed this Post Office ought to be fired... yesterday!  The space for customer service is designed for a populated town of about 500, and this area serves about 50,000 to 100,000 people.  It is always overcrowded and there are only 2 service areas that can be used (yes, it's that small).  There are times when the people are stacked on themselves just to get in the door.  Now, with that being said, the employees are nice and try hard - this setup is simply deplorable!

name: Debra Longo
text: This is one of the best post office's I have ever been to ! The people who work here are great they help with everything and are very friendly. Not once have I walked in their and had a bad experience, maybe all other post office's should learn from them. Keep up the great job !!!!!

name: WE Hart
text: They're all incompetent liars and carelessly give inaccurate information. But, they're nice while they're waisting your time.

name: Jason Meredith
text: Excellent customer service and very quick!!

name: Matthew Callahan
text: Literally drove an hour to get here and traffic made me 3 min late, the package has been stuck in transit for 3 weeks their fault, and this lady comes up and locks the door seeing me walk up. And refuses to literally let me get my package thats sitting in there.

name: H Meyers
text:
For the year I've been at my new address I've gotten a lot of mail for former tenants. Less than at first but it's still a problem. Carrier and supervisor assured me it would be addressed, but it continues.

Mailed a priority mail package on Saturday that should have been in Atlanta area by Monday (per usps, not guaranteed of course). Now on Tuesday I find out it's been "miss-sorted" and sent to Hattiesburg, MS, won't be sent out till tonight and "may" get to GA by Friday.

Had same problems with previous address. Very, very poor mail service and they didn't change the regular carrier or used musical carriers at times.

name: Jackie Johnson
text: I don't complain very often but this time I have to let my letter carrier know I saw her break more branches off my shrubbery after I had already pruned it!  It was not in any way blocking access to the mailbox.!! She is very much over stepping her bounds!

name: Gary Stiegler
text:
Our mail originates from this post office and is always late in the afternoon.  They never pick up our outgoing mail, although we put the flag up on the mailbox.  They just pile the incoming mail on top of our outgoing mail, causing us to have delinquencies on payments that we make.  Sometimes mail sits in the box for  4 or more days.
We receive mail from several different addresses completely distant from our office, plus 1 bill arrived 6 months after the postmark and was water damaged and in deplorable condition.  Although we have reported this several times, nothing seems to be corrected.  We still have an outgoing piece of mail in our box for the 3rd day today.  There seems to be a lack of caring for their customers.  Typical government run organization.

name: Darlene Wolfe
text: This is a greatb post office,  it's small,  but the clerks are very nice and so dang helpful.  Each person gets their needs met,  plus they are friendly and gracious.

name: C K
text: The staff is great but the facility needs to grow a bit. West Mobile has oversized this location.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Very friendly, I appreciate the timely service even though there was a large crowd!

name: Johnney07
text: This is the 3rd time my packages were left at the wrong address. The address was correct on the package but they delivered to the wrong address.

name: John Mclain

Most ppl are rushing just to get in the door before locking the doors at close time, bc they close too early (4:30 M-F, & Noon on Sat.), & have basically 1 person working the counter! Definitely needs improvement!

Thank you for continuing to be the best even during these crazy busy times.

Very friendly, helpful staff
Always leave with a smile!

text: I have been stopping here for just a few weeks now. I stop at least 2 to 3 days per week and it’s always the same people working. There is one lady with curly hair that I have witness to be rude to multiple people. Today I experienced it myself. The things she is rude about is unnecessary not to mention that she is very slow with her duties. I think I’m just gonna make a longer drive to go to the other post office in Irondale. They are so much nicer there and do not make me feel like a burden when I have to use their services.

name: ivana perkins
text: Teresa was rude as hell. I sent my package Dec 2nd with priority mail and it was last updated Dec 6th saying “in transit” with no location. It was a Christmas package as well. Furious!

name: Christopher Douglas (BO)
text: Completely a waste of space. If i didn't think that it would be a complete waste of time. I'd call what ever complaint number there was. Honestly I'd just get someone D.A. that could careless about anything.

name: JOANA CAIN
text: Completely useless staff! Since when shipping a small package is so dang complicated?! They don't even try to help. I sell online and ship packages all the time, so I know the drill. Needless to say, I couldn't ship my package. Recently moved near this office and tried it for the first time. Not going back!!

name: LeAynn Harris
text: Very, very slow.

name: Kennedy Kinsley
text: high class staff

name: omaro stayka
text:
NO STARS• UNPROFESSIONAL- Garbage Clerk her name starts with a V- terrible service not recommended at all.
stay away from this office if you need mailing address for your business , important documents or anything like that  choose another location.
And now the only time you have access to your mailbox is during normal business hours that's it they close the lobby as well at 5 and weekends

name: Debbie Lindsey
text: Called the 800 # given on the website.  Held for 57:38  Was told I would have to speak with my local post office and was given another # which I have called 7 times .  No one will answer!!!  I don't feel this should even get a star because my score is A WHOPPING ZERO.

name: M J
text: Its been 16 days my package is lost. And no one gave me tracking of that package because they told me its an international package. I am upset :(

name: Lisa Allen
text: I have been at my property for many years. For the most part the carriers has been great. But today the carrier for the Turney Lane route was rude and showed very poor disrespectful customer service. I left $$$ for 5 stamps for my 5 letters and I left $$$ for 10 stamps with a nice note saying please, thank you, be safe, be blessed. I just so happened to be watching as I wanted to saying thanks in person. Well what I got was him swearing/cursing. When I asked what was the problem as I have always done this and NEVER any problems before. He got out of his car and began arguing and began talking rudely  so I just asked for my mail and money back. He gave it back while but continued to be rude. Now I have to make a trip to the post office. I am so disappointed in my carriers service.

name: Kevin Mercado
text: Horrible service, three times I did not receive my delivery on a Sunday ...

name: SlyFox997
text: Always friendly and helpful service at the front desk! I drive the extra distance from Harvest to avoid their post-office because service is a joke there most of the time. The front desk women is so kind to let me know what the most inexpensive shipping options are, and isn't pushy or comes across like "i interrupted her" look that I'v gotten at the Harvest one. Great Place! Will continue to go there for my postal shipping needs!

name: Denise Marsh
text: Our mail carrier is absolutely amazing! She goes out of our way to help us with anything we need. The post office itself is really good. Every time I go in, I always get helped quickly.

name: Kerri Clutts
text: Love this place. Been my home for over 12 years. My co workers are the best!

name: Italian Guy
text: Quick friendly service

name: Matt A
text: I have been having a problem getting my packages from them. Today, my security camera caught my mail carrier writing the "we missed you" thing instead of coming to the door. I should mention that the camera was the one in the back of my car at that. I'm very unhappy with how I'm being treated with my packages

name: Beverly Ramsey
text: Have several relatives who work for postal service.

name: Carrin Nichols
text: They were very friendly and helpful.

name: Tiffany Cunningham
text: Awful, you can never get anyone on the phone.

name: Eddie McClain
text: Very courteous and accommodating.

name: Danny Fafach
text: Friendly small-town post office with great service and low wait times!

name: Rick James
text: The best post office there is. Love the crew up front they always light up my day!

name: Chris Wilson
text: Not sure why all the negative reviews. I have been coming here for years. It's a small town postal service. They have always been efficient and helpful.

name: Vincent King
text: Been coming here for years, my tracking lights up that my package arrived at the box. AFTER the "Box Time" I understand that. But I took off work to come up here to pick up my first shipment of books and I was told they aren't supposed to give it to me. I get there is regulations and all or something.. but that's wrong if they are only open during work hours. I will just start getting boxes shipped elsewhere.

name: Ashley Johnson
text: We’ve filed police reports for mail theft in our area and our mail carrier decided to force a box into the mailbox that contained a $200 tablet and leave it there instead of bringing it to the house.

name: Hannah Davis
text: I ordered a few sweaters for the winter and unfortunately the place I ordered from didn't include my apartment number on the package despite me listing it on my shipping address. I didn't even find out about it until the day it was supposed to be delivered. However, the employees at this post office were SO helpful in fixing my address on the package and ensuring me that it would be delivered the next day. It wasn't even the post office's fault that it was messed up in the first place. The same day I called the post office I also sent an email about the situation and was told I would hear back within one business day and I actually received a phone call the same day. I know 2020 has been a very strange year, but I am thankful to have the USPS to help us receive our mail and packages every single day.

name: Tiffany Bolden
text: My packages are being stolen. The mail carrier in Northport keeps leaving them at the front door and I have told her and him this many times. I want to pick them up from the post office. It's like they just don't care and it shows. I am on my way to talk to a manager or post master now. I wish I could post this video. Because I live on the FRONT STREET. The package looks like hey come get me I'm free. I got a all my Christmas packages stolen its pitiful . I told the carrier about this trying to be nice and not get anyone in trouble but now I'm feeling like a doormat. I shouldn't have to get cameras. Just write the paper slip so I can pick it up. I wish I didn't have to give a star at all.

name: Alexander O'Bryan
text: Terrible customer service. Very nosey. Need to stick to sorting mail dumb as hoez and mind your business.

name: Pamela Blanchard
text: I sell online and the employees at my Northport location have always gone out of their way to help me. They are always very polite and patient and believe me I have tested that patience on a couple of occasions LOL. Cannot praise them enough 💕💕💕💕💕

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Phone number is not to local post office and does not give you what you need nor let you speak to a real person. Waist of time to call

name: Samantha Giambalvo
text: Nobody enjoys going to the post office. You’re always in a rush and there’s always a line and that’s just kind of how it is. However. I’m bordering on enjoying this post office. All the people that work there are very polite and helpful as long as you are polite and helpful to them. Especially Atiya. She is super helpful and she has a great sense of humor and very sarcastic wit and that’s basically my favorite type of humor.  So if you have to go to post office, these people make it not too painful on a bad day and on a good day they make it pretty fun. By the way, I am putting a five star rating based on my experience today… Atiya was there, helpful as always, there was no line. Perfect post office day

name: Mirna Barahona
text: There is always a lady in a very bad mood she has short hair very rude ,if she is tired from her job she needs to go and find another job where she can be happy not friendly at all. She is dark skin very rude unfriendly.

name: Chief Justice
text: Terrible customer service. Look at you as if you are stupid when you ask a question.

name: Mikey Skates
text: Horrible customer service. They never answer the phone. EVER.

name: mohammad ahmad
text: The supervisor Jimmy is the most helpful guy and this is the best usps I’ve ever been to, thank you very much mr. Jimmy!

name: Amelia Thornton
text: Always keeps the line moving! Friendly, patient, and knowledgeable.

name: Laura Boothe
text: Was told to leave

name: Trevor Benoit
text: The service is somewhat slow given that there is always an elderly man at the counter. However, I have never had an issue with anything shipping related.

name: Montrell Miller
text: Very friendly and efficient staff.

name: John Samuel Gurtler
text: Clerk has friendliness of a robot. Parking is cramped.

name: Michael Clark
text: Line goes fast

name: aniham Gaming
text: Mail lady never gives us our packages

name: Kayla Hanback
text: Very helpful

name: Mikey8567
text: Delivered to wrong address, could not talk to person on phone just got the automated system. We have progressed to a point there is no longer customer service or at least one that isn't a real person.

name: Kay Reed
text: Mail carrier will not get out to deliver a package. She will already have the note wrote up saying dog on property. The dog she is talking about is the neighbors dog which is in a fence. And can't get to her. She doesn't want to get out of her car to deliver. The post master is not a very nice guy either. Very rude to the customers. The lady's up front desk is usually very nice.

name: Brian Walden
text: I have had mixed experiences at this post office. I have had good experiences with the women that work there, but there is a man there who is extremely rude and sarcastic. If you say you need something shipped, he'll say "I'll mail it." Isn't that cute? He doesn't greet you or thank you, just acts put upon. He is also rough with the packages. He wouldn't last one minute in the private sector.

name: S.Mills
text: Only open 2 hours on Saturday and locking the doors at 10:55? 1 star for sure.

name: KARAY999
text: Twice I have had to pick up a package from the post office because the lady didn't want to get out of her truck and bring the package to my porch.  She left a note saying I wasn't home. Yes I was! Also, if your dogs break out of your fence and are in your yard then they don't deliver...completely understandable, BUT they NEVER come back! They are supposed to come back the next day, but this is probably the same lazy mail carrier.

name: Dorothy Guillory
text: I stopped by the post offices in Calera Alabama, Rachel that works at this location is very helpful, She will go out of her way to make sure the job gets done. Thanks to Rachel for being professional. 🙏

name: Aubie Rieux
text: terrible service delivery, often times they will skip delivery especially after a holiday weekend.

name: TIARA CALHOUN
text: The second worst post office that I have to deal with. The mail lady never delivers mail to us on Saturday literally NEVER. She marks our mail every Saturday as Delivery Attempted-No Access to Delivery Location. Really there is plenty of access no blocked roads, no people in the way its an apartment complex.

name: Monica Rice
text: This post office is awful. I have nothing but problems out of them and my mail lady. Waiting on a package to be delivered? Don't even because she won't even attempt to get it to you! Literally stood in my driveway and watched her pull up and stick a notice in the box took not even a second so she already had it written before she got to my box. Very poor customer service. Wish I could use another branch. Completely fed up and tired of fighting for my mail. So disappointing. What would be a federal crime to others obviously doesn't apply to calera post office.

name: Tiffany Roberts
text: The guy at the counter (Justin) was incredibly rude. First, I stood there several minutes waiting on someone to ring me up and mail my package. Then he finally comes in, grabs my package, slaps it on the counter, starts furiously pressing buttons and going through everything without actually asking me the questions. I guess he magically knew that nothing was fragile (he never asked), slapped a sticker on the package and threw it down in the back. If you're going to act like customers are an inconvenience, go find a different job. And don't toss my package around, acting all indignant and irritated. Wow.

name: larry Hatchett
text: Need to be able to speak with live person automated service cant help

name: Melissa Roberts
text: Dont bother putting a hold request in... IF and thats a big IF they honor it, they refuse to read the notes section that CUSTOMER WILL PICK UP. If I wanted it left in my box I wouldnt have put a hold on it in the 1st place!!

name: Patrick
text: This post office will not forward mail despite my numerous complaints. So much of my mail has been lost or disregarded by the new tenant at my former address.

name: Charish Watson
text: Very nice people. I never had a problem since i moved in this town. They always go above ang beyond customer service.

name: Queen Bee
text: Multiple issues with carrier not picking up pkgs. Have called and complained numerous times with no results. They over promise and under deliver! Not happy at all.

name: Angel McGhee
text: I've had 2 packages "lost" just this week. The mail carrier said she put both packages in my box but fortunately for me, we have a camera on our box that clearly shows no package! The only explanation I've gotten since explaining this and offering to provide proof is that my packages are lost and someone will be contacting me. Still no word and no package! Disgusted is an understatement! Very unprofessional service

name: Kaylo
text: I recently had a terrible experience here and you can form your own opinion. I went to mail a package and was told I needed more tape on the box. I asked the clerk for some and she stated I would have to buy a roll. I purchased a roll for $3.49, taped the box as instructed. Another woman after me came in with her package without any tape at all. The clerk graciously gave her free tape with no problem. My niece asked her why she did that, she gave no reply and walked to the back of the post office. I'm black and the woman who came in after me was white and so was the clerk.

name: SexualChocolate Black
text: Very professional they handle people in timely manner very nice people always smiling face.👍👍

name: Joyce Lambert
text: Quick, fast service. Thanks.

name: Rebecca Lister
text: Get everything mailed in one spot

name: Crystal Guilford
text: The customer service is absolutely terrible to nonexistent. I say this because the post office always send a new mail carrier to my address that doesn’t even know the route (or simply how to use a GPS either), so whenever I’m expecting packages or very important mail, it’s a gamble on rather I’ll actually get it or not on those specific days. Even if they do give me some of my mail and/or packages, they usually leave something out. So if I don’t receive everything right then and there, then I’ll have to go to the post office in person the next day to retrieve my mail that was left out and my packages that were left behind because it’s like trying to find gold to get ahold of a real person on the phone because they usually ignore the calls and barely ever actually answer the phone. USPS sucks terribly, I truly wish that I could have all of my packages delivered ONLY by FedEx, UPS, or some other more reliable delivery service.

name: Sherry Rylander
text: Called about a package that had been at the Post Office for 14 days but never scanned in as being received at that location according to the online tracker. An employee checked and stated it was definitely not there and they would check with our carrier. It was delivered the next day. Thank you for following up and finding my package.

name: K. W.-Wilson
text: I have been monitoring a package from an order and it's been sitting with the Chestnut St. branch since the 17th, today is the 21st and it has not been delivered yet. I have called and called but nobody has answered. I called Piedmont Cutoff and they answered immediately, but they could not help due to zip code. Chestnut Street office needs to do better and work on customer service and efficiency.

name: Wyatt W
text: So i go down to the post office to retrieve a package, tracking says "insufficient address". Lady at the post office says the sender forgot to put the apartment letter on the label. Ok, not your fault USPS, i get it. So the lady says ill go back and look for it if they havent already sent it back, comes back and says cant find it, the post office guy must be riding around with it on his truck. Give me your name and number and ill call you when he gets back. 2 hours later I get am update saying its being processed out of Gadsden usps to be returned to sender. Wowwww . so thanks for nothing i guess? And I get the 1 star is kinda harsh but even after the driver was made aware i was trying to retrieve it (lady said she called him) it was still sent back. Smh. You can do better Gadsden USPS

name: Brittney A
text: Over 2 weeks, how can you lose 6 individual small packages with tracking numbers on them inside of a locked mailbox that has to have a key to open it? But yet all my paper bills are still there? If you can read the box well enough to leave bills, you are perfectly capable of reading the same name and same address for my packages?

name: Kacey Watts
text: the place is great, but trying to call them is a nightmare. you can never get an actual person on the phone

name: Matthew
text: It’s Saturday morning and they should open at 9:00, it’s now 9:15 and it’s not open and a line of 10 people.

name: Jackson Morgan
text: Can't talk to anyone about lost or misdelivered package.  Online is no better.

name: michael silvey
text: What's really pathetic is the mail carrier will fill out "Sorry we missed you while you were out" pink slip before they leave for their route. They do this so that they do not have to get out of their car and can finish their routes faster. I have caught my mail carrier doing this several times. Try to report it but the bureaucrats don't care about anything except a paycheck and benefits. Absolute disgrace.

name: Marcus Davinport
text: This place is horrible.  The people working the window are great.  But everyone else is horrible.  Driver forgot to deliver package for two days. Showing OUT FOR delivery two days. Person at post office said that it did not mean out for delivery only that it was at post office.  Which is worse a driver not delivered for two days or that it sat at your post office for two days.......

name: A S
text:
This negative review is more a reflection of one of the passport agents, and not so much the staff collectively.

Last week, the passport agent on duty was a blonde lady who was very helpful and sweet. Fast-forward to today, and now it is a black man who is exactly the opposite of what the lady was.

I walk in at 11:32 and he tells me that I have to leave and go to the court house because 'she' (as he gestures to a lady filling out paperwork) will be his last customer for the day.

Now, the lady sitting there was, as I said, filling out the paperwork for the passport application. I, on the other hand, had completed paperwork in-hand, along with all required identification and monies. Instead of just allowing me to turn in my paperwork and pay my fees *ahead* of the lady filling out paperwork, he directs me somewhere else; which translates to, "I'd rather sit here and wait for this lady to finish her paperwork so that I don't have to do anything for a while."

I also mentioned to him that I had visited or attempted to visit that office nearly every day over the past week (so that he would know that I have been making every effort to get this taken care of), and even though he said, "I understand, but...," we all know he couldn't care less. Saying "I understand, BUT..." is the customer service equivalent of, "Your issue/need doesn't matter."

The employees at the front desk are nice enough, and always helpful; but the gentleman I speak of in particular has left a very bad taste in my mouth.

name: dwight bush
text: The front counter employees are great! I noticed that they are very helpful to all customers. They show concern for their customers. Very friendly people!

name: Kevin McCullouch
text: I went here about 11 today to send a care package off. The short brunette lady was such a help and was super polite.

name: Andrea Benjamin azu
text: The people in this post office are great

name: M A
text: Excellent staff , very friendly and helpful, if you are polite while talking to them, they will do everything to help you 👍🏻💚

name: Noah Walker
text: First "Treda" is the women that never called me back for anyone who calls. These people suck, my package was "delivered" but i never got it. I called three times with a " ill call u right back" and they never called. I asked for the manager and Treda finally got off her but and talk to the carrier. She told me that the guy never delivered a package there or anything, but yet someone had to write down a "delivered" message or the tracking info wouldn't say "delivered". very unsatisfied and will not be using them again.

name: jordan riggan
text: Very unprofessional. Their phone service is nonexistent. An automated voice states you are being transferred to the next available agent and then after several rings it automatically disconnects the call. They could not care less about customer service.

name: Alex Casey
text: Because I live on the county line they tell me they don't service my address. So they refused to help me find my package even though after I track my pack it says that it is in their office. They wouldn't even bother to check. Terrible customer service. Would give 0 stars if I could.

name: Mr. Shakedown
text: Horrible service and don't deliver what they're supposed to deliver

name: Wendy POWELL
text: Very nice employees!!!!

name: Marvellus Prater
text: Excellent service

name: Pamella Vann
text: Over the past year. This post office has continued to go down hill. There is always just one person working and a line out the door. Plan to spend 15-30 minutes here to mail off a package.

name: Steve Downey
text: people at the post office in gilberttown Alabama was very helpful they helped me pick the right boxes that I needed to ship the products that I needed to ship

name: clang theo
text: Great post office with an attentive staff who will. Help you with packaging if necessary.

name: Chapel McCullough
text: Very disappointed with the Auburn, AL Post Office. I’ve lived here over 10 years and they have consistently brought us the wrong mail and sent our mail elsewhere. Some of the time it seems like it’s this same random address because those residents will bring us our mail, and we do the same. This includes very important packages. I’ve called to complain several times and the supervisors I’ve spoken to brush it off to human error and don’t ever offer any solutions, or even real concern. It distresses me to think about what mail I haven’t received over the years. Avoid using the USPS when you can if you live in Auburn!!

name: 마이힐링포인트[my healing point]
text:
I was very worried before I visited here because they were not nice.
But it was pretty okay.
I had a problem with package which seemed to be lost.
Here was one Korean clerk, so I got her help for solving this trouble.
She was really nice and work very harder than others I could feel.
This place is not too bad.

name: ginger2018
text: nobody will answer the phone! two of my packages were delivered and roomate returned them to post office in auburn. now i cant get in touch with anyone.

name: Frances Bailey
text: Wait times are out of this world, no one answers the phone and it says “delivered” when nothing is in my mailbox or on my porch.

name: TheJessicaMorgn
text: this isn't so much about the post office but the carriers, I have been waiting two days for mail and on my app it says I have had mail due to come yesterday and today and the mailman has yet to come and just completely did not come yesterday... I have been waiting two extra days for a package to come that was due to come through usps and STILL have not received it!!  The last mail woman we had was very rude and the carrier has swapped out so many times I never know when mail is going to come, sometimes it's been early and sometimes it won't come until 6-7 p.m. which is ridiculous!! I also can not get in touch with anyone at the office because the darn automated system.... you guys SERIOUSLY need to do better!!!

name: Jimmy Johny
text: If I could give them a zero stars, I would.

name: Mike Kensler
text: A couple days ago I mailed a package to a family member that included a $500 check and dropped it off in the bin inside the post office lobby in Auburn.  Two days later I received a letter from the local P.O. with the check inside it.  Turns out the check had slipped out an unsealed crack in the box.  Thank you Auburn office of the U.S. Postal Service!  And BTW, I have always had competent, courteous service there.

name: Dasha Andrews
text: The guy working the morning was very rude. Will continue doing business with UPS & FedEx for shipments.

name: Jinx !
text: Two packages were left outside my garage door yesterday (rather than at my front door).  Thankfully it was one of the rare times I didn't hop in my car and back right out.  Please do not leave packages where they could easily be run over in the middle of someone's driveway.

name: Tomi Ferguson
text: I would not be sad if this post office closed indefinitely! I have had so many issues I stopped counting. Once, a carrier sat in the truck at the top of the hill by my house, reported a “delivery attempt” and then sped past my husband and I as we stood by the mailbox awaiting our package. I videoed the event and showed it to the postmaster. His response, “ She’s young and she said it was too heavy”. Yesterday my package was returned because my “address was invalid “ yet my regular mail was delivered to my mailbox. Two weeks ago my package was given a false “customer hold request” status despite me never requesting a hold and waiting at home for my package which originally said “Out for Delivery”. This location is unreliable, very rude, & dismissive to customers when you come in, especially the guy at the first window with the “ I cant lift over 50lbs sign!

name: George Martin
text: USPS Auburn is unreliable. My wife and I ordered packages separately and USPS tracking show they were delivered at 8:03pm, but our security system proves that no USPS delivery was made that day. USPS is claiming no responsibility. Additionally, they will not pick up their phone. I let it ring for 15 minutes (out of spite) and no one answered. I've lost hundreds of dollars in items and all USPS told me to do was contact the seller or file a police report... It seems like their carrier hit "delivered" and never delivered it. Additionally, they never knock. We've had elderly neighbors with packages outside their door for days. My wife routinely goes out and knocks on people's door letting them know they have mail.

name: Emma Atkins
text: My mail carrier with USPS has consistently delivered my packages to various addresses in my neighborhood - they are never delivered to my home. I have packages that have been lost because of the carrier, and they have never been found because he refuses to read the numbers of the address on the package. Very frustrating - especially when you need what you ordered.

name: Chennan Xue
text: The Asian lady is the only one who treats everyone fairly and equally. Good luck with the other guys.

name: Sara Hutchins
text: Rudest people i’ve ever had to deal with.

name: Nyjah Byrd
text: Whoever be delivering the mail they leave the mailbox wide open and mix other people mail with others.

name: Jacob Moore
text: Absolute joke.  This is why people don't trust or want the post office anymore.  Waste of tax money.  One person working on a Saturday.  Government waste and abuse at its finest.

name: Jeremy McDaniel
text: Jennifer is a life saver. She helped me pack up two of my packages VERY last minute and made sure everything was good to go for me. Also, I noticed how she gave a distressed women some great advice about her kids. The women thanked her repeatedly and left with a smile. Top notch person and employee! She deserves a raise!

name: vgmaster2001
text: No one knows how to answer a phone. Leaving one start because 0 isn't an option

name: Sydney Stewart
text: My entire trailer park hasn’t seen a mail truck in a week, much less gotten our mail. They’ve lost important mail for me in the past, as well as packages I’ve looked forward to. Saturday I scheduled to have some packages picked up, and they never came. Praying the packages I’m supposed to have delivered show up this week actually show up. If I could give negative stars, I would.

name: Simply Cyndi
text: They CONTINUALLY forward my mail FROM my NEW address to nowhere, instead of forwarding my mail from my OLD address. I never get my mail and they just keep circulating it from "out for delivery" to " back in the warehouse". I have went in and spoken with them and my forward paperwork is CORRECT, it's the mail person actually told me, they just try to remember the forward and have never put the new names on our mailbox. Now I have several packages and mail missing. Including my child's school work that came 10 days late now they won't accept the work to be turned in. NIGHTMARE!

name: Jennifer Manning
text: They will not answer the phone at all. I've had my mail in my business mailbox with the flag up since before daylight this morning. They drive right by it and don't pick it up. Important documents are now going to be late because of them! Worst mail service I have EVER experienced!! They don't even deserve 1 star.

name: Rachel Miller
text: I have never seen, or had experience with, a worse USPS location. This location is slow, inefficient, and rude. Fedex had delivered a package of mine their because I wasn't home, and that was fine. When I even called their location to make sure it was there, they said it was and I asked them to hold it until the next day when I would come by to pick it up. I went and waited in line close to 30 minutes, gave the lady my tracking information, and she said that the carrier took it out for redelivery THAT day, without asking me if that was okay. The package never came. A day later, package still hadn't shown up. I called to the store, no one answered. I called SIX more times in a row, still no one answered. No one has an answer for my where or what happened to my package, and quite frankly they don't care.

name: Jessica YB Lee
text: Asian lady in here is so kind! :)

name: Painted Pony
text: Worst postal service on the planet. Consistent at losing mail, delivering to the wrong address when correct address is plainly provided, rude, and will not answer the phone.

name: Lina Jeon
text: Rude. Wasted $60 because they’ve lost my parcel.

name: Katie Jones
text:
No smiles, no kindness, and not polite or professional.
If they don't like their job, there are many others who would appreciate working for our postal service.

name: Kasha Brown
text: Scheduled a pre-paid 1 package puck up today. Not only was the package NOT picked up, but got a notice saying it was completed successfully. 😡

name: Joan Neptune
text: Never answer the phone (the actual Auburn PO number).  We have a major issue that our mail was to be forwarded as of December 2 for 5 months- I have a confirmation code.  It got dumped on our front porch 2 days ago - according to our Auburn neighbor.  Many important pieces- e.g. bills in the bunch.  I cannot get the PO in Auburn to answer the phone to fix the problem!  The national USPS is trying to fix it - as I called them in desperation - and had a 1 hour wait.  The Auburn PO was great until a couple of years ago and their staff was cut a lot.

name: Anhayt Ananun
text: Some times you need to wait, but my packages were always processed nicely.

name: Karismol
text: I lost $130 from an ebay sale because these guys wouldnt accept a phone call in a reasonable amount of time. Just go to UPS, the guys working there are actually pretty cool too.

name: Caleb Williams
text: Slow, poorly organized, rarely helpful, and inefficient. Needs better leadership. The only thing consistent about this post office is that my mail will get skipped on Friday.

name: Zac Joseph
text: Carrier pigeons and sending letters by horseback are more reliable than this branch - if you're having something delivered use anyone else. My last 3 packages have been lost in some capacity despite being marked delivered by carrier.

name: Matt Ouellette
text: Consistently returning my mail and packages to sender claiming my address is incomplete due to it not having an apartment number, even though my house does not have a unit number. Whenever I try to resolve with a supervisor, after waiting usually for over half an hour, they tell me that my address is just unique as it is a house in a complex that contains primarily condos, and that there’s nothing they can do to help. It is simply just laziness on their delivery drivers and lack of management or care from their supervisors.

name: Joshua Nolan
text:
I'd have better luck tying my mail to a weather balloon or untrained pigeon. This office is one of those places you'd avoid like the plague, because, like the plague, you know with 100% certainty that they're going to mishandle your packages. They're a fundamental lesson that in life some things are unfair, and some people/organizations take great pride in meting out that unfortunate truth.

I've had several deliveries go through transit at this location. Every time the package sits in limbo for one business week at this location—regardless of shipping or mail type. The USPS shipping logs read like they're torn from a time-traveler's diary. They show processing at the beginning of the week only to have it magically appear back at this office by Thursday. And for their trouble of pretending to deliver the package? Well, they hold it over the weekend and the vicious cycle continues.

I've had customers complain constantly enough that I'll no longer be using USPS for the sole fear of having my package land at this location. So take that USPS Auburn. Vengeance is mine and my passive-aggressive comment will stand the test of time for more countless, forgotten packages.

name: Josiah Ayala
text: Horrible. Can’t deliver on time. Go there to pick up my package and it’s not even there. Been waiting all day for it again and still nothing. USPS in this area is just god awful.

name: Zuri Suero-Lepper
text: They have lost a lot of mail and packages that are supposed to arrive. I have never lived near a post office as awful as this one. Glad I moved!

name: Johanna Bottoms
text: Had our mail on hold during vacation. Went to pick up 10 days later. 3 important pieces of mail were missing. Ended the hold and now a week later, we are not getting any mail as if we never ended the hold. Tried to call, expected wait time on hold is 1 hour! Another trip to the post office.  If this was a business with competition,  they would be in trouble.

name: Gogineni Srinath
text: Unfortunately just i cant give a rating less than this, but terrible service, they just dont care about the customers, they have huge lines always

name: Benjamin McDaniel
text:
No problems for over 20 years until carrier changed.

The new carrier regularly delivers mail to wrong address or falsifies dates on “sorry we missed you” slips to make it appear they delivered days before actual delivery attempt.

name: Brian Plowcha
text:
This is the worst branch imaginable.

Have lost 2 packages (w/ priority tracking) in 2 weeks. Nobody here cares. Expect to wait 45 mins if you need in-person service.

name: Braymon Brooks
text: Stated my package was left on my porch at 7:55pm yesterday, odd I was outside on the grill from 6:30-9pm didn't see a mail truck.

name: Robert Ward
text: If the substitute person gets within a half mile or so of my mailbox.Any mail box is just fine with them. Big big joke. Can't read #'s I guess.

name: Cary Way
text: This is Cary’s wife Amy, I love the post office!  I still love sending mail with crazy stamps😃

name: Nick Johnston
text: Packages often arrive damaged or do not arrive at all. Your phone system is terrible. I always try to use other services if I can.

name: Kayla Truong
text: Very bad services. They were not very helpful when they lost my mail and all of a sudden it was my fault that THEY couldn't find an address and when i came back to pick it up they said it was no longer there. Life's great.

name: Jessie M
text: Generally have never had a bad experience here UNTIL TODAY. ABSOLUTE worst service and attitude.

name: Amod Karki
text: Always a great experience with quick and friendly staff.

name: weez larti
text: They literally stole my package

name: Ivy Lee
text: Thanks to Eunjoo, I had such a pleasant experience  at this post office.  She is so friendly and efficient. I appreciated her service a lot. Happy New Year!

name: Betsey Grubbs
text: So we have a little yellow card in our p.o. box for pickup of some material at the counter.  They hand me a package of maybe 25 letters held together with a rubber band.  When I check the letters they are various incoming checks to our company, in the range of $20,000 and invoices that are requesting payment from other companies.  The problem with this is that the letters were all about 5 months old and must have been hanging around the post office since January (now June) and all the checks have been cancelled and many of the invoices have  been received again with dunning notices and late charges.  Thanks Post Office, keep up the good work.

name: Keba Sanders
text:
Update: This is the WORST USPS location ever. They lost yet another package. They have been late delivering and/or lost multiple my packages in the last 4 months. Why am I still forced to deal with them? I wish companies were exclusively UPS...I would even take FedEx at this point.

I dont like the USPS in general most of the time. They make inconvenient mistakes and are in general difficult to get in contact with due to long phone holds, which I'm pretty sure is due to the fact they just dont want to answer the phone as their actual hold time is usually double the "estimated hold time." Not impressed with the customer service at this location, but that is my experience and it was one employee, I believe someone in charge to say the least. The other employees seemed pleasurable. However, no one really helped with my problem. They never even followed up for my lost package. I had to go BACK the next day. My advice? Use UPS as much as possible, or at least FedEx. USPS, specifically this location, is a joke.

name: Andrew Cooper
text:
Pretty bad. They purposefully under staff the front forcing a large line
to form and only bring out more people when the line is out the door. When the line goes back down they pull people off starting the whole thing over again.

name: Mrs. jenkins
text: Always good service. Very friendly. I really like all the workers there. One guy there has a back injury and he still in good spirit to service our needs thank you sir very much. And to all of the workers there thank you for all you do.

name: Wendy Gray
text: Service here is always very slow. Things always take longer than you would expect them to and the employees manning the desk plod along at a leisurely pace, regardless of the number of people in line. That being said, I recently called the post office and someone answered the phone (which they never used to do before!). They were also very helpful. This has bumped up my rating of them.

name: Elijah Eiland
text: The absolute worst customer service i have ever experienced at a post office. The employees are friendly but the Supervisor was awful. They don’t know where there carriers are and they lost my $1000 phone then found it after waiting 7 hours. The supervisor was extremely rude and told me she was not going to allow me to sit in my car and wait for “her” carriers to return with MY phone. Pathetic. Next time i will go to UPS. Never again.

name: Robert McConnell
text: On a very busy day, the lady was very nice and helpful getting my card out for Christmas, and she saved me from a long wait in line.

name: Dennis Self
text: Normally would be OK with home delivery service, but this summer, we entered a stop mail for a couple of days while out of town. When we got back after no deliveries for an additional couple of days I had to go by post office and complain. Next day, still no mail. Had to make a return trip. They couldn't just give me my mail because it was "on the truck." Finally four days after it should have been delivered they delivered, and some of the pieces of mail was mail that should have been delivered prior to the original mail stoppage. Now, here we are again in the fall. Stop the mail for two days and not only has it not been delivered but have Amazon package that should have been delivered today--even though Amazon says "out for delivery today (at 8am this morning).

name: Glenn R
text: This group is the poster child for why we don't want the government running healthcare!! 5 wrong deliveries in 2 days.

name: Chae Lucy
text: She just put me hold and not answering the phone again

name: Abigail Springer
text: sent my mail to Ohio instead of Alabama

name: Zach Chow
text: My girlfriend tried to send cookies to me in Arkansas for Valentine's Day through this post office and I received them on April 30th, ten weeks late. They were stale and the love she baked them with had nearly worn off. I sent flowers to her in Auburn through UPS and they got there in two days. The superiority of private sector delivery over the 19th century socialist Post Office model could not be more evident.

name: Streetninja 0909
text: Very slow. And some legal issues were brought to my attention recently. I'd avoid the place if you can.  Fun fact: UPS is just as good and they cost about the same for larger packages. USPS should go out of business.  We should stop subsidizing mail.

name: Summer Jones (One Motion Media)
text: So slow! Always one person attending people at the busiest times.

name: Nicole Linen
text: I ordered a small package from a company out of state and the package was sent with tracking. The package had been marked as "Delivered," but it was not in my mailbox or on my porch. I called the post office to explain, and they said the package was not at the post office and the logbook noted it had been delivered. But I told them it was not in my possession. I was then told I would have to come to file a claim online, which included waiting to hear back from the claims department. After a week and a half of no response, I filed another online claim. Still no response, so I called the local office and was told I would have to come into the office to file a claim. After filing the claim in the office I was told that I would be contacted later that same day because the person who handles the claims was not in. The business day came and went, and I never heard from anyone. So when I called the next day, I was told I needed to come into the office TO FILE ANOTHER CLAIM. I did...AGAIN...and was told that someone would contact me. They didn't. After calling the office a THIRD TIME, I spoke with someone who said they had been looking for my package and could not find it. He then went door to door in my neighborhood only to find that the package had been delivered to a neighbor 3 houses down the street. I was irritated to say the least.

name: Kassie Mink
text: The customer service at this establishment is absolutely horrid. I'm not usually one to give bad reviews, but I am absolutely appalled.

name: R Lane
text:
As a business owner I take packages to the post office daily and fortunately am able to purchase my shipping labels online. However when I have to file a claim in person, this is the post office I go to. Today, after dealing with a similar situation in the past, I had to request my guaranteed money back for a late Priority express delivery. Teresa, the supervisor I had the misfortune of speaking with, refused to process my claim spouting off numerous reasons why that were entirely false. My receipt said one day money back guarantee by 3pm when I purchase it two days previously. Since it was delivered an entire day late, not just missing the 3pm mark, it was obvious that I should be refunded.

Fortunately, USPS recently changed their site to allow for online Priority express claims. I was able to enter my tracking number and IMMEDIATELY was approved for a refund because tracking showed it took two days instead of the guaranteed one.

If a website can do your job better than you can, I see no reason why money should be wasted paying your salary.

This incident was reported and Teresa has received a formal complaint for inability to follow policy as stated in the Domestic Mail Manual.

name: Brandon Nickolson
text: They are consistent at one thing and that's loosing mail. The worst post office ever. I try my best not to even get close to this horrible place. They have lost numerous pieces of mail of mine and they have no clue where it goes. They have one job to do and fail daily at that.

name: Chris Lewis
text: Returned Amazon package saying invalid address. We have had multiple packages delivered to the same address in the past.

name: Colton McLean
text: It’s almost comical how incompetent this post office is. The most unfortunate thing about them is they are funded by us, the taxpayer and they have shown that means absolutely nothing to them. They deliver mail to the wrong address at least once a week, the delivery driver is always on her phone (I’ve said thank you as she has dropped packages at the door and she paid absolutely no mind because of the phone), doesn’t knock to notify packages are there, and to top it off she has started this new thing of saying “receptacle blocked” when in fact it is by no means blocked (to add insult to injury both my neighbor and I have door mailboxes that are postmaster approved). I’ve had 2 different mail people who have never said that at any point in time. The mail is delivered at inconsistent times. Overall summary this place is the worst joke you’ve ever heard.

name: Danielle Spiker
text: Literally the worst post office I've ever had to deal with. Very rude employees and not helpful at all. I feel like I could hand-deliver my mail faster than they could help me.

name: V B Richardson
text: Excellent customer service by counter helpers. Very helpful and make you feel like you are an important person!

name: Debi McAlister
text: Our mail carrier has not even shown up at 6:30 today.  She has an attitude problem and is out many, many days.  We need a carrier who cares and it is more than just a paycheck.

name: Brendan Fagen
text: If you have any business to conduct use UPS or Fedex instead -- quicker, easier, and guaranteed delivery in 3 days. Also, don't call them if you live in auburn-- it's faster to physically go to the post office to talk to someone, based on how long i was on hold

name: Madison Panter
text:
I was originally informed that the package I ordered has a wrong address. I scheduled a redelivery. The next day it said again the address was insufficient. I gave the clerk the correct address. Then, I scheduled to have the package picked up at this post office.

The package was for  someone else. He went to pick it up and they confirmed it was there but it couldn't be picked up that day cause of some policy. They said he would have to come back tomorrow. I called first thing that day to make sure it wasn't returned to sender. The clerk then tells me it was never available at the post office for pick and was returned the day before.

I have been told 5 different things from employees at this location and the call center. I spent $150 on this gift plus shipping. It's now being sent back and I'll have to wait for to repurchase and get it delivered AGAIN. At this point they should be responsible for all costs that I paid.

name: Odin J
text:
My mother had horrible experiences with the same blond-haired African American woman twice recently. She seems like a new employee. She has a bad attitude toward a certain race. My mom is Asian. This employee was extremely rude. At first she didn't speak at all, basically using her head to gesture as if my mom wasn't even a human being. It was extremely disrespectful. Clearly she thought just from my mom's appearance that she couldn't understand a single word of English. She also seemed extremely impatient, not bothering to explain any of the shipping options. Paid about $180 for international shipping. Good service should be expected everywhere, but it is even more infuriating to have to pay this much while receiving this kind of treatment. Is this woman racist or does she have a terrible attitude toward all customers? I don't know.

Be nice to everybody!

name: Sogol Momeni
text: The staff were really rude when I wanted to know where my package is!!!!

name: Colin
text: This post office is just a joke. They lost a really important document of mine and I asked them to write a letter for me to acknowledge they lost my package. Since the package they lost is a document which does not have any value, there is no point to tell them that I did not receive it if my package was actually successfully derived. A white lady at the post office refused to do anything for me given the fact that I talked to her really politely, she even did not want to help me check the address on my package. That is not all, you know what, when I call the post office, the people who answered my call is exactly that white lady, she lay to me that there is not searching result for the case number that I provided. I am not saying all the people working at this post office is bad, but unfortunately that white lady who is the post office manager is the worst people I have ever dealt in my life. It's not fair to not to use USPS just because of one bad people, but I have to say that I will never choose USPS again.

name: Brent Butts
text: I live in constant fear that my letters will not arrive or be sent out properly. We constantly get others mail and they constantly get ours. So frustrating

name: sundae mundae
text: Slow service, bad attitudes from The AA women who work here, a blonde haired AA clerk and AA female with glasses who usually works from the back office but occasionally services in the lobby. These two  are unprofessional, usually the laziest  and always do the opposite of what I've paid for in choices of how I send off my mail, be weary of these two  they're not worth your time.

name: Rainbow Grahamcrackers
text: Up until yesterday, I was thinking the mail carrier for my area was doing fine  aside from running the route at inconsistent times. But yesterday, they were supposed to deliver a package to my mailbox. It just so happened my apartment number was missing off the label. But that was it. (I did put my whole address in on the order, not sure why the heck it was missing.... I have contacted them directly as well.) There were other pieces of mail in their hand with my name printed on them exactly the same way as it was on the damn package! Not to mention, this is a complex with a nice lady a few paces away from where the mail is delivered that can be asked which person the package goes to... Then they go and make the choice all on their own, to send my package alllll the way back to the place I ordered it from! What the deuce!!!? AND I'M THE ONLY PERSON HERE WITH THE NAME THAT'S ON THE PACKAGE!!!! Really, there was no logical thought to at least hold the package for a bit? Obviously someone ordered it and is expecting it! Pure dumbassery over here. Seriously, get your stuff together with who you guys hire, Auburn USPS!!

name: Veronica Zhang
text: I had a bad experience there before. I was shipping a package to China, after I filled out the forms, the white lady who was supposed to help me with the shipping went to the back room and did not come back to the front desk for at least 20 minutes. She was just refuse to show up even her work mates went to the room trying to find her! I had no idea why I need to wait over thirty minutes even after I filled out the forms for the shipping!!! Thanks for the sympathy of a black male employee there, I was finally able to ship the package. Since then I would rather use the online shipping then go to the post office to face the bad attitude!

name: Ainsley Horton
text: Worst damn post office ever. My mail was claimed to be put into the parcel locker but I was never given a key to access and when I finally confronted them about it there was no mail there. These people only have one job to do and they're terrible at it. If you don't want to work do not have a job, especially one that involves something  viable to people's lives. The only thing I'm sure they know how to do is be idiots.

name: Shannon Smith
text: Their delivery system does suck, but I’ve never had any issues with customer service. Their phone system is a hassle but when I finally got through to a real person, a man named Patrick answered my question thoroughly and was very polite.

name: Greer Miceli
text: I have been using this post office for a year and didn’t have a problem until today. However, it is a serious problem. I am an artist and I mail a lot of drawings out to various locations around the country. I have always had the post office mark my packages “DO NOT BEND” and “FRAGILE”. The most recent drawing I sent was received by the buyer bent and wrinkled and unusable. I am VERY disappointed and will go out of my way to not use this post office again.

name: Katherine Holmes
text: This is the WORST post office ever! Sometimes I wonder if the same people who work here also work at the local McDonald's. the employee's act the same (terrible attitudes & acting as if we the people forced your had to work here) Auburn post office had yet again to LOOSE another package of mine! Its ridiculous! Please if your reading this: Deliver your own packages ! CAUSE THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE!

text: I'm a super nice person generally but I'm out of patience for them!!!!!!! USPS shipman stole my package and EVERYTIME I call them I have to wait like 2h!!!!!!!!!! So I have never successfully contact them and report it over 10 days!!!!!!! I booked things online twice and they both failed to send the packages to me!!!!!!!!  Seriously they don't even deserve one star of the rate!!!!!! I haven't seen any service is worse than theirs!!!!!!!!  I asked my friends who have used USPS and they all hated it!!!!!!! This campany should close soon if they continue do what they are doing!!!!!!! To USPS: Good luck with letting everyone hates it bc you will!!!!!!!

Yet they deny to ever have made those mistakes. The drivers (on my route at least) are careless as I've sat inside my door and watched one physically throw a package at my door from yards back. Sick of the horrible service - trust me, I don't want to come in just as bad as yall don't want me there!

If anyone knows his name please respond to this or me so I can file a complaint against him, Thank you.

name: Cassandra Aaron
text: A vehicle was left at my property a month ago. I found the papers with the loan agreement and called to see if they were looking for said vehicle. The first time I was told someone would be to retrieve it. Noone ever picked car up. Again I called and was told again someone would be to get it. I waited almost 3 weeks before calling again, at this time I was told they had to talk with someone to see if they wanted the vehicle. When I called back two weeks later, because I was told someone would call me back, I was told they didnt want the car. I proceeded to  get said vehicle off my property  when I was told I had to get a WRITTEN letter stating they didnt want the car before I could proceed with getting car off my property.  My husband went to the office and they REFUSED to give him any documentation.  They did call the other party but was told again they needed WRITTEN documentation before PROCEEDING AGAIN THEY REFUSED..IM VERY FRUSTRATED AND AM VERY CONCERNED THAT THEY WERENT WILLING TO GO ABOVE AND BEYOND TO SATISFY A CUSTOMER. I Intend to go where I need to go in the company to get this resolved. VERY VERY UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER.

resp.text: Cassandra - please contact the corporate office at 864-515-5600 and ask for Stephanie Wade.
