text: Very unprofessional, horrible experience

name: Cheyenne last
text: Local post office says closes at 4pm. Arrive at 3:50 doors locked. 2nd post office I tried to mail out boxes. First one at Ryland and Jordon had a sign that said go here. Not happy😔

name: George Howard
text: Excellent post office. Fast service at almost anytime and a very friendly staff. We shipped a lot of stuff through this post office and they were great!

name: Andy Bennett
text: Always friendly service and never a long wait, I am  usually the only person when going inside.

name: June Walton
text: Went in to see if I could retrieve a package before it was sent back to sender after the tracking said “no such number found.” I haven’t had a chance to put a mailbox up at my address yet. The lady was super nice to me when she explained that they can’t deliver packages without a mailbox and I am very appreciative to know that now but then I went to go check my P.O. Box and she immediately started talking to her colleague about how “people just don’t know how carrier services work and that they just think we can deliver packages without a mailbox. Where are we going to put them, on the ground?” I hardly ever get packages through usps because most places I order from sue fedex and ups and so I was unfamiliar with all this but really? Immediately think people are dumb?

name: Lindi Pearson
text: This post office is great! I go in about 3 times a month and have always had a wonderful experience. The staff has always been very friendly, accommodating, helpful, and genuinely concerned with my mail getting to me. Now my delivery person is horrible with packages, just throwing them from her window. However, the people actually working at the post office are different and I have always witnessed them being gentle and respectful of my packages.

name: B Lew
text: Great team n very helpful.

name: Crystal Dawn
text: I'm very very upset with the post office because any time my mail carrier delivers a package she will literally just throw it. most of the time this is Michael Kors perfume or name brand makeup I've had to go back to Ulta and exchange my items because they are shattered and broken twice. And if my mail carrier continues to throw my packages I will be installing a security camera and sending the video to the news. The packages I receive have air packs in them to prevent anything from getting broken but they're being throwing so hard that they are breaking and I really don't appreciate that. I spend an average of $300 on each package and to receive them broken and have to Drive 25 minutes one way to replace these items is unacceptable.

name: Kristen Harris
text: Lydrell is everything that makes USPS great. He's such a responsive post man that takes care of those on his route, and even those who were formerly on his route.

name: CHEER
text: Eugine was very rude to me. He had a terrible attitude. Very rude demeanor and he rolled his eyes at me when I asked him a question. Terrible experience! All I wanted to to was safely mail my families Holiday gifts.

name: Missy Fantusi
text: There was no waiting, and people were social distancing. Very good service

name: Gabe Ledesmas
text: This branch is looong overdue for an upgrade. There are no drop bins for packages, no self serve kiosks. Yet there are what seems to be miles and miles of PO boxes? Now during Covid, you are asking me to wait in line, in tiny confined space with about 10 other people?! I literally drive to other post offices to avoid this one. I give it two stars because the employees seem to always be helpful and efficient, although their customer service demeanor could use  a little help.

name: Zack Shields
text: Both employees were friendly and helpful.  I had to wait a bit in line, but nothing too bad, and this is understandable because both customers in front of me were mailing international items.  This has been the best experience at a United States Post Office that I have had at any of their locations.

name: Keey Keey
text: Eugene wasn’t helpful bad customer service

name: lana mccay
text: the floors and p.o box need cleaning also the doors

name: Boadicea Holman
text: After I moved in the apartments off of Clinton Avenue about a year ago, I have been having the hardest time with my mail. I live with a family of 5 people and my last name is the only different one out the group that receives mail. My mail will not end up in the mailbox when it is expected to. The first time was for my driver’s License and it was not delivered. The court house had to send it out a second time and thankfully it showed up or else I would’ve had to pay another $60 for a retake. Then, it was my notice for my Medicaid that lets me know I need to refile. I had not received it and so now I don’t have insurance coverage. Now it is my debit card and I had one that was supposed to be here a month ago and it is still not here. So I called my bank so they can send me another one after confirming my address, and I am giving them until tomorrow before I go to extreme measures. I have went up to the post office and filed claim cards and talked to the delivery supervisor myself because the delivery people won’t put my mail on the box. Even my mother has talked to managers and supervisors before me. My last name is literally on the inside of the box, written on an index card and tapped on the inside of the door, that is how drastic it is. If you can go anywhere else to get your mail, do it, because right now I am struggling to pay my bills because of this nonsense.

name: Philip Anderson
text: Clerks are always helpful, friendly, and efficient.

name: Dan P
text: Very efficient and super friendly. Possibly the best USPS!

name: Morgann Peters
text: Clerks are usually friendly but they rarely answer the phone. Lines are almost always long, but the kiosk for self shipping is AMAZING. They should have more of those kiosks available for the holidays.

name: Heather Rose
text: Fast, friendly and helpful service. Drop boxes in the parking lot.

name: Jeska Lewis
text: Always fast friendly service, they stay open until 6pm where all the others in Huntsville close at 430pm

name: Lady T
text: Short line, maybe I just went at the right time. The clerk help me with my initial packaging. I was in and out in five minutes.

name: PinkDaisy65
text: No self serve Kiosk!!!  Unable to get packages metered and mailed on weekends.☹

name: Chris Cutts
text: My package was not delivered on time and then lost. And of course no one answers the phone to give you any information.

name: Tia M. Grubb
text: Very helpful and patient!

name: Chris Williams
text: Hey lazy P.O.S. mail lady. Use your pea brain for once. DO NOT LEAVE PACKAGES OUTSIDE OF BUSINESSES BECAUSE YOU ARE TOO LAZY AND OR OVERWEIGHT TO TAKE THEM BACK TO THE POST OFFICE. IT DOESNT MATTER WHAT THE PACKAGES SAT, ESPECIALLY WHEN I HAVE TOLD YOU ON NUMEROUS OCCASIONS NOT TO LEAVE PACKAGES OUTSIDE THE DOOR. I WILL DO EVERYTHING IN MY POWER TO GET YOU FIRED. IM TIRED OF YOU LAZY POST OFFICE PEOPLE. USELESS

name: Kelly Grimes
text: It's a busy post office but I come in with my stuff prepackaged and get in and out . They all recognize me now and always say hello.

name: K Allen
text: This is the worst post  I ever seen I can't to move away from here.

name: Carlos Baker
text: Speedy, friendly service.  Clean, spacious office in a convenient location.

name: Donna Houser-Larriett
text: I’m STILL searching for my package that they delivered a street over from my home.  I haven’t heard from the postmaster and I stop by every few weeks and leave my info.  Ten months now and they have not paid me or come up with my package.  If I go in and see an employee wearing my merchandise I’m immediately calling the authorities!!!

name: John Moseley
text: New facility.  Very clean and well lit. The people are nice.

name: chelsey love
text:
I never write reviews, but im litterally fed up with this office and their mail drivers id give them a 0 if possible. Im not sure why they havent closed this location down.

Im in a warehouse location and we have 3 signs up that direct them to deliver larger items to the back building that wont fit into the mail box.

Our front office is closed after 10 am.
they ignore the signs and either leave items in front of the door or attempt to re deliver instead of driving their trucks back to the open dock through the gate and just leave them there. We’ve also talked to 2 drivers about this also and they continue to be lazy and dont so it.

We’re pretty much done and wont be using USPS for deliveries anymore other than mail, we’ve had over several issues and its not worth dealing with the location or the drivers about because their lazy and dont care so they dont fix anything.

name: Glen Malone II
text: The place looks really good and the people helping are very nice.

name: Master Yoshi
text: Again, I'm going to give this post office 1 star because there is no way to take away stars. This is the third time in 6 months though this time they have lied, lost my package or threw it away. There is a disconnect between their corporate and their office management, management doesn't respond to emails nor call customers back, they don't take responsibility for their employees throwing away packages, and can't handle their business at all. The office itself is a joke and the employees don't care about anything besides getting you out of their locations even if it means they lie to get you to go away. Absolutely terrible and only seems to be getting worse.

name: Lisa Thompson
text: The postal workers are thrives,stupid,can't read,the I tire time I've lived in the same place for 25 yrs mail is never delivered correctly,I've lost SO MUCH MERCHANDISE,mail,checks,had utilities cut off,invitations, etc due to non delivery!! This place is a fkn joke! If you call to complain nothing is done,I've even received mail with racist remarks like trash on them!

name: Key Freeman
text: I'm pissed off because no one ever answers the phone. Every Tuesday now for a while the post man never runs n if they do it's super late n I wanna know why. If I call the 1800# it's still hard to get someone on.the damn phone. I don't want to go up there n be rude bt it looks like I'mma have no choice.

name: Mz Pretty
text: Their attitudes are very NASTY!!! They talk to the customers very bad !! Every time I send mail to my husband he never gets in the time frame that it takes!!! I hate this post office!!! They need to FIRE EVERY LAST ONE OF THEM AND HIRE A WHOLE NEW STAFF IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!

name: Carletta Davis
text: the new location is nice and much more efficient

name: Cord James
text: This post office is awful, you can never reach them on the phone, they place your packages where it can be stollen, my package has been at the post office for 6 days was supposed to be delivered nov 30 now it's dec 2.

name: Tom Hagood
text: They loose and misdirect an appalling percentage of the  parcels that were supposed to be directed to me and they are not accountable!

name: jeffrey vaughn
text: Postal driver must have mental or entitlement issues. Throws packages at doorstep

name: Frog Price
text: Nice people work there.

name: Danielle Kinney
text: This is probably the worst post office I’ve ever had to deal with. I am constantly getting others people’s mail/packages. My mail doesn’t get delivered for weeks. Packages saying they are delivered but never delivered or even attempted. Notes left saying they attempted to deliver but no one was home when there’s someone at my house at all times. Can never answer their phones. This will be the second time I have to go down to the office to retrieve my package. Our lady before was okay, but our new lady is absolutely terrible. So frustrating

name: Bethany Golden
text: We have had a lot of issues getting our mail delivered. Packages left on the ground by the mailbox, packages delivered days late, paper mail arriving weeks after the post date, the mail carrier honking the horn the entire way up the driveway, I could go on. But what has really frustrated us is that a package was jammed in the door between the screen and regular door and it broke the screen door. When I called, the supervisor is completely denying that it is possible that this happened. She came out, looked, and is sticking to the mail carrier’s story that she didn’t close the door all the way. When I pointed out that the package was not wet after it rained, meaning that she had to have closed the door hard, and pointed out that she left the paper mail in the door as well, which included a check, the supervisor said the carrier did this as a kindness since it was raining. Okay, but it is not kindness to break the door, lie about whether you closed it, leave paper mail in the door, and then refuse to accept any kind of part in what happened. The supervisor is saying there is no way the carrier could have broken it and that they are not going to do anything. So we have to eat the cost of fixing it and the worst part is that there is no other way to get mail except to go through this post office. So frustrating. I hope there is some sort of accountability at some point and that these things stop happening.

name: Angela Nagle
text:
This is the fourth or fifth time I've had issue with this post office/carrier not delivering my packages correctly. The most recent, last week, she left a pair of shoes sitting on the road underneath my mailbox. I am now being told by the seller (and tracking number) that another pair I ordered were delivered, although I have yet to see them. I've tried talking to a supervisor, but she's never available, and won't return my calls.  This carrier apparently sets her own schedule a she is apt to show up as late as 8:00 PM, as well a on Sundays because she didn't do her deliveries on Saturday. The last package I had issues with was never delivered to my address, but because it was only about $6 and the seller (on EBay) refunded my money, i let it go. Well, i am done letting things go where this post office is concerned! DO YOUR JOB!

Update one year later:
Still constantly delivering my packages to the wrong address, and you can NEVER get anyone to answer the phone at their location. Horrible service from both the carrier, and the manager at this location.

name: Jessica Campbell
text: Always have a problem getting packages from them. Love getting a notice that something needs a signature only to see on the box that its not required. OR my favorite...attempt to deliver and some crazy reason they couldn't ...yet my camera shows no one ever attempted to ring the door. Then to add..your hours suck so it becomes a nightmare trying to make it up there in time to get my stuff.

name: Chris Mosley
text: I LOVE my local McCalla Post Office folk!  When I go in to the counter I'm treated with courtesy, and they're always helpful.  Mail delivery at the house is reliable, and when I occasionally see my mail carrier, she is always friendly.

name: Wrath
text: Want to have your stuff either lost or stolen? Go ahead. Don't expect any employee here to be honest or take any responsibility either. Can't say I'm surprised though, this is USPS afterall. The incompetence here is a complete joke. Oh and if you have an issue, the post master will say one thing then do another. And change her story the whole time. Essentially try to lie her way out of it instead of actually doing her job.

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
Horrible experience. I started doing business with this one because the Bessemer post office felt that because I "receive a lot of packages" that they can just help themselves and keep stuff for themselves. This post office wasn't much better.

I had a paid PO box... and of course, the employees would CRAM items  and break them, stuffing the box instead of using a locker. The clerk had  behaved poorly to me, so I closed my box.

Later, my brother closed his, because this post office decided that they would treat him like garbage too. If I'm not mistaken, the same clerk I had trouble with, raised her voice with him. Of course, nobody at customer relations, no postmaster ever cared.

Pick a different parcel carrier, because at least you'll get your money's worth, instead of being treated like a criminal.

name: Brian Baker
text: Been waiting all week on a package. Was transferred from FedEx to the post office yesterday. Today tracking said out for delivery. Never received package and comment from USPS says " customer not available or business closed" it's a residence and I've been here waiting on it! They never attempted to deliver it or the rest of my mail!

name: KEN BROWNSON
text: Always helpful go there Dailey there job there is done to detail very nice always patient with me and my messups .

name: Michael M
text: Whoever is coming to my house has VANDALIZED my mailbox with the wrong street address, 3 times now. I even made a new post, a brand new white mailbox with clear numbers on the sides, and woke up the next day to the wrong address etched on the front again. Absolutely ridiculous, I am afraid to ship anything to my house now in fear that it will go wherever this person decides it should.

name: Joe Dixon
text: This PO has mis-delivered mail to a similar address as mine several times, but when I called the Post Master he was courteous and apologetic. Since that time, mis-delivery has not occurred. The carriers are always friendly. When much younger I worked at the PO, and I would say for a small town PO, this one is fine.

name: Chris keel
text: Have tried calling 10 times and let phone ring until it disconnects.  What bullshit.  They are open.  I called huey town post office they answered 1st try and verified mccalla phone number

name: Crystal Shoults
text: Super friendly and helpful employees!

name: mark allinder
text: at home all day and they leave a notice it my mail saying item couldnt be delivered because no one was home when they never came to my door so now i have to wait another 2 days

name: Mark Clark
text: Can't even get a call returned are talk anyone REALLY....... this automated phone service a••s

name: Becky Mealer
text: They are always so rude.

name: Marshal Conover
text: Like watching a glacier melt in the antarctic. The packages take forever to get sorted and marked for pickup. If your package was "delivered" to the post office, then come back 48 hrs to pick it up. They need to develop a faster mechanism to sort mail. I have a feeling they haven't changed the process since the base opened in 1910.

name: kap kim
text: Maxwell Air Force Base is blessed to have this postal station on base. More over, we are lucky to have Shelia there. I always find reasons to ship things off because it's such a treat to just exchange pleasantries with her. Though we are going through tough times, she has made sure each and every package I have brought there (there have been hundreds) made it out expeditiously. kk

name: 2HOT Tray3415
text: It is absolutely incredible how poorly run the post office is now. The amount of packages that aren't delivered because the delivery person is beyond lazy or incompetent amazes me. This particular branch is horrible. Good luck getting your package on time or even delivered. Even when they mark it as delivered, it likely won't be. Putting the apartment lockbox key in the wrong mailbox, or straight up not putting the key in the mailbox. It is pathetic. And people really want the government to run more things in our lives.

name: Christopher Walker
text: I have no idea why Sheila has been rated so badly. She the nicest person every time I come in. She is also very good at her job and always tells me the best mailing approach to get my letter or package to its destination on time at the best rate. The reason she is not typically at the counter is because she is “one deep” and has to work in the back to get all of the packages ready for mailing and sort through incoming mail. Just ring the bell like she asks on her sign and she will come right out. She is awesome and is warm and cheerful and very competent.

name: Hailey McNaughton
text: My husband was stationed there for OTS. Long story short we moved and are trying to reach the PO as they have a package of ours that we need. NO ONE ANSWERS THE PHONES. Day three and still no one has answered.

name: Diane SAMs
text: This is my favorite post office location in Montgomery.  Sheila is always pleasant and helpful to all patrons.  I live close to another post office location and gladly drive further to use the Maxwell AFB location.

name: House Of Beauty by Wabanoonkwe
text: The WORST customer service ever! Not only has she (older Caucasian lady with grey hair) humiliates me EVERY TIME I’ve gone in , she Complains EVERY TIME I send a package over seas! Then she makes a public announcement to let everyone in line know that it wouldn’t be so long if it wasn’t for my packages. It’s embarrassing and disgusting. I CANT BELIEVE I had to leave “1” star cause it should be a negative star. I truly tried to have my opinion instead of listening to the online reviews, but I truly feel thier frustration with the poor service at this USPS office.

name: Jorge Serafin
text: I would give a zero if that was an option: Went at 2PM as opening hours stated. 2PM comes and goes and nobody opens. 2:10 comes and goes and nobody opens. At 2:13 a postal employee comes out and informs the line of customers that it will be another 10 minutes before they open. I took my package and went to UPS, last time I try to use our postal service.

name: Matthew Brew
text: Older lady that works the front desk is generally not there and when she is you will very much be on her time table when waiting for or receiving service. One time, after shuffling around in the back for a while looking for someone's lost package, she finally arrived to the service desk just to tell us all she had to go to the bathroom. Couldn't make this up, but shes probably been doing this most her adult life and is nearing retirement. Which is also probably why she came off as rude and condescending every one of my three visits to send a few bank documents. Would have loved to save time/not working with her if my bank didn't need the paper copies...there's a reason people don't use/want to use USPS. The one star/benefit is that it is on base...although closed from 1-2 and always on the weekends..

name: Austin Mattley
text:
Worst post office I have ever visited. They constantly neglect to leave slips in the P.O. Boxes, give out the wrong packages, skip delivery days whenever they want, and the one lady is always rude and never tries help.

Horrible excuse for a post office. I use UPS and FedEx whenever possible.

name: Aaron Bradley
text: I believe the ladies name is Shelia... she is always rude and passively aggressive to customers. It's inappropriate and embarrassing how she treats military members.

name: Tiffany 334
text: Horrible service!!!!

name: Celeste
text: Disrespectful.

name: Jeannine Lewis
text: Put the right number, not no 1800 number!

name: Sean Abernathy
text: It's rarely open, and if you have an issue, there is no direct number to be found for this branch and the worst automated system ever created!

name: Neophyter *
text:
Service is kind and helpful.
Buy a very large mailbox if you have a Amazon Prime membership.

name: White Raven#5477
text: My mail carrier insists on putting mail that doesn't belong in my box in my box. I have repeatedly put it back in the return mail and she repeatedly puts it back in my box I'm sick of it.

name: Marie E
text: There was only one employee. The line and wait were far beyond reasonable! The one employee, a tall bald man, was extremely rude. I had a passport appointment, and he used his phone during the time he was taking my picture. Also, he was hasty and rushed me. He did not mention or suggest anything about priority or express mail or insurance. He lost my application at one point during the process. He told me to write on the form to correct it, when the dept. of state explicitly says NOT to write on the form. When I told him that, he said something to the effect of, "Trust me, I've been doing this for years, and I took the all day class. I know what I'm doing." With a sharp tongue. My application never made it to the dept., and it is now lost with my original birth certificate and a check I had to pay to void, with no way to track it's whereabouts. Absolutely horrible. Id give them -5 stars if I could.

name: George William
text: I’ve lived all over the country. This post office is the absolute worst ever. Soooooooo slow and the employees are clueless. I can only imagine the sight if these workers had jobs where they had to produce. They also need to update their posted hours. I was here on a Saturday right after 8:30 because online it states 8:30. However their window shows 9:00 and of course they didn’t unlock the door until EXACTLY 9:00 in spite of a line waiting outside.

name: Reme lopes
text:
Positive this place is stealing packages
I’ve had two packages say attempted deliver but that they didn’t have access to my apartment building
For three days in a row now, my packages are gone.

My apartment building is never locked and doesn’t even have a lock on it.
Today Saturday was their “ attempted re delivery “ for all of my packages ( sep order)
And no one even showed up.
Also yay me it’s Saturday they said they re delivered around 7 pm which is coincidental that tomorrow they are closed and already closed today.

I will be calling to people above them, to get this area reported.

name: jeffrey mathis
text: Our residence, 3257 Monte Doro Dr, 35216 has had no delivery of mail since Wed., June 2 through Sat., June 5. That's 4 days. I will attempt to be in someone's ear about this.

name: Paul Goodall (PrincePaul)
text:
I scheduled a passport appointment on 1/21/2021.  The appointment was confirmed to take place at 10:00am on 1/26/2021.  I arrived 10 minutes early on the 26th as directed and was informed that... "The guy who does passports isn't here today.  He said he was going to call everyone who had an appointment and let them know.  They called me to come open the store.  I'm not even supposed to be here.  You can wait if you want but usually if he was coming in, he would already be here."

Obviously, I left.

I had to leave work for this appointment and now I'll have to leave again on the 28th... to go to a different location, of course.  You may rest assured I received no call from this man.  You may also rest assured that this place deserves even less than the 1.9 stars they have earned for themselves.

name: Kirsten Ratza
text: I am quite frustrated with this post office. I had a package marked as delivered that never appeared at my home. Now, three weeks later, the same thing has happened again. Another package is marked as delivered but has not appeared.  What is happening to this service?  I would rather have slower but accurate service then missing mail.  Please, if someone of any authority reads this, figure out what is happening to this vital service! We rely on you to do good work.

name: notthebeesxoxo
text: Slow with usually only one person working the entire office. If they are tied up doing passports, they will tell you they can't help you. They have lines out the door of people with one person working always. They will also set out hand written signs that say they will be back later, leaving the doors unlocked and the office completely open with no one in it.

name: Kristen W.
text: I was wary of visiting because all the reviews are bad but it was a good experience. There was a line but Lakita was pleasant and efficient.

name: peter rambin
text: Amazon package not delivered for no apparent reason. Just says held at location and gives me the address for the vestavia post office. Obviously I'm already frustrated since I paid for delivery. I go there and ask if my package is there and the man working very rudely starts cutting me off and telling me I don't have a p.o. box there he doesn't have my package and that it's at green springs location. That's fine and dandy, but could he not tell me nicely it, even in a neutral tone? Why did it set this guy off and why could he not conduct himself like an adult to tell me this? He also appeared to have a nicer shirt in than the other employee as if he might be in charge/the manager which is insane given how he acted like a child. Based on these reviews I'm not alone with incredibly incompetent and rude staff.

name: Kenneth Carden
text: Lazy. The bald guy here will cut corners if he can. Make them verify the address sent and also just go to another post office.

name: William Sellers
text: I don’t even review places but I had to leave this 1 star after my experience today.

name: jacob g
text: Declined service at 3:30 on a monday when no else was in store.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text: In and out in 5 minutes or less. The service was fine. Others complain about the long line. The newer post offices are much bigger. This little place can’t help but have a line. My issues is the building. This location is very old and dark. The location can also be hard to get in and out.

name: JIll Billions
text: This post office is unfortunately the slowest post office ever. The same employees have been there for ages and take their sweet time no matter how long the line is. Occasionally they’ll get a new or temp worker that is smiley and more proficient which is a breath of fresh air. I absolutely dread this post office and often drive farther to a different one. I’ve also mailed cards directly from here that were local and took over 2 weeks to arrive.

name: Jessica Gunter
text: Wouldn't make a copy of change of address to enroll a student as proof of address change for the new school ... school told me that the post office did actually what i needed went to a another post office and got what was needed for the school .... when they told me it would be 10 to 15 business days

name: Jenna Willoughby
text: Very disappointed with my attempted visits here. I had a passport appointment at 10:00 am (first appointment of the day) and when I came in they said all passport appointments had been canceled. She said they called everyone but I did not have a missed call. I scheduled an appointment for another day at 10:00 am. I went in and the man said they canceled all passport appointments again!! I did not have any missed calls, and the night before I received confirmations of my appointment. Not coming back.

name: Matt Burke
text: Friendly but not enough employees especially when they’re the busiest—during lunch hours.  Line is regularly out the door with only 1 employee at the register.

name: Jesse Carter
text: I was 5 min late for a passport appointment after driving 40 min away and having to wait in traffic. She said after 3 min your late and I can't help you. Like exceptions can't be made over 2 min? The past 3 usps ive been too have had awful service. Its like they hire way underqualified people to work there that don't understand what line of work they are in. The answer is customer service by the way. They need to take some training courses to learn how to service people. Mcdonalds has better customer service.

name: Shaun Thomas
text: I called because a package was attempted for delivery to my business and a "notice" was supposedly left because we were closed. There was no notice to be found, and the carrier did not show up the next day to redeliver. The phone number online is a fax line, so no luck calling to get anyone on the line to explain. I've had other similar experiences here in person where employees couldn't be any less concerned with helping customers. I also have had packages taken without being given tracking information after asking for it. Hate having to deal with this office.

name: Adaryl Mines
text: One of the letter carriers rear ended my car not paying attention at a stop light. It's going on 2months and they still haven't called me or my insurance agent back about the repairs my car needs. When you call all you get is the run around and directed to a claims lady that is never in her office nor does she return phone calls.

name: Nikki Aaron
text: A family had an appointment to get passports. Instead of having two desk workers to cover the appointment and regular business, these morons sent the second employee on a long break. So a long line of customers had to wait and wait to get our business handled. I'm so glad we spend all our tax revenue on war instead of on making the government run smoothly.

name: Katie R
text:
I have never used this post office location, as it is not really near my home or work but it was convenient to me yesterday to purchase stamps and mail my Christmas Cards.  This location was by far the most personable I have been to in many many visits.  There was a line out the door but the two clerks working the registers stayed calm and friendly the entire time, even when the system went down and quit taking credit/debit cards.  They were friendly and patient and it was truly a nice experience despite the wait in line.  They were efficient and methodical as well.  Often times at other locations I feel as though the clerks are attempting to see just how SLOWLY they can process everybody in line.

Job well done, despite your location not being convenient to me, I wouldn't mind making the drive just to have this good of service from a postal service office.

name: Stina Journey
text: I tried calling about getting a passport and the lady didn't even care. I am new to the area and didn't know about the walk-in building. I had to ask her about the address for the walk-in building and she quickly told me. I asked about the times they were opened. She quickly told me with a very bad "I'm better than you" voice and hung up. I didn't even get to ask about the application or what forms of ID I needed to bring. I'm definitely not calling back or wanting to be a customer.

name: Seble abadi
text: Worst place to do business at. The staffs are horrible. It’s a place you wouldn’t want to go back again!

name: Marcus Ross
text: Slowest. Post Office. Ever.

name: Christian Mays
text: This post office and the post office downtown were rated some of the United States fastest post offices. Heck yes. My packages have never been late. It's pretty incredible.

name: Jermaine Watkins
text: Took forever to get on the phone & when answered was rushed to get off. Tried to pass me off to the main office several times. I recommend going to the UAB location. They were very nice AND efficient

name: Arnold Servo
text: The single worst experience I had at an USPS office!  I was "served" by Mrs. Joanne Simmons.  It became evident pretty quickly that this lady couldn't care less about working at this office or to fulfill the most minimal and basic duties this government paid job requires.  Admittedly, there might be other great service providers / employees at this facility, but the fact that the disrespectful and incompetent behavior of a person like Joanne Simmons is tolerated there, makes me doubt that this is the case.

name: Richard McCallum
text: Plan to wait at least 10 to 30 minutes if you need to see someone at the counter. You would figure that they would have full staff on busy days like April and October 15th. It seems like every time that their is a deadline, the line is out the door and there is only one person at the counter.

name: Daniel Ford
text: Going to the post office is never fun, but it's not their fault that the lines are long. I've never had anything other than a positive experience here, and I ship packages for my business regularly

name: Tiffany Roberts
text: This is the slowest post office anywhere around. There's only ever 1 cashier and a ton of people in line. It's worth the hassle to just drive to Hoover where they actually have multiple employees and it doesn't take 20 minutes to mail a single package.

name: Dee X
text: Went there around 10am. Line wasn't too long so that wasn't bad, but one of the employees was rushed and rude to the customers that were ahead of me.

name: Sharon Worcester
text: Been twice. First time the doors were locked more than 5 min before closing. Second time I made it at 10 min til closing and a man at the counter rudely said I had 3 min and should probably just come back in the morning. There won't be a third time.

name: Wrath
text: Several post office locations nearby. Do not go to this one. You will regret it.

name: Tommy Norton
text: I would rather go to a dog fight than to the USPS.

name: Robert Evans
text: Not very friendly. Act like you need an appointment to get a stamp.

name: Rebekah Eckard
text: Slowest post office ever. 5 customers. 2 employees. 20 minutes.

name: Gary Grimes
text: Typical post office

name: Stephanie Sprouse
text: Friendly service

name: Kat Paay
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. This post office lost my engagement ring. A custom, quite expensive, engagement ring, which I was assured would not only be expedited but also insured. If you are shipping anything of any value, or need something to you in any kind of specific time frame just go ahead and go with UPS and Fedex, at least they don't lose your insured valuables and then tell you they hope they find it but there's no guarantee. I guess at the very least the staff has been apologetic and the mail lady that runs our route is super nice, but beyond that I cannot even fathom the dysfunction and chaos these people must work in.

name: Jenny White
text: I have a P.O. box here and most of the time the workers are okay and helpful, but they can be rude when asked about packages or if something has arrived yet. One experience I had, I asked if a package had been delivered and instead of checking they asked of I had a tracking number (which I didn't) and then I was told I cant pick it up unless there is a slip in the box and refused to check if the package had in fact come. Recently I went there with a tracking number saying my package had arrived earlier that morning and provided them with the number and screen that showed it was delivered. They confirmed it had been dropped off, but they would only tell me that they "hadn't got to it yet" and couldn't give me a definitive answer on when I would be able to pick it up, only "maybe we will get to it this evening" and didnt give me my package. (Which is honestly really inconvenient for people who don't always have enough time to stop by the post office during their operating hours) Hopefully this location can make some changes better their organization skills  and attitude of the workers.

name: Gary Ewing
text: Pretty sure someone up there is stealing my mail. We will get to the bottom of it or there will be a lawsuit. I’m done. Y’all have no respect for the fact that some mail is important and needs to be recieved. Instead y’all take what you want and it never gets delivered but y’all can’t be bothered to even try to find out where it went.

name: CrownedSoV
text: Today I found some of my mail in the mailbox and the rest in the street by the mailbox. I believe the carrier dropped some of the mail as it was being put into my mailbox and didn't bother to get out of the mail truck to put it in the box with the rest of it. The mail that was left in the street could have been lost or stolen; not the first time I've had issues....I filed a complaint via the USPS website.

name: R. Griffin
text: Poorly managed post office station.  Twice already this year (as of 7/20) my mail carrier has informed me that the Troy, AL post office is out of first class (letter) stamps!  How does this happen except for poor management?  In addition, the few times I've been in the facility, the customer service is marginal at best.

name: Meeks Sweets MekaFay
text: Horrible. The lady named Jane is very unprofessional and has a bad attitude. I simply went to pick up packages from there. This ordeal turned into about 20-30 minutes of her telling me they were not there when she didn’t look. FINALLY, she went again and came back with package and a stack of mail she said I did NOT have. Don’t waste your time with her.

name: Serena Z
text: The lady at the front desk helped me contact the driver and retrieved my package that was delivered to the wrong address. Very helpful and professional customer service.

name: anna glover
text: Poorly managed post office station.  Staff is very rude!!

name: Jane Doe
text: I was given two different instructions on how to write addresses on a change of address slip. I got back in line 3 times and saw a different clerk when i’d Get up to the front and was told i’d filled it out incorrectly. She was rude about my hand writing on the form and all around unpleasant. It took me 45 minutes to fill out a change of address form because she’d Send me to the back of the line. When I was 2nd in line for the 3rd time, the clerk told a lady who’d been sent to the back of the line to fix her package slip that she could go in front of me and that she didn’t have to wait in line. I politely mentioned that I wished she’d said something to me about not having to wait again after making minor adjustments to the form and she said, “she forgot”. I’ve seen anything so unprofessional.

name: SarahElizabeth Richards
text: Never had any issues

name: jill strickland
text: Don't even try to get them on the phone!

name: Matthew Brodhead
text: I asked the lady if I could buy a few stamps. Her reply was, "obviously". Horred customer service.

name: Hoàng Nhật Anh
text: Bad Customer Service. I want pick up my package early a day before it delivery. My tracking number show it arrived in post office. I came to pick up my package . They said i can't pick up until they leave a note in my mailbox ? Event i can prove that my package with my id and tracking number.

name: BlueLine Bassing
text: Have no regard for customers packages

name: Alex Weith
text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE customer service

name: Adaria Holland
text: Carrier said my address was invalid . Called post office they said it would be redelivered , next day , no package . After calling for hours I finally got an answer for her to say she will tell the carrier to leave it at the office so I can pick it up. Get there it’s no package. Carrier hasn’t saw the package! They need better customer service and carriers that will deliver packages to your home if it won’t fit in the box ! 😡

name: William White
text: Do you want your package lost or damaged. So you not want to receive tour package at all. Do you enjoy calling for endless hours with no answer. Then this is the post office to use. If I could give a negative 5 star review I would.

name: Aries Diamond
text: My mail was sent here according to my tracking status. When I got there, I was told that my mail was delivered there on April 1st, 2021 but someone was gonna send my mail to my PO Box which is at UPS Store in Opelika. Then I was told that they do not deliver to PO boxes and they claimed they didn't have my mail anymore. This is all just a headache, I need my mail! Those were important papers being sent to me pertaining to my vehicle!

name: hashirama senju
text: I wish there was a negative rating. The customer service is awful.

name: Sylvia Rogers
text: My package was misdelivered and I called to report it.  A very nice lady answered the phone and called me back to report that they would redeliver in one day.  :)

name: Neil Sasser
text: Was told I had to buy a roll of tape to put on a prepaid label. Meanwhile, the young lady behind me was offered tape for her box. I looked at the clerk and looked at the young lady. The clerk said I see you looking but we don’t have tape for you.............wow

name: Jasmine Chang
text: The staff is always nice and helpful! I had to return a mail to sender and they had no problem doing that for me. Keep it up!

name: David Shaw
text: Incredibly personal profession service that I have never received from any PO across the world. Always a pleasure going there. Thank you all  and happy new year for 2020.

name: Austin Davis
text: Awful just awful. Try calling them and have fun talking to a robot for hours.

name: Hunter Smith
text: The number they have to call is only a machine, they sent my package back to the sender because they thought for some reason no one lived in my apartment.

name: Rachel Caswell
text: Terrible customer service and I'm not saying it's completely Opelika's fault but it's definitely a USPS problem. I'm 4 days behind on receiving a package and the tracking info hasn't even been updated. I can't get in contact with any of the 'diligent' employees up there either because no one answers the phone. Would say I'm let down but after years of this kind of service, it's come to be expected.

name: T Potts
text: Very nice facility. Easy access and friendly staff.

name: Julie Gibson
text: I cannot praise the Opelika Post Office high enough.  If there was a 10 star rating they would get all 10 stars.  The folks in the post office are fabulous, courteous and very helpful.  I worked for a company that did not have a mail box on the property, we had only a PO Box.  When folks would send something to the street address it would end up in my PO Box.  How is that for service??  These folks go the second mile.  My mail carriers who have been assigned to our home route are also exceptional people.  They walk the extra steps to put my packages in my carport to protect them from weather and porch pirates. Kudos the the entire staff of the Opelika Post Office.

name: Ms .meka Buck
text: Great staff love them all & Mrs Darcel  very nice  & Flex  keep me laughing  great people this get a 5 star ❤❤❤

name: Claudette Hendrix
text: Close before 5. Just an FYI. Staff ok normally

name: Madelyn Weaver
text: I love everything about The Opelika USPS. Darcel is always happy! And my mail lady never ever seems to have a bad day! Rain or shine she is smiling!!!!!

name: Braxton Hunsberger
text: Mail is never on time or delivered to the wrong house. Sent a package to several post offices around me after it had already gotten to my local office and ended up getting to me 2 days after expected delivery.

name: Rob Still
text: I had a package for delivery today, and realized that I had accidentally set the delivery address for my office instead of my home. No big deal, I'll just wait up at the office and get some work done near the door until they come to deliver my package. I waited 3 hours for my package, and then get a notification that it was undeliverable. They did not attempt to deliver my package.

name: Michelle
text: Lisa at the Opelika post office totally saved my day with my package!!! THANK YOU LISA :)

name: Polly Nix
text: The post office is the best! More fun than Disney world!

name: timmy chance
text: Live in Opelika and there's no regular mail carrier , different ones and runs late every day, thanks for poor service

name: Kayla Fitzgerald
text: Excellent service!  I called with tracking # in advance of live animal delivery and they called me when my chicks arrived. 100% survived. Thanks opelika post office!

name: Steve Salo
text: Always get great service from friendly staff.  I made a mistake of ordering stamps by mail and s week later I have not received them.

name: shauna marshall
text: Never get mail on time. I have caught the mail man sleeping under a tree and I am sick and tired of them not doing there job. Its ridiculous

name: Tonya Banks
text: Always friendly & helpful staff!

name: Harry A
text: Dumb-As-Dirt Sunday USPS carriers won't put mail in my mailbox.

name: Lakeshia Pendleton
text: Ok

name: Blair Winfield
text:
I guess the days of courteous behavior is gone when Sharon is not there and since Sarah has retired.

There are two women in there at the counter who are the most rude and obnoxious people. I don't think it's right for them to behave that way when people.go in there and spend their money to send cards off to loved ones for the holidays. It doesn't matter what day it is or what it's for. They do not have the right to treat people horrible or ruin their day. They need to rethink their attitudes or  go find another job that does not require talking to patrons.

name: Jacob Warden
text:
Hey, I was in there today around 4:30 April 10th. Firstly. I'm sorry if I was out of place with anything I said while I was in there, I wasn't  trying to make the situation worse at all....
Secondly,  your whole staff is incredible.  You are all very nice and kind and helpful. I just hope I didnt make the situation worse with anything I said.  I know you all try your best every day and it shows! Thank you for your kind service to the oneonta community!

name: Heather Reeves
text: Only because one is an option. I mailed a package on the 14th of feburary and it's still siting at the post office at this time. I really dont recommend going here.

name: Lela Dailey
text:
The staff is excellent and knowledgeable.
I've never had any problem with them
and we've had a box there for many, many years.

name: homesteader fifty w/ ricky & martha
text: Thank you ,ladies  for sesrching high and low for our package ..

name: Kate Lucille
text: I had called to check on a package that they are supposed to receive soon and they were very sweet and quick about everything

name: Neil Putman
text: THE PEOPLE IN POST OFFICE  IN ONEONTA AL ARE REAL NICE THAT IS WHAT MAKES  A REAl Great post office friendly faces always good .so good to you  it's like 0 so good BarBQ its so good to see some being good to you.you it makes you to want back and buy their steamps or say Hi How you doing you go to out for a veggie pizza at pizza Hut

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Very helpful staff. Unlike most of the offices I have visited.

name: Chris Mahan
text: Very professional and helpful.

name: Mary Chappell
text: Very helpful and nice.

name: Larry Bush
text: When my wife goes into the store she gets sexually harassed by the man and so do my daughter's. Any man that enters are treated rudely. I've witnessed it before. Plus he's racist regarding Latinos being nasty when they had the laundromat open. They need to find someone else to work there. And he'll close early without notice. I've forbidden my family to patronizing that place.

name: Curtis Ford
text: Cheap gas get in an out quick

name: Austin Beard
text: The woman who was in this office today was extremely helpful. She was all by herself, but was able to help several customers on her own. I'm giving 4 stars because there was a long wait, but this is in no way the fault of the employee at this USPS location. She did the best she could by herself. They need more staff, but otherwise this is a great post office.

name: Steve Sink
text: Let’s be candid — our USPS’s reputation has suffered lately, and I suppose that’s partly deserved. Today I am compelled to leave a glowing commendation about a postal employee at the Trussville PO who was a picture of grace & good cheer under fire. His name is Rico. He was apparently working alone. There was a line when I arrived so I had the opportunity to observe him interact with several customers. He patiently answered questions, in one case a gentleman went on and on about junk mail & coupons & forwarding address — not a hint of frustration from Rico. Another lady left a package on the counter to be mailed. Rico had the presence to ask her to show him the label, which was actually a UPS label, and he gave her directions to the nearest drop-off point. She was visibly relieved by his averting her error. He JOGGED multiple times back & forth to help customers at various stations to attend to them. The electronic payment system was down temporarily — he was not flustered, and gave full dollar change, rounding up in favor of the customer. An older gentleman asked if he needed to wait in line (several people deep at that point) to ask for forms. Again gracious & adroit, Rico provided the forms to him in the same few second time period it would have taken to explain that he needed to stand in line.  Smiling, pleasant throughout, Rico was giving a clinic on customer service! Rico was so impressive I went back to wait in line again to buy stamps, not because I needed them, but in order to ask his name & compliment him for his excellent service.

name: Rita Rubio
text: I always go to purchase stamps or send packages and every time I have had great customer service.  They have very efficient and professional staff to help in the window.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: Great bunch of people

name: ManBirdWatching
text:
I ordered an item from Amazon. Was supposed to arrive on Sunday. I got a message saying the driver attempted delivery but when checking my camera at that time I never saw anyone try to attempt anything around the time given. Then they said it was being held at my request at the Trustville USPS which I never requested. I called USPS waited 5 hours for a call back when it should have taken 1 hour and the person told me he has no idea what this location is doing because the zip code shows the package is there responsibility and NOT the Trustville location. He told me the Moody location should have my package. He gives me the number. I call it. I have a women who interrupts me "Sir, its at the Trustville location and will arrive Tuesday" I told her I was visiting and went home. Why is the package in Trustville. She only repeated it will arrive Tuesday and said you can come in and fillout a change for address (they cant do it over the phone) and I am in FL now. I called Amazon and had the item refunded and have already reordered it. I will never have something shipped through USPS at the Moody location again. Now once the package arrives I am going to have to ask my family member to send it to me in Florida since I went home Monday morning (I was told if I get the item by Amazon I could keep it if I ever get it).

When the guy from USPS is confused and tells me he has no clue what these people at the Moody location are doing and Trustville that sound like a big red flag considering Moody branch should have my package but its in trustville and is arriving 3 days late (He filed a report at the office for me). I even called the Trustville branch 5-6 times with no answers to see if they had my package so I could possibly stop there before I left but no.... nobody answered. The fact they say attempted when they did no such thing plus saying I requested them to hold my package for me to pickup is nuts. I can't even get ahold of them to ask for them to "redeliver" the item. The moody branch lady only told me "It will arrive Tuesday"

USPS for Moody - 1/5
USPS for Trustville - 1/5

name: Steph Brooks
text: Such a bad office.  Very rude. Never enough workers and they never answer the phone.   The post master is never considerate or researches anything.  Horrible service. My packages that I paid Priority mail for, sat in the office for days because THEY put them in the wrong place.  I was scolded for holding my mail when I went out of town.  Truly horrible service and rude

name: wesley hutchins
text:
Been calling for over an hour, says hold for operator then they disconnect the call. No wonder they are going bankrupt! Poor customer service skills!!

Seriously what's the point in even having a phone number for this facility? You all never answer the phone. It has you waiting and then the call drops. Horrible business!!

name: Pretty Princess
text: They have a thief here, and whoever it is needs to be fired quickly. My grandmother never received her 2 Mother’s Day gift! Shame on you to whoever runs this post office.

name: Corey Barron
text: I just arrived a minute before closing. There were 4-5 people in line and the door was already locked. The guy working would not even look up when I knocked. Poor customer service. Now I have to drive to another post office to mail my package. Thankfully, most all other offices are open to at least 2 on Saturday.

name: Mortuary Affairs
text: One of the worst post offices in the northern part of Jefferson Co. Some of the employees are very helpful while the rest aren't very helpful. The "soup" is very knowledgeable of p.o. operations. I've been to this location numerous times but I've never witnessed any of the previous managers/postmasters act in a manner in which he or she seemed to be hasty with the customers or a bigot. Avoid this location at all costs!

name: Brent Parkman
text: Extremely inconsistent on what is allowed for first class tracked mailers. Employees are consistently rude and give off the vibe that they are doing you a favor by handling simple tasks. I hate this is the closest option for me.

name: Jonathan Brobst
text: Absolute worst experience ever with Miss Beth and Miss Tee, who both instructed me to use a readypost envelope when I was searching for a padded envelope in the flat rate section. After unpacking and repacking into a flat rate envelope, they forced me to pay for their mistake and an envelope I didn’t even use. “Sir, I’m not a mind reader” says Miss Beth after asking if she could help while I’m searching the flat rate section for the padded envelope and she instructs me to walk across the store to another section for the readypost envelope. No, no mind reading required ma’am. Just a minimal amount of common sense, and a dash of old fashioned customer service might help. If they offered zero stars, this store would get it.

name: Nicholas Anderson
text: I've been to post offices in slums in Sao Paulo, Brazil that were more efficient and friendlier. Everyone in there is always angry. I dread going in there every time, but it's just the closest one to my house. That's government provided services for you.

name: Zackary Downing
text:
They close about 5 minutes before their listed closing times. I have observed this twice trying to drop off packages at 5:55 pm. This time was according to the time.gov website which is official government time. USPS is part of the government so it should be ran according to government time, not whatever digital or analog clock is sitting on the counter.

If you think you will get there within 5 minutes of closing, do not even bother as they will not let you in.

name: Barbara Abel
text: Pathetic customer service from Clerk 67. He acts like he's doing you a favor to sell you stamps. I hated the stamps on a book of stamps that my daughter went in and purchased. Two days later, my husband took them and my receipt back to exchange the stamps. Clerk 67 refused to exchange them without a payment of $20 extra. WOW! He had the receipt!!!!!

name: Didi Karn
text:
I received a notice in my mailbox that I was not available to sign for a package. My security camera showed there wasn’t an attempt to knock on my door.  Later when I tried to call during business hours, there was no answer.

When I stopped by at closing, the workers were nice enough to allow me to sign for the package and not make me come back the next day.

name: Melissa Anderson
text: Legit the worst post office I've ever been to.  Every single time. I was just in there today and was accused of taking a picture of one of the workers when legit the dude she was training asked me to verify a zip code so I pulled up my pictures to check my screenshot of the address. I even showed her I have no pictures and she still was extremely rude. And another lady who might have been the Post Master, (who didn't witness what this worker did to me) said I didn't need to talk like that but I said of course I'm going to have a defensive tone when I was accused of something I didn't do and am treated like that. All I said was "are you kidding me??" And looked around behind me at the lady there in line who could obviously see what I was doing on my phone and we both just rolled out eyes incredously at them. The lady then moved up to turn my package so she could see my address (she was not the one who was servicing me). So then I did take their pictures since they were so adamant about it (and I was feeling petty at that point lol) and legit was weirded out by her looking at my address. I asked her to turn her name badge over so I could have her name and she wouldn't turn it over. I also mail packages frequently almost always prepaid label print already on the package so literally all they have to do is take the packages. and put them in the back to be sorted and shipped. I've literally done all the work. But they still are so rude and act like it's such an inconvenience to bother them to do their job and take the box of packages. My husband has said the same thing when he's gone for me. Thank goodness other post offices don't act like this but unfortunately this is the closest one to home, not worth it after today anymore though. This is the only Birmingham post office to lose packages at their facility, never to be found again, and I'm legit just waiting to see if these never get mailed out either.

name: bryan clements
text: My package and mail showed it was delivered to my mailbox but was must have been delivered at the wrong address or something. Now I can't get in touch with anyone to find out, and I really needed the part I was waiting on. Wish there was someone there to answer the phone.

name: Mick McMeme
text: I have to deal with several different Post Offices. This one is a pleasure to deal with. Always helpful, always smiling. The Postal Service would be wise to see what is going right here and implement it at other Post Offices (looking at you Pinson, Gardendale, Vestavia Hills).

name: Daniel Conniff
text: Fast and friendly service. Sidney was very polite and efficient.

name: pooja vaidya
text: Horrible service and attitude. Will not explain anything and extremely rude. Avoid this branch.

name: Diane Cole
text: Why doesn't anyone answer the phone? I shouldn't have to drive all the way down there just to ask a question about the mail drop practices!

name: Taylor Dunn
text: Ask if your package is fragile, and if you say yes, they still hurl it over a wall. Really unprofessional.

name: Frog Price
text: It's a post office. Quick service.

name: Terri Goode Parker
text: This is the only one star rating I've ever given on Google +.  Sheesh this post office.  Don't go here!

name: jfrost173
text: Usually a long wait

name: Momma B
text: PLEASE ANSWER YOUR DAMN TELEPHONE!!! I've called million times!!! And nobody is answering!!!!!!!!!!

name: LeudisFit
text: Really bad experience! I ordered some medications I needed for this Friday, I ordered on last Monday it was delivered on Thursday to the wrong address, I went to the post office, they took my number, the delivery man just told me “Maybe one of your neighbors has your package, I think I put it in the wrong mail box” it has been happening a lot lately on my apartments complex because I went to the apartments office to see if my package was delivered there, and they said some neighbors complained about the same experience. I hope they be more carefully about people package.

name: Curt Brewer
text:
***** UPDATE 10/17/2018 *****

I have noticed that many personal items of mail that we receive to our P.O. Box have been ripped as if someone has looked in on it.

Please stop this!!!

It happens to most of the items that look like they may be a "Check" or a "Financial Item."

Please, Gulf Shores Post Office, Please look into this.  It happens a lot in the past year.

------------------
End of new review
------------------

I have read several reviews from this place, and people have rated it low. I've seen the volume they do in this post office, and I'm surprised at how patient they can actually be with the amount of people that come through. The building and the property leave a few things to be desired, but for the most part, everybody here is nice and friendly and they do try to help you to the best of their ability!

name: SE Editor
text: Edward provided excellent customer service. He was fast, friendly and efficient as he weighed and prepared postage for the 45 boxes we were sending across the United States. Keep up the good work Edward and Gulf Shores Postal Service.

name: Cody Cothren
text: Everytime i use the post office here everyone is friendly. As someone who uses the post office a lot I know that the Gulf Shores office is one of the better offices around. They have a high volume of customers and mail. Prices are set by congess. Tax dollars are not used, the post office funds itself. Put yourself in the employees shoes dealing with customers that have messed up addresses or came to complain to them and they had nothing to do with that situation, but they listen and try and help. I know I would be a little frustrated sometimes too. Just a thought. Maybe it will make the experience better if you don't come in blaming everyone and just ask for help instead. Most of the negative comments i have read on here are just people whining because they didn't get exactly what they wanted and chances are they didn't pay to get it either. The post office has premium services for just about everything from special handling to restricted. You just have to be willing to pay for the service or properly wrap the items.

name: connie lopez
text: The post office staff from the Postmaster to those that work at the counter in Gulf Shores are always so helpful and very pleasant.

name: Nancy Pfaff
text: Staff is always helpful and patient 😀

name: Stefanie Stortz
text: A big shout out to Dixie and Roger at thr Gulf Shores location. I had a problem today and they worked fast and fixed it on a Saturday!! Thank you so much!!

name: Thomas Davison
text: Would not recommend this post office, Not vacationer friendly. Will not hand out General delivery mail except on Thursday and Friday between the hours of 2pm till 4pm. Called and talked to Postmaster and he stated that they would rather have you rent a P.O. box instead of using General Delivery. They would rather make the money off of P.O. box instead of the inconvenience of general delivery. Now I understand why the post office is going under. Lack of customer service. I explained to the post master it might be a good idea to post the general delivery rules somewhere so people will know. It sounded like he didn't care. Will be using UPS stores in the future.

name: Niconico nii
text: My favorite post office. Go early. It gets packed quick.

name: Jane Randolph
text: Suzanne was so helpful even though it was my error on packages that were addressed incorrectly. Thank you Gulf Shores Post Office.

name: Sean Nichol
text: Every single time my wife or I come in there which is often since we buy and sell a lot on eBay. These people are always so rude and act very inconvenienced. They charge me twice what UPS does for a simple padded envelope. I will no longer be using this post office ever again.

name: Sofia Rivera
text: Doesn't matter what the package is labeled with, my lights always come broken. I can't get these reptile bulbs local so I have to order online, only they are usually damaged in shipping even with big labels saying "GLASS BE CAREFUL". Now I have to find someone to drive to since I've been waiting for reshipments of the same product, only to arrive once again broken. Very displeased and will avoid from now on.

name: Sondra Kilgo
text: Fast and Super Friendly 😊

name: Angela Wingard
text: Susan is the rudest person o have ever delt with...she was unwilling to help anyway and to top it off was talking to me like i was stupid. Very obvious she did not want to help me..bad experience

name: Irina Gusak
text: The Best staff!!!

name: David
text: Slow

name: William Frost
text: Very friendly

name: Geoff HockeyDad
text: Friendly and helpful staff, full service P.O.

name: Richard Kiefl
text: Love the post office

name: Mister Haznoskilz
text: Just your regular post office.

name: Adventures with Maverick
text: Can't get an answer

name: DJ Jenks
text: Its a Post Office, Yaaaaay!
